Title: Data Analyst Working Student
Description:
Lovehoney Group is the world‚Äôs leading sexual wellbeing company. We offer exciting brands with innovative, high-quality sex toys, lingerie, and accessories in a smooth online shopping experience.

Lovehoney employs over 900 awesome, diverse & driven people throughout our 9 offices across the globe, celebrating a broad spectrum of talents in engineering, industrial design, sales, and marketing.

We are proud to be a company that thrives by doing things differently, challenging expectations and stereotypes while making a positive impact on our customers‚Äô lives.

We are currently recruiting a Working Student Data Analyst who will be integral to driving high-level performance across Lovehoney Group. Your focus will be on leveraging our technology stack to derive insights and support various teams within the business.

What You Will Do


Utilize tools like Google Analytics, Big Query, Airflow, Tableau, and Superset to analyse data from our group data warehouse
Collaborate with finance, marketing, and product teams to produce reporting capabilities and insights
Develop visualizations and storytelling to communicate complex data analysis in an understandable manner
Understand and apply core e-commerce KPIs in your analysis
Utilize your analytical and problem-solving skills to identify trends and insights



What You Should Bring


Currently enrolled in a degree in business, mathematics, science, or engineering
Experience in writing and reviewing SQL queries
Proficiency in building visualizations and data storytelling
Understanding of core e-commerce KPIs
Strong analytical, problem-solving, and communication skills



What We Can Offer You


A welcoming workplace full of drinks, snacks, and friendly faces, as well as a range of benefits that make working with us an unforgettable experience.
Fun team-building events, including dinners, barbecues, and games, that bring our team together and foster a sense of community
Discount Shopping Portal: Access to unique discounts at high street retailers, hotels, and service providers through Perks at Work.
A hybrid work model that allows for flexibility and work-life balance, with three days a week in-office
25 holiday days a year, plus an extra day for every year you are with Lovehoney, giving you plenty of time to rest, recharge, and explore



Lovehoney Group is an equal opportunities employer. We promise that every qualified person will be evaluated according to skills regardless of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage and civil partnership, pregnancy and maternity, race, religion or belief, sex, or sexual orientation.

If you require accommodations during the interview process due to a disability, please inform your Talent Acquisition Specialist so that we can ensure a smooth and inclusive experience for all candidates.

At Lovehoney Group, we leverage artificial intelligence as part of our screening interview process, for note-taking purposes. Rest assured, we prioritize transparency and respect candidates' preferences. You'll have the option to opt out while still receiving fair consideration for the role.

We currently have a hybrid work model supporting a blend of in-office and remote work (3 days per week in-office)

If we sparked your interest and you are open to embarking on your professional path with us, please visit our Lovehoney careers page to apply: https://jobs.eu.lever.co/lovehoneygroup

Our privacy policy is available here: https://www.lovehoneygroup.com/privacy-policy/

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Are you a skilled Python and SQL user with a strong analytical background? Are you passionate about uncovering insights within data and applying them to real-world financial challenges? Then you might just be the Data Analyst we're looking for!

Your Primary Responsibilities Will Be


Manage the end-to-end process of data-driven knowledge gathering (connect, mine, simulate, predict, illustrate, and deploy)
Create data-based solutions to address complex business challenges


What We're Looking For


Solid analytical skills (you're a natural problem solver)
Proficiency in Python and SQL (you can write advanced queries with ease)
Focus on quality (you strive for excellence in everything you do)
Strong communication skills (you can explain complex ideas in simple terms)


It Would Be Great If You Also Have


Knowledge of financial markets (options, futures, etc.)
Familiarity with financial products


If it seems like a match, don't wait! Apply now and show us what you've got üî•

What we offer;

At LYNX, we value your growth and development; we'll provide you with a supportive work environment and opportunities for your professional development.


Competitive Salary, depending on your educational level and work experience;
Pension scheme that is fully paid by LYNX;
Free lunch from our cook or lunch ticket, fresh juices & fruit;
Travel allowance;
Continuous growth potential and a training budget of ‚Ç¨ 2,000 per year;
Trips & activities with your colleagues;
Relaxed and informal working environment.


About Us

"LYNX helps you invest in yourself"

"Working at LYNX means joining the LYNX family"

"The development opportunities make LYNX the best place to work"

This is what the employees say about LYNX and it is exactly what we want to offer: a work environment where you can get the best out of yourself. At our office in the heart of Amsterdam, Ghent, Berlin and Prague, we work every day to offer both private and professional clients the best trading opportunities, with a fast, user-friendly and reliable trading platform.

The Best Choice For Anyone Who Takes Investing Seriously

LYNX is an international FinTech that offers you a relaxed and informal work environment, where you can get the best out of yourself and where 300 people contribute together to the success of our customers since 2006.

In 2006 LYNX entered the investor market with two spearheads: very low rates and an extensive product range. This makes the online broker not only successful in the Netherlands, but also abroad. After opening offices in Belgium, Germany and the Czech Republic, LYNX now offers its services in ten different countries, making it a European broker of size.

In 2019 the product of LYNX, and therefore the offer for investors, has been greatly improved. For example, a highly advanced mobile and tablet app is available, the LYNX Masterclass webinars can be watched weekly via the Knowledge Portal, and thanks to the Morning Call, investors are quickly daily informed about the latest news on the financial markets.

Title: Data Analyst (m/f/d)
Description:
THIS IS US

At Oetker Digital, we partner with the Oetker Group companies to define what digital business transformation means and to create business value and impact based on data, technology and talents, so that they can unlock their digital future. We support many beloved brands such as Dr. Oetker, Radeberger and Coppenrath & Wiese.

With our team of about 100 talented individuals from diverse backgrounds, based in our Berlin headquarters, we foster an open, positive learning culture, driven by our shared values and the spirit of a family-run company.







THE ROLE

We are looking for a talented Data Analyst to join our innovative and international Data & Insights team. By understanding the data needs of our stakeholders, you'll provide valuable insights and clear recommendations to support our data-driven decision-making process.







WHAT YOU'LL DO

Dive into complex marketing data sets to uncover trends and insights that drive key business decisions. Your work will have a direct impact on the strategy and growth of our group companies
Collaborate with a forward-thinking team that embraces the latest technologies and methodologies. We believe in continuous learning and innovation
Partner closely with team members and external business stakeholders to understand their data needs and objectives
Act as a consultant, using probing questions to gain deep insights into the business domain and processes
Communicate insights in a compelling and accessible manner to support data-driven decision-making







WHAT YOU'LL BRING

At least 3 years of experience in data analysis or data consulting, preferably within a business context, preferably in Consulting
A Bachelor‚Äôs or Master‚Äôs degree in a related field (e.g., Economics, Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science)
Proficient in SQL and/or Python for data analysis and modeling
Experiences with Marketing Data and Analytics, as well as Retail Media and Customer Analytics would be a big plus
Familiarity with Cloud platforms for data storage and processing, having worked with BigQuery is a plus
Strong abilities in generating reports using data visualization tools such as Power BI or Tableau
A proactive and collaborative mindset, with the ability to work effectively in cross-functional teams
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to communicate complex ideas clearly
A passion for learning, hands-on work, taking ownership, and making an impact
Fluent in German and English







WHAT WE OFFER

Modern and dog friendly office located at the heart of Berlin
Hybrid working model with flexible working hours for a healthy work-life balance
We work in cross-functional and international teams and have regular company/team events
28 days of paid vacation, plus Christmas and New Year‚Äôs Eve off, as well as the possibility to take a sabbatical or additional unpaid leave
10 paid child‚Äôs sick days per year
Annual learning and development budget purchase educational resources up to ‚Ç¨1.500
Equipment of your choice: Macbook or Lenovo, plus additional devices for your home office set up
In house conversational German classes for beginners
Subsidized Urban Sports Club Membership or BVG Deutschland Ticket
Mental well-being support, including individual sessions, through our partner Likeminded
Company pension scheme and personal accident insurance
Corporate discounts from a wide range of external partners










Diversity and Inclusion

At Oetker Digital, we believe that diversity, equity and inclusion are crucial elements of a respectful and inspiring workplace. We value the unique experiences that each individual brings to our team, and we are committed to creating a culture where everyone feels valued. We are an equal opportunity employer and welcome applications from candidates of all walks of life, backgrounds, identities, and experiences. Even if you don't meet all the requirements above, we actively encourage you to apply. We're eager to learn about the perspective you can bring to our team!

Title: People Data Analyst
Description:
Brief info about Vinted

Vinted Marketplace is the largest online international C2C marketplace in Europe dedicated to second-hand fashion, with millions of registered members spanning 22 markets in Europe and North America. With a mission to make second-hand the first choice worldwide, Vinted enables people to sell and buy second-hand clothes and lifestyle items from each other, helping give those items a second or even third life.

Vinted Go launched in 2022, with a focus on developing products and solutions for more seamless shipping and delivery across Europe. Vinted Go has connected more than 40 carriers and more than 200,000 PUDO points across Europe to support the delivery of millions of parcels per year.

The Vinted Group, composed of Vinted Marketplace and Vinted Go, is headquartered in Vilnius, with workplaces in Germany, Lithuania, France, the United Kingdom, the Netherlands and over 2,000 employees. It is backed by six leading venture capital firms: Accel, Burda Principal Investments, EQT Growth, Insight Partners, Lightspeed Venture Partners, and Sprints Capital.

Information about the position

We are looking for a People Data Analyst to join our People Analytics Team. As Vinted grows with new products, locations and increasing complexity there is a need to further support decision making in the company with people data.

Your primary focus will be on analyzing and interpreting data across the employee lifecycle providing a holistic view from candidacy to alumni. You will work closely with a Senior Analyst, have an opportunity to build People analytics products from scratch and shape the People Analytics function at Vinted. We‚Äôre looking for a candidate that has knowledge of analysis tools and the ability to communicate well with a variety of stakeholders.

Reporting to a Senior Director in the People team you will work within a team whose mandate is to accelerate people analytics at Vinted. You will work with data across various People systems like Workday, Greenhouse, Peakon and others.

In this position, you‚Äôll


Contribute to building People Analytics products and expansion of data-based culture
Maintain and build dashboards and perform analysis on data spanning across the complete Employee Life Cycle (‚ÄúFrom Hire to Retire‚Äù)
Assist stakeholders in identifying trends and patterns within People data to provide valuable insights
Contribute to cross-functional projects and initiatives in People team


About You


BSc or MSc in Mathematics, Computer Science, Economics, Statistics, or another related field
At least 2 years of experience in a similar role, specializing in data analysis and storytelling
Experience with data visualization tools, preferably Looker but Tableau and Power Bi are applicable too
You are a Google Sheets master
Strong communication skills with proficiency in English
Knowledge of HR domain or a strong interest in developing skills in HR analytics


Nice-to-have:


Knowledge of SQL
Familiarity with Workday
Knowledge of a statistical programming language (R, Python, Matlab etc.)


Work perks


30 days of paid annual leave
Newest MacBook models
Mental and emotional health support through the Mindletic app
Home office support: we provide IT workstation equipment and a personal budget of up to ‚Ç¨540 for home workplace furniture
A daily lunch allowance
Frequent team-building events
A personal monthly budget for shopping on Vinted
A subsidised gym membership with ClassPass or Urban Sports Card
A subsidised pension plan provided by Vinted
Hallesche Supplemental health insurance
Life and disability insurance provided
A subsidised Deutschlandticket
The opportunity to spend up to 90 days per year - 21 of which can be spent working outside of the EU - on workation
A dog-friendly office


Working at Vinted

Individual Learning Budget

Vinted will set aside a yearly sum equal to 10-13.2% of your annual salary to be invested in your continuous professional development. You‚Äôll be able to take the initiative to use it for covering relevant learning activities that benefit your role.

Hybrid Work

We‚Äôve adopted a hybrid workplace model where 2 days in the office are recommended but not enforced. It‚Äôs up to you and your team to decide on the exact days you‚Äôll spend working together in person.

Equal Opportunity

The Vinted Group is committed to building an inclusive workplace where people from all walks of life feel a sense of belonging. We welcome applications from people of all backgrounds, identities and life experiences. At Vinted, all applicants are treated fairly without regard to their race, age, religion or belief, sex, national origin, citizenship, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, or any other protected characteristic.

The salary range for this position is ‚Ç¨ 51,900 - ‚Ç¨ 70,200 gross per year.

Title: Data Analyst (Freelance)
Description:
The Client

Our client is a digital hub company, founded by two of the largest companies in financial services and consultancy, with the goal of enabling innovation.

The result was a unique space where international corporates sit side-by-side and work together with cutting-edge startupsThe RoleFor one of their founding companies, they need a data analyst to be able to support on various fintech projects.

Data Analysis
Data visualisation

What they need

You are an experienced data analyst with 3+ years of experience
You have worked in banking or Fintech companies

Title: Data Analyst (m/f/x)
Description:
Carhartt WIP is part of the WIP Trading AG. Our family-owned business group started as a licensee and European distributor of the US workwear manufacturer Carhartt in the early 1990s. Since then, it develops its own collections based on workwear originals.




Carhartt Work In Progress aims to continuously progress and evolve, without ever losing sight of its origins. Over the course of the past two decades, our business has developed organically, along with its customers, the culture that surrounds the brand, and its employees who have helped shape what Carhartt WIP is today.




Your Responsibilities:

Management of and participation in Ecom&ERP projects in the BI environment
Implementation of change requests from the Ecom/CRM Team in the BI environment
Close cooperation with external service providers and partners
Ensuring operation & support for the BI systems of the Carhartt WIP Ecom&APP
Technical contact for the BI architecture in the ERP/Ecom environment




Your Profile:

Very good technical understanding of ERP, Commercetools and DWH architecture
At least 5 years of professional experience in a comparable function
Experience in working with Power BI is a plus
Entrepreneurial mindset and high customer orientation
Hands on and agile Mindset
Very good process understanding in the ecom&retail landscape
Very good technological understanding in the reporting area
Good analytical and logical thinking skills
Very good communication skills




Your Benefits:

Be part of the progress - find your place in our unique WIP culture
As part of the WIP crew you have the opportunity to connect at our events or just have fun
Your closet benefits from our staff discounts
Your future, our upgrade - we subsidise your company pension scheme by 100%
Your well-being is important to us - we contribute to this with free beverages




Your Location:

Berlin (Kreuzberg) / Germany

Show more

  • As part of the WIP crew you have the opportunity to connect at our events or just have fun
  • Your closet benefits from our staff discounts
  • Your future, our upgrade - we subsidise your company pension scheme by 100%
  • Your well-being is important to us - we contribute to this with free beverages


Your Location:

Berlin (Kreuzberg) / Germany

Title: Data Analyst Lending - FinTech (all genders)
Description:
About The Opportunity

Be our next Hero! - Join the world‚Äôs leading local delivery platform.

We are looking for a Data Analyst Lending to join the Fintech Data Team on our journey to always deliver amazing experiences.

Our team creates innovative lending products across multiple markets, catering to the diverse needs of consumers, vendors, and riders on our platform. We design solutions that enhance our customers' experiences, ensuring that our lending portfolio provides value and support.

If you're a creative problem solver who is hungry for a new adventure, an international workplace is waiting for you in the heart of Berlin!

Your mission:


Work in a highly effective team responsible for the processing of financial transactions amounting to billions of euros
Partner closely with Fintech Business and Product stakeholders to understand their analytical needs, set the roadmap for analytics work of various products offer lending solutions to our consumers, vendors, and riders
Collaborate with the Data Science team to optimize the performance of our lending portfolios
Explore and analyze high volumes of data in order to quantify and answer questions to improve business performance. Monitor KPIs, identify user behavior patterns, and actively take actions to improve lending portfolio performance across multiple regions
Collaborate with the central teams in Berlin as well as with the regional and local teams to run A/B tests, and experiments, and drive best credit management practices across the globe
Proactively bring new ideas and suggestions to the team and our internal clients to improve our Fintech setup


What you need to be successful

Your heroic skills:


Relevant work experience in Analytics, Business Intelligence or comparable functions within organizations focused on credit
Proficiency with SQL
Experience with data visualization tools (e.g. Tableau and Looker) to build intuitive and insightful data stories.
Familiarity with mathematical and statistical data analysis techniques (such as regression, extrapolation, time series analysis, forecasting, statistical hypothesis testing and econometric models)
Strong analytical skills with the ability to implement business strategy to data analysis and make recommendations to product and business stakeholders
Good and versatile communication and presentation skills (technical vs business vs layman vs C-level)


Nice to have:


Credit analytics experience, familiarity with BNPL and/or Credit Scoring
Experience with big data tools (e.g. BigQuery, Spark, dbt)
Proficiency with Python


Who we are

As the world‚Äôs pioneering local delivery platform, our mission is to deliver an amazing experience, fast, easy, and to your door. We operate in over 70+ countries worldwide, powered by tech, designed by people. As one of Europe‚Äôs largest tech platforms, we enable creative minds to deliver solutions that create impact within our ecosystem. We move fast, take action and adapt. No matter where you're from or what you believe in, we build, we deliver, we lead. We are Delivery Hero

What's in it for you

Ensuring you and all our Heroes are looked after, happy, and healthy is always on the menu. Because if you‚Äôre in good shape, then we‚Äôre in good shape.


Make the most of our hybrid working model and join the team for face-to-face connection and collaboration in our beautiful Berlin campus 2 days a week
We offer 27 days holiday with an extra day on 2nd and 3rd year of service
Ensuring you and all our Heroes are looked after, happy, and healthy is always on the menu. Because if you‚Äôre in good shape, then we‚Äôre in good shape
Get moving and release those wonderful, mind-boosting endorphins: Health Checkups, Meditation, Yoga, Gym & Bicycle Subsidy
Cash. Dough. Cheddar. Whatever you call it, we‚Äôll help you with it: Employee Share Purchase Plan, Sabbatical Bank, Public Transportation Ticket Discount, Life & Accident Insurance, Corporate Pension Plan
Look up and go for it. We will support you in developing yourself and your career: 1.000 ‚Ç¨ Educational Budget, Language Courses, Parental Support
The power of getting together over some food is unrivaled. Here are a few ways to help you do that. All the yum: Digital Meal Vouchers, Food Vouchers, Corporate Discounts


At Delivery Hero, we believe diversity and inclusion are key to creating not only an exciting product, but also an amazing customer and employee experience. Fostering this starts with hiring -- therefore we do not discriminate on the basis of racial identities, religious beliefs, color, national origin, gender identities or expressions, sexual orientations, age, marital or disability statuses, or any other aspect that makes you, you. Just be yourself and we can‚Äôt wait to see what value you bring to the role. We're as interested in your character as we are in your talent.

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Senior Data Analyst - Python / SQL / Clean Energy / Hydrogen / Data Engineer




Interested in using your Data Analysis / Engineering background to help tackle some of the biggest challenges in the Clean Technology market?




You'll join a team that are a market leader in the production and storage of Green Hydrogen, who have recently started looking for a Senior Energy Data Analyst to join their team in Berlin (Hybrid / Remote available).




The role:




As a key member of the team's Data group you'll enjoy a lot of responsibility, and will take a lead role in designing the structure of the existing database, analyse weather and market price data, and act as the interface between the electricity market, RES generation, and in-house Hydrogen production teams.




What's on offer?




A very competitive compensation package.




The chance to enjoy a lot of responsibility as part of a small team of experts
A hands-on engineering role with one of the best funded Clean Technology teams in the industry




Ideally you'll have a combination of:




Python
SQL

Title: Data Analyst (Intern/Working Student)
Description:
As a Data Analyst (Intern/Working Student) at Blacklane, you will collaborate with our customer care and chauffeur care teams to drive data-driven decision-making and support the continuous improvement of our operations and services. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in SQL, data modeling, and data analysis, with a passion for deriving actionable insights from complex datasets.

*Please note this role is a full-time position if taken as an internship. Working students are expected to be available 20 hours per week during term time and 40 hours outside of term time.*

YOUR CHALLENGE:


Independently analyze complex datasets to uncover trends, patterns, and actionable insights, framing problems correctly, cleaning, and interpreting data sets.
Structure complex analytical CTEs in modeling pipelines using advanced SQL techniques, including window functions.
Apply analytical methods confidently to generate insights on specific issues or domain problems.
Manage the delivery of technical stories by collaborating with other teams and stakeholders, supporting data literacy initiatives.
Communicate findings clearly and concisely to both technical and non-technical stakeholders, creating understandable summaries of reports.
Influence stakeholders by working on dashboards with company/department-wide impact, ensuring stakeholder engagement for realizing value.


ABOUT YOU:


Studying preferably in the fields: Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, or a related field.
Gathered first practical experience working on data projects
Experience in SQL for advanced data modelling and analytics
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to interpret complex data sets and propose relevant metrics.
Passion for customer-centric work and problem solving


MORE THAN A JOB:

We are Blacklane, providers of premium global chauffeur services. Our mission is to create true peace of mind for discerning travellers by delivering perfect experiences around the world and to inspire a better future. Blacklane is offering airport transfers, City-to-City commutes, In-city mobility chauffeur hailing and Chauffeur-by-the-hour in over 50 countries globally, either pre-booked or on-demand. Whether it's for business or pleasure, Blacklane and its 300 employees and tens of thousands of chauffeur partners have the right premium transportation service for you. By changing how people move, we opened up new opportunities for our chauffeur providers and set industry standards for climate protection in the travel industry.

Working at Blacklane: We prioritize fostering a strong company culture that promotes collaboration, innovation, and meaningful connections among our employees. Our offices in Berlin and Dubai serve as a central hub where employees come together to collaborate, build relationships, and participate in cultural events that reinforce our shared values. For our employees outside these geographies we promote having a hub life where our employees come together in their specific locations as we believe this plays a crucial role in supporting employee well-being, facilitating career development opportunities such as shadowing and mentorship programs, and nurturing a sense of belonging within our team. We are committed to creating a workplace where every individual feels valued, supported, and empowered to contribute their best work. Through our dedication to cultivating a strong company culture, we aim to drive engagement, productivity, and success across the organization and also offer the following:


Continuous Learning: We believe that open and actionable feedback is the essential component of continuous development. Set your personal development plan and take an active role in our internal learning communities to progress your career.
Flexible Working: Even the most ambitious Blacklaner needs some time to unwind. Find out what works for you and your team with flexible working hours and home office days.
Become Part of the Crew: Get to know your fellow Blacklaners through our regular team socials. Our success comes from a collaboration of more than 350 people from 70 nations and we are looking for more exceptional people to join us!
Employee Stock Options Plan: We want all Blacklaners to benefit from the company's success, so every employee gets virtual stock options.
Fair Remuneration: We've banded salary levels and matched them to the local costs of living, meaning you're always paid fairly and you know that the rest of the crew is too.
Sustainability: We care for both people and the planet, having launched the mobility's industry-first global carbon offset scheme in 2017. Blacklane plans to deliver 35% of global rides in EVs by year-end 2024, and 50% by the end of year 2025.
Equal Opportunity: We are committed to inclusion and diversity. A company is only as strong as its crew, so we developed a work environment that is inclusive, inspiring and open. All qualified applicants receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status.
Blacklane Cares day: Every crew member receives 8 hours of paid leave per year to participate in volunteering initiatives of their choice or lead employee-driven community outreach projects. Utilize your time to lend hands to a cause that drives your passion.


Upgrade your career with Blacklane
Show more

Description:
Immer in Bewegung, spontan und einfach anders: Berlin ist eine lebendige Stadt voller junger Menschen und die Berliner Sparkasse seit mehr als 200 Jahren mitten drin. Profil

Du bringst Erfahrung in der Datenanalyse mit und bist versiert im Umgang mit gro√üen Datens√§tzen.
Du hast fundierte IT-Kenntnisse und praktische Erfahrung mit Business Intelligence-Tools und -Anwendungen.
Du verf√ºgst √ºber fundiertes Wissen im Bankwesen und verstehst die relevanten Prozesse und Produkte.
Du besitzt ein ausgepr√§gtes analytisches Denkverm√∂gen und arbeitest strukturiert und methodisch.
Du zeichnest dich durch hervorragende Probleml√∂sungsf√§higkeiten aus und setzt den Kunden stets in den Mittelpunkt deines Handelns.
Du bist ein echter Teamplayer, leistungsorientiert und √ºbernimmst gerne Verantwortung.


Wir bieten

Ein spannender, abwechslungsreicher Job mit zahlreichen Entwicklungs- und Aufstiegsm√∂glichkeiten, in einem wirtschaftlich stabilen Umfeld, in dem Arbeiten Spa√ü macht.


Flexible Arbeitszeiten & Mobiles Arbeiten f√ºr eine ausgezeichnete Work-Life-Balance sowie zus√§tzliche freie Tage (24.12. und 31.12.) - auch in Teilzeit.
Eine attraktive Verg√ºtung ‚Äì 13. Gehalt, Verm√∂genswirksame Leistungen und weitere Sozialleistungen.
Standortgarantie Berlin mit optimaler Verkehrsanbindung.
Ein kostenloses Girokonto und weitere Produkte mit Verg√ºnstigungen sowie Mitarbeiterangebote von starken Partnern.
Weitere Benefits: Betriebliche Altersversorgung, Work-Life-Service des F√ºrstenberg Instituts, Eltern-Kind-B√ºro, vielf√§ltige Kunst-, Kultur- und Sportangebote sowie Essenszusch√ºsse.


Important note

Please be advised that a valid work permit for Germany is required for non-EU citizens. Unfortunately, applications without a valid work permit and sufficient German language skills may not be considered.

HTML:
Immer in Bewegung, spontan und einfach anders: Berlin ist eine lebendige Stadt voller junger Menschen und die Berliner Sparkasse seit mehr als 200 Jahren mitten drin. Wir sind der gr√∂√üte Finanzdienstleister in Berlin, eine Arbeitgeberin, die in der Region aktiv ist und Gutes tut ‚Äì an dem Ort, wo du lebst und arbeitest. Hier triffst du st√§ndig auf neue Leute, neue Themen, neue Herausforderungen. Ob im Gesch√§ft mit Privat- und Firmenkunden/innen oder in der Immobilienfinanzierung sowie in den verschiedenen Bereichen der Berliner Sparkasse ‚Äì hier bei uns kannst du deine Talente zeigen. Hier ist dein Job. So vielf√§ltig wie du.

Aufgaben

In unserem Bereich Kunden- und Produktmanagement dreht sich alles um die Gestaltung innovativer Produkte und die Optimierung der Customer Journey. Dabei stehen die Bed√ºrfnisse unserer Kunden im Mittelpunkt. Wir setzen auf agile Methoden, um flexibel und effektiv zu arbeiten.

Der Fokus Deiner Zuk√ºnftigen T√§tigkeit

  • Du identifizierst und entwickelst anhand von Daten zielgerichtete Kommunikationsanl√§sse und stellst relevante Informationen zu unseren Kunden und Produkten bereit
  • Du entwickelst kreative Impulse f√ºr das Produktmanagement und unterst√ºtzt durch datengetriebene Insights die Marktforschung und das Vertriebscontrolling.
  • Du erstellst schnelle und pr√§zise Ad-hoc-Analysen, um operative Fragestellungen zu kl√§ren und fundierte Entscheidungen zu erm√∂glichen.
  • Du arbeitest aktiv in interdisziplin√§ren Projekten mit und tr√§gst dazu bei, unsere Prozesse und Angebote kontinuierlich zu verbessern.

Profil

  • Du hast ein abgeschlossenes Studium in (Wirtschafts-) Informatik, Wirtschaftswissenschaften oder einem vergleichbaren Bereich mit starkem Fokus auf quantitative Methoden.
  • Du bringst Erfahrung in der Datenanalyse mit und bist versiert im Umgang mit gro√üen Datens√§tzen.
  • Du hast fundierte IT-Kenntnisse und praktische Erfahrung mit Business Intelligence-Tools und -Anwendungen.
  • Du verf√ºgst √ºber fundiertes Wissen im Bankwesen und verstehst die relevanten Prozesse und Produkte.
  • Du besitzt ein ausgepr√§gtes analytisches Denkverm√∂gen und arbeitest strukturiert und methodisch.
  • Du zeichnest dich durch hervorragende Probleml√∂sungsf√§higkeiten aus und setzt den Kunden stets in den Mittelpunkt deines Handelns.
  • Du bist ein echter Teamplayer, leistungsorientiert und √ºbernimmst gerne Verantwortung.

Wir bieten

Ein spannender, abwechslungsreicher Job mit zahlreichen Entwicklungs- und Aufstiegsm√∂glichkeiten, in einem wirtschaftlich stabilen Umfeld, in dem Arbeiten Spa√ü macht.

  • Flexible Arbeitszeiten & Mobiles Arbeiten f√ºr eine ausgezeichnete Work-Life-Balance sowie zus√§tzliche freie Tage (24.12. und 31.12.) - auch in Teilzeit.
  • Eine attraktive Verg√ºtung ‚Äì 13. Gehalt, Verm√∂genswirksame Leistungen und weitere Sozialleistungen.
  • Standortgarantie Berlin mit optimaler Verkehrsanbindung.
  • Ein kostenloses Girokonto und weitere Produkte mit Verg√ºnstigungen sowie Mitarbeiterangebote von starken Partnern.
  • Weitere Benefits: Betriebliche Altersversorgung, Work-Life-Service des F√ºrstenberg Instituts, Eltern-Kind-B√ºro, vielf√§ltige Kunst-, Kultur- und Sportangebote sowie Essenszusch√ºsse.

Title: Senior Data Analyst - GTM (Remote Europe)
Description:
n8n is a low-code platform for workflow automation and AI app integration, designed for technical users. It simplifies connecting to any app or API and enables the incorporation of AI into business processes. n8n is Source Code Available and has a passionate and engaged community of builders!

We were founded end of 2019 and currently:

üßë‚Äçü§ù‚Äçüßë We're a diverse team of 60 talented people

üöÄ Our annual recurring revenue is growing 5x year-over-year

‚≠êÔ∏è With +44k GitHub stars, we are in the top 0.0001% most popular projects on Github

üå± We now count a total of $20m in funding: we were Sequoia's first seed investment in Germany, and most recently secured a Series A extension (February 2024)

MISSIONS

üéØ Your main goal will be to unlock insights that drive revenue growth and optimize sales & marketing efficiency at n8n.

To achieve this, you will:

1- Empower Marketing with actionable data insights

üîç Transform complex marketing data into accessible insights by optimizing our BigQuery setup and integrating with tools like Metabase

üìä Analyze campaign performance, demographic trends, and product telemetry to help the marketing team focus on high-impact areas

üîó Centralize and link additional data sources such as HockeyStack, Reo.dev, and Scarf to deepen our understanding of user behavior

2- Support RevOps and Sales with strategic analytics

üìà Build and maintain dashboards that provide real-time visibility into sales performance and marketing ROI

üõ†Ô∏è Run ad-hoc analyses to support sales strategies and inform RevOps decision-making

üß© Develop attribution models to map out customer journeys and identify key conversion points

3- Optimize SEO and content strategies with data science

üîó Leverage data science techniques to analyze node usage, SEO performance, and keyword strategies for maximum impact

üß† Provide actionable recommendations to enhance our online presence and content marketing efforts

üöÄ Explore new avenues for personalizing SEO strategies based on user interaction data

4- Proactively identify opportunities for growth

üå± Continuously explore new data sources and methodologies to unlock further growth opportunities

üß© Collaborate closely with cross-functional teams to ensure data-driven decision-making across the organization

üí° Be a proactive voice at the table, driving conversations on how data can further our ambitious goals

5- Drive data-driven decision making across GTM

üéØ Lead efforts to ensure data-driven decision-making becomes a core part of our GTM culture, empowering team members with the insights they need.

üìö Maintain and expand our GTM data documentation, ensuring consistency and accessibility for current and future team members.

üõ†Ô∏è Set up and manage the necessary tools, systems, and processes that streamline data access and analysis for GTM teams.

Requirements

Must-have

üõ†Ô∏è 5+ years of relevant experience: You have a proven track record in data analytics, data science, or business intelligence, particularly in a marketing context.

üíª Advanced SQL proficiency: You are skilled in complex queries, including aggregations, joins, and filters, and can make data accessible to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.

üåê Expertise with Google Analytics, Tag Manager, and BigQuery: You can handle data sources, manage transformations, and deliver actionable insights from complex datasets.

üìä Experience with revenue/sales CRM systems (especially Salesforce): You understand how to integrate CRM data with marketing analytics to drive sales and revenue growth.

üéØ Focus on business impact: You have a strong ability to translate data into strategic recommendations that directly contribute to revenue growth and operational efficiency.

‚öôÔ∏è Pragmatic problem-solving skills: You are known for your bias for action and your ability to tackle complex challenges with practical solutions.

üîç Proactive and curious mindset: You continuously seek out opportunities for analysis, always asking 'why' to uncover deeper insights.

üìà Experience in early-stage data teams: You've successfully set up tools, systems, and processes in a fast-paced, growing environment.

Nice-to-have

üîó SEO and content marketing experience: You've worked with SEO datasets/tools and have a solid understanding of how to integrate these insights into broader marketing strategies.

üìä Data science/BI experience: You bring additional expertise in data science methodologies or business intelligence platforms, enhancing your ability to deliver sophisticated analyses.

n8n is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

We can sponsor visas to Germany; for any other country, you need to have existing right to work.


Our company language is English


You care about diversity and inclusion? We do too! Check out our Diversity, Inclusion and Belonging initiatives at n8n.*

Benefits

üí∏ Competitive compensation

üí™ Ownership: Our core value is to "empower others", and we give you a slice of n8n in the form of equity.

üèñÔ∏è Work/life balance: We work hard, but make sure everyone can properly recharge their batteries with 30 days holiday, plus public holidays wherever you are.

üìà Career growth: We are looking to hire 'rising stars', who can grow with the company into more senior roles. We give you ‚Ç¨1k a year to spend on courses, books, events and coaching, to support you in developing your career.

ü§© A passionate team: We love our product, and we have regular office hackathons to see who can build the coolest thing with it!

üåè Remote-first: Our team works remote from anywhere within Europe but we have regular off-sites to help build team bonds and alignment.

üôè Transparency: We all know what everyone's working on, how's the company doing ‚Äî the whole shebang.

ü§ù Giving back: We're big fans of open source, and you'll get $100 per month to support projects you care about.

üòç Ambitious but kind culture where people love to work - our eNPS for 2023 is 100!

Disclaimer: If you see the same job posting in different locations, it's because we're hiring remotely and are pushing it to several locations! We're currently only making one RevOps hire. Please do not apply twice for the same position.

Title: Marketing Data Analyst (all genders)
Description:
The role in a Snapshot

Are you passionate about disrupting the future of education and to make a real impact? Do you want a career in an edtech company that is innovative and rewarding? Join us and enjoy working alongside an international team of talented thinkers, doers and magic makers.

We are seeking a passionate and experienced Marketing Data Analyst to join our central Data Team. You will play a key role in developing and maintaining our BI infrastructure, overseeing data governance as well as driving actionable insights and making direct impact on efficiency of marketing expenditures.

Location

Remote within Austria, Germany, and Spain. Hybrid is also possible in Vienna, Berlin, and Madrid.

Your Role in Our Journey


Partner closely with Marketing leaders and stakeholders to shape the marketing strategy through data-driven insights and impactful analysis.
Provide and present reports that are actionable for business departments and support the decision making process.
Work closely with Data Analysts and Data Engineers, support and mentor colleagues within Data & business teams to build, maintain and improve the set of current dashboards applying best Business Intelligence practices.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define, refine, organize and monitor key performance indicators (KPIs) that align with business objectives.
Design and develop Data Models that empowers end users to answer their own questions.
Drive adaptation of new tools & technologies in BI area to maintain a clean, accurate, and efficient data governance framework.


Your impact


3+ years of experience as a Business Intelligence Analyst / Data Analyst or related role.
Strong Marketing analytics background, with proven experience in digital marketing projects. Experience in attribution modeling is a plus.
Proven proficiency in SQL, with strong experience in building clean and meaningful tables.
Expert-level knowledge of Tableau with outstanding data storytelling skills.
Solid understanding of data warehousing concepts, data governance principles, and ETL processes. Experience with DBT and Amazon Web Services or other cloud computer platforms is a plus.
Strong problem solving, analytical thinking and organizational qualities.
Strong communication skills, and ability to effectively collaborate with stakeholders at all levels.


Your way to unlock your full potential


Disrupting Education: Join us for a unique opportunity to disrupt the traditional education landscape. It's not just a job; it's a chance to be part of something big and meaningful.
Global Dream Team: Say hello to an international and diverse crew of thinkers, doers, and magic makers. Get ready to be inspired daily by your colleagues from around the world.
Work, Your Way: We offer a flexible, hybrid work environment that respects your need for work-life harmony with 2/3 remote days a week & 5 fully remote weeks a year so you can shine in a way that suits you best.
Office Shenanigans: Our regular team and office events will keep your spirits high. We believe in bonding, celebrating, and having a blast together.
Strength in Unity: Join one of our GoStudent Employee Resource Groups (ERGs) and be part of communities that champion causes you're passionate about.
Growing is LIT: The sky's the limit in our EdTech playground. Access a wide array of online and in-person learning and development opportunities to build your career as high as your dreams can take you.
Support Around the Clock: We've got your back 24/7. Enjoy a comprehensive Employee Support Programme that's not just for you but for your loved ones too.


Life at GoStudent:

Do you want to reimagine education together with us and join a mission to believe in?

GoStudent is one of the world‚Äôs leading tutoring providers and education platforms. We‚Äôre also a unicorn and have raised more than ‚Ç¨675m investment to date. Together with our acquisitions Seneca Learning, Tus Media and Studienkreis, we currently support more than 11 million families each month to fulfil our vision to help each student reach their full potential.

We are passionate about disrupting the future of education and making a real impact. Join our journey and unlock your creativity and advance your career by mastering exciting challenges together with an international, driven team. We are here to support your goals and to discover how far we can reach by growing smarter and stronger together. If this sounds good to you, then join us now and unlock your full potential.

Openness Statement

At GoStudent, we are an open and welcoming bunch that values your unique skills, passion, and potential. We don't hire based on age, gender, nationality, or political views, but rather focus on your talent and motivation to contribute to the future of learning. Even if you are a unicorn - just as GoStudent is: if you believe that you can make a positive impact, we encourage you to throw your hat in the ring & to apply, regardless of whether you meet every requirement. Our team is diverse, and we believe that this diversity fosters creativity and innovation, making us a better company. Join us in reimagining the future of learning!

Learn more about "Who we are"

Please upload your CV/Resume in PDF format, preferably in English, as a DOC format might not be supported.

Disclose Privacy & Compliance Information

Title: Customer Data Analyst (Customer Segmentation) (all genders)
Description:
THE ROLE & THE TEAM

You work for the Customer Analytics team in Zalando‚Äôs Markets organization, which enables data driven business strategies for 20+ countries. Through our customer focussed analytics and segmentations we put our customers at the center of every marketing and retail decision. As a (Senior) Customer Data Analyst in our Customer Segmentation Team you are the closest link to our customer You build a deep understanding of our customer base by developing and analyzing different customer segments based on their purchasing behavior, interests, customer value and onsite activities. You will transform data and segmentations into actionable insights and recommendations that drive strategic decisions and customer retention.

WHAT WE‚ÄôD LOVE YOU TO DO (AND LOVE DOING)



Develop and analyze customer segmentations and audiences, support targeting and steering initiatives to drive customer value and retention. Collaborate with data scientists and engineers to optimize and productionalize your segmentations and audience selections.
Design, conduct and evaluate A/B tests to optimize your segmentations and audiences according to their use case. Recommend testing strategies to optimize targeted campaigns, campaign efficiency and ultimately customer value and retention. Translate complex questions into sound analytical tasks, autonomously planning large scale projects.
Collaborate with business stakeholders to identify new strategic opportunities and recommend actions supporting the customer strategy. Present your findings and work closely with business stakeholders and product owners to operationalize your recommendations.
Drive data mindset in the team and provide senior guidance to your team members in terms of methodology & technology to raise the bar within the department. Collaborate with other analysts, data scientists, engineers and commercial colleagues to untap new sources of data and know-how.
Independently manage analytical projects, identifying efficiency opportunities and supporting decision-making with insights from descriptive and inferential analysis.
Conduct knowledge-sharing sessions, support junior colleagues, and contribute to internal events and the hiring process.



WE‚ÄôD LOVE TO MEET YOU IF



You have 3+ years experience in using customer data in smart and creative ways to answer business questions and/or drive targeting efforts incl. model driven statistical analysis, e.g. Causal Inference. Very good quantitative degree, e.g. in Economics, Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science.
Advanced skills in data methodologies and technologies (Python and SQL, PySpark). Visualization tools, e.g. MicroStrategy, Tableau, PowerBI and versioning tools, e.g. Git/GitHub, are considered a plus. Curious about learning new technologies, e.g. Databricks, AWS data lake, Airflow.
Strong communicator to challenge the status-quo, tell data stories, maximize decision impact of your results and liaison with commercial and tech people alike.
Proactive, fast learner, problem solver, teamplayer, comfortable working in English in a fast paced international work environment



INCLUSIVE BY DESIGN

At Zalando, our vision is to be inclusive by design. And this vision starts with our hiring - we do not discriminate on the basis of gender identity, sexual orientation, personal expression, ethnicity, religious belief, or disability status. You are welcome to leave out your picture, age, or marital status from your application. We only assess candidates on their qualifications and merit.

We want to provide you with a great candidate experience. Feel free to inform us of any accommodations you may need, so we can best support you throughout the hiring process.

do.BETTER - our diversity & inclusion strategy

https //corporate.zalando.com/en/our-impact/dobetter-our-diversity-and-inclusion-strategy

Our employee resource groups

https //corporate.zalando.com/en/our-impact/our-employee-resource-groups

Recommend testing strategies to optimize targeted campaigns, campaign efficiency and ultimately customer value and retention. Translate complex questions into sound analytical tasks, autonomously planning large scale projects.
  • Collaborate with business stakeholders to identify new strategic opportunities and recommend actions supporting the customer strategy. Present your findings and work closely with business stakeholders and product owners to operationalize your recommendations.
  • Drive data mindset in the team and provide senior guidance to your team members in terms of methodology & technology to raise the bar within the department. Collaborate with other analysts, data scientists, engineers and commercial colleagues to untap new sources of data and know-how.
  • Independently manage analytical projects, identifying efficiency opportunities and supporting decision-making with insights from descriptive and inferential analysis.
  • Conduct knowledge-sharing sessions, support junior colleagues, and contribute to internal events and the hiring process.


WE‚ÄôD LOVE TO MEET YOU IF


  • You have 3+ years experience in using customer data in smart and creative ways to answer business questions and/or drive targeting efforts incl. model driven statistical analysis, e.g. Causal Inference. Very good quantitative degree, e.g. in Economics, Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science.
  • Advanced skills in data methodologies and technologies (Python and SQL, PySpark). Visualization tools, e.g. MicroStrategy, Tableau, PowerBI and versioning tools, e.g. Git/GitHub, are considered a plus. Curious about learning new technologies, e.g. Databricks, AWS data lake, Airflow.
  • Strong communicator to challenge the status-quo, tell data stories, maximize decision impact of your results and liaison with commercial and tech people alike.
  • Proactive, fast learner, problem solver, teamplayer, comfortable working in English in a fast paced international work environment


INCLUSIVE BY DESIGN

At Zalando, our vision is to be inclusive by design. And this vision starts with our hiring - we do not discriminate on the basis of gender identity, sexual orientation, personal expression, ethnicity, religious belief, or disability status. You are welcome to leave out your picture, age, or marital status from your application. We only assess candidates on their qualifications and merit.

We want to provide you with a great candidate experience. Feel free to inform us of any accommodations you may need, so we can best support you throughout the hiring process.

do.BETTER - our diversity & inclusion strategy

https //corporate.zalando.com/en/our-impact/dobetter-our-diversity-and-inclusion-strategy

Our employee resource groups

https //corporate.zalando.com/en/our-impact/our-employee-resource-groups

Title: Senior People Data Analyst
Description:
Brief info about Vinted

Vinted Marketplace is the largest online international C2C marketplace in Europe dedicated to second-hand fashion, with millions of registered members spanning 22 markets in Europe and North America. With a mission to make second-hand the first choice worldwide, Vinted enables people to sell and buy second-hand clothes and lifestyle items from each other, helping give those items a second or even third life.

Vinted Go launched in 2022, with a focus on developing products and solutions for more seamless shipping and delivery across Europe. Vinted Go has connected more than 40 carriers and more than 200,000 PUDO points across Europe to support the delivery of millions of parcels per year.

The Vinted Group, composed of Vinted Marketplace and Vinted Go, is headquartered in Vilnius, with workplaces in Germany, Lithuania, France, the United Kingdom, the Netherlands and over 2,000 employees. It is backed by six leading venture capital firms: Accel, Burda Principal Investments, EQT Growth, Insight Partners, Lightspeed Venture Partners, and Sprints Capital.

Information about the position

We are looking for a Senior Analyst to join our People Analytics Team. As Vinted grows with new products, locations and increasing complexity there is a need to further support decision making in the company with people data.

As a Senior Analyst your primary focus will be on analyzing and interpreting data across the employee lifecycle providing a holistic view from candidacy to alumni. You will have an opportunity to build People analytics products from scratch and shape the People Analytics function at Vinted. We‚Äôre looking for a special candidate that has a combination of HR domain expertise, strong knowledge of analysis tools and the ability to communicate well with a variety of stakeholders.

Reporting to a Senior Director in the People team, you will work within a team whose mandate is to accelerate people analytics at Vinted. You will work with data across various People systems like Workday, Greenhouse, Peakon and others.

In this position, you‚Äôll


Contribute to building People Analytics products and expansion of data-based culture
Understand business problems and enable business leaders and the People team to translate them into solutions supported by data and analysis
Managing dashboards, analysis and enabling for data spanning across the complete Employee Life Cycle (‚ÄúFrom Hire to Retire‚Äù)
Contribute to cross-functional projects and initiatives in People team


About You


BSc or MSc in Mathematics, Computer Science, Economics, Statistics, or another related field (or equivalent working experience)
HR domain expertise
Strong analytical, strategic, and storytelling skills
Experience with data visualization tools, preferably Looker but Tableau and Power Bi are applicable too
You are a Google Sheets master
Excellent communication and relationships building skills to partner with stakeholders
Ability to prioritize and manage time effectively
Knowledge of Workday reporting would be an advantage


Nice-to-have:


Hands-on experience in statistics and advanced analysis, i.e. hypothesis testing, forecasting, predictions, sentiment analysis, etc.
Knowledge of at least one statistical programming language (R, Python, Matlab etc.)
Ability to use SQL
App scripting in Google Sheets


Work perks


The opportunity to benefit from our share options programme
30 days of paid annual leave
Newest MacBook models
Mental and emotional health support through the Mindletic app
Home office support: we provide IT workstation equipment and a personal budget of up to ‚Ç¨540 for home workplace furniture
A daily lunch allowance
Frequent team-building events
A personal monthly budget for shopping on Vinted
A subsidised gym membership with ClassPass or Urban Sports Card
A subsidised pension plan provided by Vinted
Hallesche Supplemental health insurance
Life and disability insurance provided
A subsidised Deutschlandticket
The opportunity to spend up to 90 days per year - 21 of which can be spent working outside of the EU - on workation
A dog-friendly office


Working at Vinted

Individual Learning Budget

Vinted will set aside a yearly sum equal to 10-13.2% of your annual salary to be invested in your continuous professional development. You‚Äôll be able to take the initiative to use it for covering relevant learning activities that benefit your role.

Hybrid Work

We‚Äôve adopted a hybrid workplace model where 2 days in the office are recommended but not enforced. It‚Äôs up to you and your team to decide on the exact days you‚Äôll spend working together in person.

Equal Opportunity

The Vinted Group is committed to building an inclusive workplace where people from all walks of life feel a sense of belonging. We welcome applications from people of all backgrounds, identities and life experiences. At Vinted, all applicants are treated fairly without regard to their race, age, religion or belief, sex, national origin, citizenship, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, or any other protected characteristic.

The salary range for this position is ‚Ç¨ 68,000 - ‚Ç¨ 92,000 gross per year.

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst
HTML:
At MBE Group we believe that a #PeoplePossible, diverse workforce drives our success. We base hiring decisions solely on candidate experience and skills.


For our offices in Berlin we are searching for a Business Intelligence Analyst. The E-commerce product manager will support the development and implementation of MBE Digital products and services proposition for the E-commerce target to ensure a seamless integration between business customers platforms and MBE logistics & shipping services provided by MBE Centers, to grow and widen MBE digital business solutions on the E-commerce community and drive profitability growth. Geographies of relevance are: Italy, Spain, Germany, France, Poland, Portugal, UK and Ireland.

 

Main Tasks and Responsibilities

 

  • To provide the business community data and reporting in order to monitor, manage, oversee and govern sales network;
  • To support Management in framework agreements‚Äô negotiation building qualitative and quantitative analysis;
  • To support the corporate business functions and the franchisees by analyzing, managing and aligning business related financial data and KPI measurements;
  • To design reports/data extracts/dashboard related to new products/services/processes in order to verify business performances and profitability;
  • To contribute to operative processes improvement through data mining together with Information technology and Sales;
  • To support Network Sales & Operations to define profitable and competitive pricelists to attract and retain final customers.

 

 

Skills and Qualifications

 

  • Fluent in both German and English
  • Completed university-level degree with record of strong academic performance in Mathematics, Statistics, Data Science or similar fields preferred;
  • 3 years experience in BI roles;
  • Strong numerical, analytical and conceptual skills with a strategic mind set;
  • Structured approach, process oriented, attentive to details and able to prioritize;
  • Enthusiasm for technology and its application to new situations to enhance business efficiency;
  • Advanced user of MS Office Products (Excel), Google, SQL and other business productivity software;
  • Excellent mastery of written and spoken English;
  • Willingness to explore, learn and problem solve.

 

 

 

What We Offer:


‚óè     A vibrant international environment in a continuously growing company.

‚óè     Extensive training and development opportunities within the group, including an eLearning platform

‚óè     A multicultural organizational structure and team.

‚óè     Hybrid working policy (60/40)

‚óè     Volunteer Day

‚óè     Fitness and Transportation allowance

 

 


About MBE Worldwide

MBE Worldwide S.p.A., a privately-owned company headquartered in Italy, is a leading commerce enablement platform for SMBs and consumers providing e-commerce, fulfillment, shipping, marketing and print solutions via multi-brand, multi-channel operations: PrestaShop, Mail Boxes Etc. (except in the US and Canada), PostNet, PACK & SEND, Spedingo.com, AlphaGraphics, Multicopy, Print Speak, GEL Proximity and World Options. In 2023, the combination of its physical platform - that currently counts 3,190 Business Solutions Centers in 58 countries with more than 12,500 associates - with its digital e-commerce platform, served over 1.1 mln business customers worldwide generating ‚Ç¨1.4 bln (US$1.5 bln) of System-wide Gross Revenue and ‚Ç¨22 bln (US$23.8 bln) of Gross Merchandise Value.

Title: Lead Data Analyst
Description:
Founded in 2008, BMG has become the fourth-largest music publisher worldwide. Our success and competitive edge are rooted in our founding values of fairness, transparency, and service. Our mission is clear: to empower artists and songwriters to maximize the potential of their songs and recordings in the digital era.




BMG‚Äôs Global Data Analytics is our central data unit, spanning a close-knit international team of experienced Analytics Engineers, Data Analysts and Data Scientists across Germany, the US and the UK. We‚Äôre transforming how music works, enabling operational stakeholders to make data-driven decisions as well as driving strategic growth, based on a modern data stack.




We are currently seeking an experienced Lead Data Analyst (f/m/d) to join our headquarters in Berlin. As a seasoned Data Analyst, you will guide junior analysts and collaborate with senior stakeholders of various departments to facilitate informed decision-making through novel data insights, compelling storytelling, and advanced data visualization. Join us in shaping the future of music analytics!




What you‚Äôll be doing

Process big data volumes, modeling and transforming data (using dbt) from centralized DWHs (e.g. Google BigQuery) and external/organizational databases to build strategic analyses and operational KPIs
Utilize data visualization to support decision-making, crafting compelling (Looker) dashboards for key business stakeholders (e.g. Investments, Artist & Repertoire, Marketing, Streaming Sales, Rights & Royalties, Finance)
Develop scalable self-service reporting solutions and address diverse ad-hoc requests that transform our business
Collaborate closely with our global team and international colleagues to foster a data-driven culture by proposing innovative initiatives and building actionable data products
Interact with developers, data engineers, and management to propose new technologies, processes and system improvements, as well as global data governance strategies
Provide training and mentorship to junior team members, empowering them to excel in their contributions to the team‚Äôs projects
Develop sustainable processes and methodologies to support the effectiveness of our Data Analytics function




What you bring

Degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Economics, Statistics, Mathematics, or related field
Profound experience in data analytics, ideally with large datasets
Excellent SQL skills and good knowledge of Python
Proficiency in data visualization tools, such as Looker or Tableau
Broad understanding of data analysis methods and storytelling
Results-driven and analytical character, with a strategic mindset to derive business insights
Effective communication skills - confident in presenting findings to senior management
Ability to build relationships with stakeholders to understand business needs and data consumer needs
Strong interest to mentor junior colleagues with enthusiasm and expertise
Capability to plan and implement projects independently
Comfortable working in a global, fast-paced and dynamic environment




It‚Äôs also a plus if you have‚Ä¶

Team leadership experience
Prior music industry experience
Experience with GCP, dbt and Git
Knowledge of Jira and Confluence
Understanding of statistical methods and ML
Experience using ETL frameworks




What we offer

A modern office in the heart of Berlin and flexible options for remote work.
Numerous benefits such as a free BVG job ticket, a reduced-price membership for Urban Sports, company bike leasing, discounts for Bertelsmann employees, among others
Ongoing training opportunities on our internal platforms BMG Campus and Bertelsmann University
Long-term career opportunities for all employees.
A collaborative work environment with an open, appreciative community of people who all share the same passion for working with artists and songwriters.
Our unique corporate culture based on strong values and mutual support that make us a great team.




This is us

As the great Kurt Cobain once said, "Come as you are." BMG is committed to providing equal employment opportunities for all employees. We value diversity in all forms. Equal opportunity is deeply rooted in our core value of fairness, and we are committed to creating a truly inclusive work environment where everyone can thrive. If you're good at what you do, come as you are! Whether you're an experienced professional or just starting out, we welcome you to join our team.

All applicants to BMG are treated equally - regardless of age, disability, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, marital status, pregnancy or parenthood, ethnic origin, color, nationality, religion or belief.

(BMG is publishing Kurt Cobain's catalog, including the 1992 single 'Come As You Are.')

Title: Digital Data Specialist
Description:
Your Role: As a Digital Data Specialist, you‚Äôll be the architect behind our data-driven success story. You‚Äôll be responsible for gathering, analyzing, and interpreting digital data to uncover actionable insights. From optimizing marketing campaigns to enhancing user experiences, your expertise will be instrumental in shaping our strategies and driving growth.

What You‚Äôll Do:


Dive deep into digital data sources to extract meaningful insights.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand business objectives and translate them into data requirements.
Develop and implement data collection strategies across various digital platforms.
Analyze data to identify trends, patterns, and opportunities for optimization.
Create compelling data visualizations and reports to communicate findings effectively.
Stay updated on industry trends and emerging technologies to continuously innovate our data practices.


What We‚Äôre Looking For:


Passion for data-driven decision-making and problem-solving.
Strong analytical skills with a keen eye for detail.
Proficiency in data analysis tools such as Google Analytics, Adobe Analytics, or similar.
Experience with data visualization tools like Tableau, Power BI, or Domo.
Excellent communication skills with the ability to convey complex ideas to non-technical stakeholders.
Proven track record of driving business impact through data insights.
Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, or related field (or equivalent experience).


Why Join Us:


Opportunity to work with a dynamic team of industry experts and thought leaders.
Flexible remote work environment, empowering you to balance work and life.
Ongoing learning and development opportunities to fuel your professional growth.
Competitive compensation package and benefits.

Title: Senior People Data Analyst
Description:
We believe it takes great people to create a great product. That‚Äôs why our team lives our company values, and we hire based on them, too. Since 2010, Pipedrive has been on a mission to support sales and marketing teams with easy-to-use, powerful tools that make everyday work faster and easier. Today, our cloud-based software is trusted by over 100,000 companies and used in 179 countries. We have grown from a five-person team to a truly international company of over 850+ people, representing more than 50 nationalities, with ten offices distributed across Europe and the US. In 2020, Pipedrive received a majority investment from Vista Equity Partners, a global investment firm that invests exclusively in enterprise software, data and technology-enabled businesses, making Pipedrive the fifth unicorn from Estonia.

We are looking for a senior people data analyst to join our talented analytics team. In this role, you will leverage your expertise in data analysis and data visualisation to support and influence key business initiatives. Your insights will directly contribute to optimising our operations and will help guide strategic decisions across the organisation.

Your new adventure:


Gather and analyze data from various P&C systems and sources, including HRIS, ATS, performance management tools, employee surveys, and external benchmarks
Identify current industry trends and patterns within People data to provide insights into areas such as recruitment, talent management, workforce demographics, turnover rates, performance metrics, and employee engagement and proactively identify opportunities to enhance the organization‚Äôs analytical capabilities
Develop and maintain key People metrics and dashboards to track progress and identify areas for improvement. Present findings and recommendations through clear and compelling data visualizations and presentations
Provide data-driven recommendations to senior leadership and other stakeholders to inform strategic decisions related to human resources and organizational development
Collaborate with P&C business partners and other stakeholders to understand business needs and develop solutions that optimize the employee experience and drive organizational success
Lead or participate in special projects and initiatives related to HR analytics, such as predictive modelling, workforce planning, and diversity and inclusion initiatives
Mentor and provide guidance to junior members of the HR analytics team, fostering a culture of continuous learning and development
Ensure compliance with relevant regulations and ethical standards when handling sensitive HR data, maintaining confidentiality and data security at all times.


Does this sound like you?


4+ years of experience as an analyst with a focus on HR projects
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Experience working with data visualisation tools such as Tableau or Power BI
Ability to create and present data-driven stories to different stakeholders
Good understanding of SQL and Python is a plus


Why Pipedrive:


A value-driven work environment where people come first
A lively bunch of colleagues from over 50 different countries, with offices in Tallinn, Tartu, Lisbon, Prague, London, Dublin, New York, Florida, Riga and Berlin
A team serious about getting things done while not taking ourselves too seriously
A world-class working environment full of perks like parties, snacks, and drinks like Spezi and Club-Mate, and, of course, office dogs
Flexible working hours as long as you‚Äôre there for your team members
Freedom to execute your ideas with a passionate and motivated team supporting you
Lots of room for personal and career development, with internal and external training opportunities
Competitive salary and bonus system and all the benefits you‚Äôd expect from a great employer (health coverage, transportation allowance, language courses, in-house coaches, employee discounts, and more)


Pipedrive is an equal-opportunity employer. We encourage diversity in the workplace regardless of age, gender, race, religion, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity or veteran status.

We're on the looking for a senior people data analyst to join our team in Berlin.

If this is something for you, send us your resume (in English) or a link to your LinkedIn profile and please add why we should pay extra attention to your application.


Show more

  • Ensure compliance with relevant regulations and ethical standards when handling sensitive HR data, maintaining confidentiality and data security at all times.

Does this sound like you?

  • 4+ years of experience as an analyst with a focus on HR projects
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills
  • Experience working with data visualisation tools such as Tableau or Power BI
  • Ability to create and present data-driven stories to different stakeholders
  • Good understanding of SQL and Python is a plus

Why Pipedrive:

  • A value-driven work environment where people come first
  • A lively bunch of colleagues from over 50 different countries, with offices in Tallinn, Tartu, Lisbon, Prague, London, Dublin, New York, Florida, Riga and Berlin
  • A team serious about getting things done while not taking ourselves too seriously
  • A world-class working environment full of perks like parties, snacks, and drinks like Spezi and Club-Mate, and, of course, office dogs
  • Flexible working hours as long as you‚Äôre there for your team members
  • Freedom to execute your ideas with a passionate and motivated team supporting you
  • Lots of room for personal and career development, with internal and external training opportunities
  • Competitive salary and bonus system and all the benefits you‚Äôd expect from a great employer (health coverage, transportation allowance, language courses, in-house coaches, employee discounts, and more)

Pipedrive is an equal-opportunity employer. We encourage diversity in the workplace regardless of age, gender, race, religion, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity or veteran status.

We're on the looking for a senior people data analyst to join our team in Berlin.

If this is something for you, send us your resume (in English) or a link to your LinkedIn profile and please add why we should pay extra attention to your application.

Title: Data Analyst Lead, Go-to-market Strategy
Description:
Remerge helps leading mobile app marketers increase revenue and retention by activating, re-engaging and retaining high-value users through programmatic in-app ads. Founded in 2014, Remerge has established itself as a leading app retargeting player globally, with offices spanning Berlin, New York, Singapore, Seoul and Tokyo. Our international team of experts has contributed to the growth of hundreds of apps across all major verticals, including gaming, on-demand delivery, e-commerce, and finance.

Job mission

We're seeking a highly organised Data Analyst Lead, Go-to-market Strategy to join our team. In this role, you'll redesign how data is presented within the revenue department and lead the definition and implementation of a collective, data-driven and decision-making culture.

Job Responsibilities


Analyse revenue team performance every quarter, identifying key abnormalities and trends that impact revenue or profitability for discussion.
Regularly analyse customer characteristics to provide recommendations for refining our ICP
Track and report the impact of completed revenue initiatives
Generate monthly performance reports detailing sales, marketing, and account management outcomes. Suggest performance targets using historical data and benchmark comparisons
Lead the alignment of top-down and bottom-up revenue and profitability planning on an annual basis
Manage and mentor a Salesforce CRM specialist, guiding their professional development and ensuring best practices in CRM management


Job Requirements


Innate interest in understanding the business context
Ability to create precise business narratives based on data analysis
Strong project management and organisational skills
Advanced qualitative and quantitative research skills
Proven practices for effective internal communication
Proficiency in data analysis tools such as Excel, PowerBI, or other data visualisation tools
Proficiency in Salesforce


Our promise


Direct Impact: Accelerate your career in a fast-paced environment with a high degree of responsibility.
Competitive Remuneration: Enjoy a top-tier package including stock option awards in a profitable company.
Personal Growth: Take advantage of our budget for books, conferences, and other training materials.
Flexible Schedule: We offer flexible working hours, unlimited home office days, and the ability to take as much time off as you need.
Office Exchange: Travel to our global offices for short-term assignments.
Team Events: Celebrate achievements and enjoy team off-sites with an amazing team.


Remerge is an Equal Opportunity Employer: all qualified applicants are considered for positions regardless of race, ethnic origin, gender, age, religion or belief, marital status, gender identification, sexual orientation, veteran status or disability. We're looking forward to your application!

Important notice: Protect yourself from scammers representing Remerge

Do not respond to job offers from third parties claiming to recruit on behalf of Remerge, or individuals impersonating as Remerge employees offering freelance or remote work opportunities. We do not ask job applicants for personal information like bank account numbers, address, money transfer requests, or other confidential details on any messaging platform. If someone reaches out to you to offer you a job, make sure that they are a verified Remerge employee by checking their identity on official Remerge channels.

Please note that the only job openings we offer are listed on our official website: remerge.io/careers

Stay vigilant and protect yourself from potential scams.

Please review our Applicants Privacy Policy.
