Title: Staff Data Analyst - Digital Tracking (f/m/x)
Description:
The role

Our Behavioral Data Squad is a cross-functional team with end-to-end ownership of digital tracking across all markets globally at HelloFresh, from infrastructure all the way to the curated data products. As our Staff Data Analyst, you will play an integral part in ensuring data quality, governance and observability by defining and building the metrics, visualisations, and targets within the squad. You will also be a data detective, deep diving into root cause analyses of tracking discrepancies or anomalous readings, to further drive up trust and adoption.

If you are an expert analyst and a self-starter, with the product-sense to create effective success metrics and use these to inspire trust in a global business, this could be the role for you. Your deep understanding of behavioural tracking infrastructure, data models, and how this data should be consumed efficiently will ensure your impact across the breadth of HelloTech, proactively identifying needs and pain points across Data Infrastructure, Platform, Engineering and Analytics, and defining solutions to constantly improve the way we work. So while you are an individual contributor, you are a key owner of best practices across our teams.

What You‚Äôll Do


Accountable for your teams‚Äô data catalogue and delivery documentation
Collaborate from a technical perspective with data product managers and data engineers to create reusable data products
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to gather requirements and define project objectives while utilising project management skills to plan and execute data-driven projects
Partner widely across the Senior Product organisation (Product, Software Engineering, UX leads) to set strategic priorities and promote a culture rooted in evidence-based decision making.
Communicate actionable insights clearly across the organisation highlighting the ‚Äúso-whats‚Äù of your analyses in order to drive the growth of our business.
Explore and analyse customer behaviour and product performance data in order to detect growth opportunities for the HelloFresh digital product by improving user experience.
Guide and mentor other Product Analysts within our team, defining best practices and providing support to help individuals and the team grow in effectiveness
Review as a technical expert the implementations of multiple teams across domains, continuously improving the deliverables of your teams


What You'll Bring


Experience with digital tracking and tag management in a B2C environment
Extensive experience in quantitative analysis roles, ideally including having worked closely with product teams for at least 5 years.
Excellent technical skills applying expert level SQL and Python for both analysis and efficient manipulation of large data sets.
Expert level knowledge of data visualisation tools like Tableau which we use to create compelling visualisations to convey complex data.
Extensive experience working with product stakeholders in setting up A|B experiments, interpreting results and deep diving to understand the impact of particular experiments.
Excellent communication skills, taking complex business problems, articulating these as analytical problems and presenting your findings in a clear and precise way.
Extensive leadership of complex projects you have led, capability building within your team, and through mentorship or direct people management.
A change mindset, the status quo is not an impediment
You are outcome oriented, and can take a business challenge, create actionable analytical insights against it, and align stakeholders on actions to create business value.


What We Offer

Elevate your lifestyle! Join one of Europe's fastest-growing tech powerhouses in a dynamic phase of expansion.


Immerse yourself in a diverse global community of 90+ nationalities.
Enjoy a competitive compensation package that goes beyond the norm, with perks like a HelloFresh- subsidized Pension Scheme, Berlin relocation support, and a Hybrid working model.
Elevate your lifestyle with exclusive discounts on your weekly HelloFresh box and office meals.
Invest in your growth with an annual learning & development budget, German language learning budget, and access to the HelloFresh Academy.
Plus, we've got your well-being covered with mental health support, transportation perks, and working-parent-friendly benefits. From our 24/7 gym access, and wellbeing platforms like Headspace and Spill, to sabbatical leave options, HelloFresh is not just a workplace; it's a lifestyle of perks and possibilities!

HTML:
The role

Our Behavioral Data Squad is a cross-functional team with end-to-end ownership of digital tracking across all markets globally at HelloFresh, from infrastructure all the way to the curated data products. As our Staff Data Analyst, you will play an integral part in ensuring data quality, governance and observability by defining and building the metrics, visualisations, and targets within the squad. You will also be a data detective, deep diving into root cause analyses of tracking discrepancies or anomalous readings, to further drive up trust and adoption.

If you are an expert analyst and a self-starter, with the product-sense to create effective success metrics and use these to inspire trust in a global business, this could be the role for you. Your deep understanding of behavioural tracking infrastructure, data models, and how this data should be consumed efficiently will ensure your impact across the breadth of HelloTech, proactively identifying needs and pain points across Data Infrastructure, Platform, Engineering and Analytics, and defining solutions to constantly improve the way we work. So while you are an individual contributor, you are a key owner of best practices across our teams.

What You‚Äôll Do

  • Accountable for your teams‚Äô data catalogue and delivery documentation
  • Collaborate from a technical perspective with data product managers and data engineers to create reusable data products
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to gather requirements and define project objectives while utilising project management skills to plan and execute data-driven projects
  • Partner widely across the Senior Product organisation (Product, Software Engineering, UX leads) to set strategic priorities and promote a culture rooted in evidence-based decision making.
  • Communicate actionable insights clearly across the organisation highlighting the ‚Äúso-whats‚Äù of your analyses in order to drive the growth of our business.
  • Explore and analyse customer behaviour and product performance data in order to detect growth opportunities for the HelloFresh digital product by improving user experience.
  • Guide and mentor other Product Analysts within our team, defining best practices and providing support to help individuals and the team grow in effectiveness
  • Review as a technical expert the implementations of multiple teams across domains, continuously improving the deliverables of your teams

What You'll Bring

  • Experience with digital tracking and tag management in a B2C environment
  • Extensive experience in quantitative analysis roles, ideally including having worked closely with product teams for at least 5 years.
  • Excellent technical skills applying expert level SQL and Python for both analysis and efficient manipulation of large data sets.
  • Expert level knowledge of data visualisation tools like Tableau which we use to create compelling visualisations to convey complex data.
  • Extensive experience working with product stakeholders in setting up A|B experiments, interpreting results and deep diving to understand the impact of particular experiments.
  • Excellent communication skills, taking complex business problems, articulating these as analytical problems and presenting your findings in a clear and precise way.
  • Extensive leadership of complex projects you have led, capability building within your team, and through mentorship or direct people management.
  • A change mindset, the status quo is not an impediment
  • You are outcome oriented, and can take a business challenge, create actionable analytical insights against it, and align stakeholders on actions to create business value.

Title: Data Analyst - Vendor Sales & Operations (all genders)
Description:
About The Opportunity

We are on the lookout for a Data Analyst (f/m/d) to join the Vendor Sales & Operations - Data Team on our journey to always deliver amazing experiences.

The sustainable acquisition of good quality restaurants is a crucial part of Delivery Hero‚Äôs profitability goal. We focus on: what to acquire, where, how should we prioritize the backlog of leads, what channel is better for us to prioritize investments on our side, how do we enhance the vendor experience in the onboarding process, etc.

We focus on global initiative, and our main stakeholders are global product and business teams that are also focused on restaurant acquisition.

Your Mission:


Owning end to end the analytics part on multiple projects for the Vendor management team (this can vary from Competitor intelligence, VRM, Grading, AMC)
We focus on delivering data projects and adding value with actionable insights that help the business and product teams


What you need to be successful

Your Heroic Skills


Passion for data, problem-solving and generating actionable insights that impact the business
Highly proficient in SQL
Proficient in Data visualization and storytelling
Team player and ability to think outside the box
Communication skills
Business understanding


Nice to have:


Experience with process orchestrators (preferably DBT+Airflow)
Experience in AB Testing
Practical experience working with Git (or similar version control system)


Who we are

As the world‚Äôs pioneering local delivery platform, our mission is to deliver an amazing experience, fast, easy, and to your door. We operate in over 70+ countries worldwide, powered by tech, designed by people. As one of Europe‚Äôs largest tech platforms, we enable creative minds to deliver solutions that create impact within our ecosystem. We move fast, take action and adapt. No matter where you're from or what you believe in, we build, we deliver, we lead. We are Delivery Hero

What's in it for you

At Delivery Hero, we believe diversity and inclusion are key to creating not only an exciting product, but also an amazing customer and employee experience. Fostering this starts with hiring -- therefore we do not discriminate on the basis of racial identities, religious beliefs, color, national origin, gender identities or expressions, sexual orientations, age, marital or disability statuses, or any other aspect that makes you, you. Just be yourself and we can‚Äôt wait to see what value you bring to the role. We're as interested in your character as we are in your talent.

Title: Data Analysis Lead (m/f/d)
Description:
We are looking for a

Data Analysis Lead (m/f/d)

(unlimited, fulltime) Join our team at our location in Verl, Berlin, Baden-Baden, Oslo or Heerenveen ‚Äì flexible working conditions available (other Riverty locations to be discussed)

As the Data Analysis Lead, you will guide our international team of data analysts across the Nordics, Benelux, and DACH regions. You will play a crucial role in advancing our data strategy and developing our team to meet their professional growth goals. Collaborating closely with various business and functional units, you will translate business needs into data experiments and derive actionable insights about our consumers, clients, and business processes.

Your responsibilities:


Lead, mentor, and manage an international team of data analysts within the fintech domain
Foster a collaborative and high-performance team environment, promoting continuous improvement and innovation
Conduct complex data analyses and provide actionable insights to support business goals and strategic initiatives
Ensure accuracy, integrity, and timeliness of all analytical deliverables, maintaining high data quality standards
Develop and maintain analysis and visualizations to effectively communicate findings to stakeholders using data storytelling techniques
Oversee the planning, execution, and completion of data analysis projects, ensuring alignment with business objectives and deadlines
Collaborate with stakeholders from various business units (e.g., BNPL, collections) and functional units (e.g., Finance, Marketing, Risk Management) to understand data needs and deliver insights
Provide decision support to business units, aiding in informed, data-driven decision-making
Standardize data analysis methodologies, implementing best practices to ensure consistency across the team
Contribute to data governance and strategy initiatives, supporting the organization‚Äôs data management and strategic goals



What you should bring:


5+ years of data analysis experience, including 2 years in a leadership role
Master‚Äôs/MBA degree in a numerate subject (e.g., Finance, Statistics, Mathematics, Economics)
Proficiency in data analysis tools and programming languages (Databricks, SQL, Python)
Excellent analytical skills with attention to detail and accuracy, able to identify issues and conduct necessary analysis
Exceptional interpersonal and leadership skills, with a passion for enabling team growth
Ability to balance multiple priorities, work independently, and meet deadlines in a fast-paced environment
Experience in the financial industry, especially in Debt Collection and Buy Now, Pay Later
Working experience in an agile, cross-functional organizational setup
Team player, hands-on mentality, and result-oriented



Benefits:


At Riverty, you can be who you are. We are committed to creating an inclusive environment and a culture of appreciation, enriched by our employee networks.
Prioritize your health with supported sports and leisure activities.
Take advantage of our numerous training and development opportunities! Enhance your skills with training offered by the Bertelsmann University, language courses, or leadership training.
Benefit from our discounts on Bertelsmann products and financial incentives.
With our diverse work models, you can tailor your work to your preferences. Take advantage of mobile office, flexible working hours, and part-time models.

Title: Senior Data Analyst, Business Analytics
Description:
About GetYourGuide

GetYourGuide is the globally leading marketplace for unforgettable travel experiences. Travelers use GetYourGuide to discover the best things to do in a destination. Since its founding in 2009, people from all over the world have booked more than 150 million tours, activities, and attraction tickets through GetYourGuide. Powered by a global team of over 800 travel experts and technologists, we are headquartered in Berlin and have 17 local offices around the world. Visit our careers website to learn more.

Team mission

The Analytics team's mission is to enable the organisation to take action based on data. We work on a variety of problems and datasets as members of cross-functional mission teams. We take ownership of the entire analytics funnel, from exploration through recommendations to impact measurement, and take pride in the insights we generate.

This specific position is within our Business Analytics and will see you collaborate primarily with the Supply Tech Team to improve supplier engagement and, in turn increase the inventory available on the marketplace for our travellers

You Will


Develop quantitative analysis to drive product and business decisions and strategy
Explore large datasets, give meaning to data and numbers, identify opportunities and issues, and present findings to stakeholders
Design and implement metrics, dashboards, and reports
Serve as a liaison between the product teams and the data engineering team
Mentor others in the skills needed for this role


Who You Are


5+ years of relevant experience interpreting data in an analytics, data science or business intelligence role
Strong knowledge of SQL and Python for analysis (eg: pandas, scikit-learn)
Experience with data visualization and reporting tools (e.g. Looker, Jupyter Notebooks, Databricks)
Ability to understand user behavior and meaning behind the numbers
Desire to work in an international environment, with minimal direction and with highly engaged individuals
Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English


Nice to have


Experience with big data tools (e.g. Spark, Hive) is a plus
Experience working in Marketplace business
Experience solving Marketplace operations questions, such as understanding inventory diversity.
Experience in statistical modelling.
Experience in B2B product analytics.


How We Set You Up For Success


Invest in your development with an annual personal growth budget
Create a comfortable workspace at home with an annual home office budget
Enjoy flexibility with a hybrid work-from-home and telecommuting policy
Save on transportation costs with discounted public transportation tickets
Support your loved ones with generous maternity and paternity leave policies


And more...

We look forward to hearing from you

Unlock your full potential and join our mission to create unforgettable experiences for millions around the world. If you have the skills and passion for joining our team, we invite you to apply by submitting your CV/resume in English through the form below. Check out how we hire for tips and visibility into our process and check out life at GetYourGuide. If you have any further questions, please do not hesitate to contact us via jobs@getyourguide.com.

We are an equal opportunity employer

Our commitment is that every qualified person will be evaluated according to skills regardless of age, gender identity, ethnicity, sexual orientation, disability status, or religion. Please refrain from including your picture and age with the application.
Show more

Who You Are

  • 5+ years of relevant experience interpreting data in an analytics, data science or business intelligence role
  • Strong knowledge of SQL and Python for analysis (eg: pandas, scikit-learn)
  • Experience with data visualization and reporting tools (e.g. Looker, Jupyter Notebooks, Databricks)
  • Ability to understand user behavior and meaning behind the numbers
  • Desire to work in an international environment, with minimal direction and with highly engaged individuals
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English

Nice to have

  • Experience with big data tools (e.g. Spark, Hive) is a plus
  • Experience working in Marketplace business
  • Experience solving Marketplace operations questions, such as understanding inventory diversity.
  • Experience in statistical modelling.
  • Experience in B2B product analytics.

How We Set You Up For Success

  • Invest in your development with an annual personal growth budget
  • Create a comfortable workspace at home with an annual home office budget
  • Enjoy flexibility with a hybrid work-from-home and telecommuting policy
  • Save on transportation costs with discounted public transportation tickets
  • Support your loved ones with generous maternity and paternity leave policies

And more...

We look forward to hearing from you

Unlock your full potential and join our mission to create unforgettable experiences for millions around the world. If you have the skills and passion for joining our team, we invite you to apply by submitting your CV/resume in English through the form below. Check out how we hire for tips and visibility into our process and check out life at GetYourGuide. If you have any further questions, please do not hesitate to contact us via jobs@getyourguide.com.

We are an equal opportunity employer

Our commitment is that every qualified person will be evaluated according to skills regardless of age, gender identity, ethnicity, sexual orientation, disability status, or religion. Please refrain from including your picture and age with the application.

Title: Data Engineer (m/f/d)
Description:
About Yepoda

At Yepoda, Korean effectiveness meets sustainable solutions: our mindfully produced skincare products are made with love in Korea. Our mission is to bring the best beauty innovations from Korea straight to Europe ‚Äì without ever compromising on our values, quality and sustainability. All our products are made with the best natural and active ingredients, are vegan and cruelty-free. We aim to make the K-Beauty routine easy, effective, and fun.

We are a beauty start-up founded in 2020 and located in the heart of Berlin. Our team is made of over 70 brilliant human beings who came from all over the world to actively write Yepoda‚Äôs story.

We are currently looking for a Data Engineer to help build and maintain scalable data systems that streamline our operations.

Your Tasks


Design, develop, and automate data processes that communicate with different microservices.
Ensure smooth communication between various data sources across departments (such as Operations, Marketing, etc.).
Extract and automate data from invoices, and integrate data from platforms like Amazon and Shopify to model demand and operations efficiently.
Create a unified data landscape by integrating data from multiple sources, ensuring one single source of truth without silos, therefore helping the team access consistent datasets for decision-making.
Build a self-service analytics platform to provide team members with the tools they need for data-driven insights. Develop reports to improve operations and financial forecasting.


Your Profile


Obtained a degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Engineering, Statistics, Mathematics, or a related field.
Proficiency in Python, SQL, and RestAPI.
Experience automating processes, and optimizing workflows to enhance overall business operations.
Strong analytical and logical thinking approach, with great problem-solving skills.
Excellent communication skills, stakeholder management, and business acumen.
Ability to work independently and manage time effectively.


Nice to have:


Previous experience as a Software Engineer with a good understanding of the architecture required to build these systems is an advantage.
Familiarity with tools like Airbyte, Airflow, DBT, and BigQuery is a plus.
Experience with dbt (data build tool) or similar data transformation tools is nice to have.


What We Offer


Dynamic Environment: The opportunity to work in a start-up environment surrounded by a passionate and dedicated team.
Accelerate Your Career: Take on responsibility from day 1, with room for professional growth and advancement as the company continues to expand.
Inspiring Workspace: Located in the heart of Berlin's Prenzlauer Berg, a dog-friendly office, with free drinks and snacks.
Hybrid Working: We understand that sometimes you get more stuff done from home and need a change of scenery.
We Value Diversity: We seek to build an inclusive workplace that welcomes people from all different backgrounds. A welcoming, international, dedicated team with flat hierarchies and trust by default.
Employee Discounts: You‚Äôll get to enjoy the Yepoda products at a discount and share it with friends and family.


Would you like to be part of the team? Then we'd love to hear from you!

Make sure to apply by clicking on the ‚ÄúApply for this job‚Äù button below. Please upload your CV and Cover Letter in English language. Our Talent Acquisition team will review your application and get back to you as soon as possible.

At Yepoda we are dedicated to providing equal employment opportunities to all individuals, regardless of race, color, ethnicity, ancestry, religion, national origin, citizenship, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, parental status, disability, or any other status protected by applicable law.

Title: Senior Data Analyst (f/m/d)
Description:
As a Senior Data Analyst at Blacklane, you will be at the forefront of our data-driven initiatives, transforming complex datasets into actionable insights that drive business decisions. Your role will involve developing dashboards, reports, and visualizations, collaborating with cross-functional teams to understand and meet their data needs, and conducting advanced statistical analyses. You will ensure data integrity and accuracy, communicate findings effectively, and contribute to the strategic direction of our data division within the engineering department. This position offers opportunities for continuous learning, flexible working arrangements, and participation in a diverse, inclusive environment.

YOUR CHALLENGE:


Analyze complex datasets to uncover trends, patterns, and actionable insights.
Develop and maintain dashboards, reports, and data visualizations to track key metrics.
Own part of our data transformation layer where we apply data modeling techniques (via dbt) to transform raw data into analytics-friendly data assets
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand business needs and translate them into data requirements.
Conduct advanced statistical analyses and predictive modeling to support strategic decision-making.
Ensure data integrity and accuracy through rigorous validation and quality checks.
Develop domain expertise in a set of business domains (e.g. Product, Marketing, Operations or Sales) to become a valuable partner to our business stakeholders
Communicate findings and recommendations effectively to stakeholders at all levels.




ABOUT YOU:


Bachelor's degree in Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, or a related field.
4+ years of experience in data analysis or a similar role.
Proficiency in SQL and data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI, Looker).
Experience in data modeling using DBT
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to interpret complex data sets.
Excellent communication and presentation skills.
Experience with statistical analysis and predictive modeling is a plus.


MORE THAN A JOB:

We are Blacklane, providers of premium global chauffeur services. Our mission is to create true peace of mind for discerning travellers by delivering perfect experiences around the world and to inspire a better future. Blacklane is offering airport transfers, City-to-City commutes, In-city mobility chauffeur hailing and Chauffeur-by-the-hour in over 50 countries globally, either pre-booked or on-demand. Whether it's for business or pleasure, Blacklane and its 300 employees and tens of thousands of chauffeur partners have the right premium transportation service for you. By changing how people move, we opened up new opportunities for our chauffeur providers and set industry standards for climate protection in the travel industry.

We believe in ethical business practices and have a strong company culture:


Continuous Learning: We believe that open and actionable feedback is the essential component of continuous development. Set your personal development plan and take an active role in our internal learning communities to progress your career.
Flexible Working: Even the most ambitious Blacklaner needs some time to unwind. Find out what works for you and your team with flexible working hours and home office days.
Become Part of the Crew: Get to know your fellow Blacklaners through our regular team socials. Our success comes from a collaboration of more than 350 people from 70 nations and we are looking for more exceptional people to join us!
Employee Stock Options Plan: We want all Blacklaners to benefit from the company's success, so every employee gets virtual stock options.
Fair Remuneration: We've banded salary levels and matched them to the local costs of living, meaning you're always paid fairly and you know that the rest of the crew is too.
Sustainability: We care for both people and the planet, having launched the mobility's industry-first global carbon offset scheme in 2017. Blacklane plans to deliver 35% of global rides in EVs by year-end 2024, and 50% by the end of year 2025.
Equal Opportunity: We are committed to inclusion and diversity. A company is only as strong as its crew, so we developed a work environment that is inclusive, inspiring and open. All qualified applicants receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status.
Blacklane Cares day: Every crew member receives 8 hours of paid leave per year to participate in volunteering initiatives of their choice or lead employee-driven community outreach projects. Utilize your time to lend hands to a cause that drives your passion.


Upgrade your career with Blacklane
Show more

Title: Digital Data Specialist
Description:
Your Role: As a Digital Data Specialist, you‚Äôll be the architect behind our data-driven success story. You‚Äôll be responsible for gathering, analyzing, and interpreting digital data to uncover actionable insights. From optimizing marketing campaigns to enhancing user experiences, your expertise will be instrumental in shaping our strategies and driving growth.

What You‚Äôll Do:


Dive deep into digital data sources to extract meaningful insights.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand business objectives and translate them into data requirements.
Develop and implement data collection strategies across various digital platforms.
Analyze data to identify trends, patterns, and opportunities for optimization.
Create compelling data visualizations and reports to communicate findings effectively.
Stay updated on industry trends and emerging technologies to continuously innovate our data practices.


What We‚Äôre Looking For:


Passion for data-driven decision-making and problem-solving.
Strong analytical skills with a keen eye for detail.
Proficiency in data analysis tools such as Google Analytics, Adobe Analytics, or similar.
Experience with data visualization tools like Tableau, Power BI, or Domo.
Excellent communication skills with the ability to convey complex ideas to non-technical stakeholders.
Proven track record of driving business impact through data insights.
Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, or related field (or equivalent experience).


Why Join Us:


Opportunity to work with a dynamic team of industry experts and thought leaders.
Flexible remote work environment, empowering you to balance work and life.
Ongoing learning and development opportunities to fuel your professional growth.
Competitive compensation package and benefits.

Title: Data Analyst- 12 Months Fixed Term (f/m/d)
Description:
Why Scout24?

Scout24 is home of ImmoScout24, Germany‚Äôs #1 for real estate. With ImmoScout24 we have been revolutionizing the real estate market in Germany and Austria for more than 25 years. Our goal is to build a digital ecosystem that brings homeowners, seekers, and agents together. Finding the right home and property is one of the most important decisions in life. So is your career! #WorkingatScout24 means being part of a diverse and inclusive team of 1,060 colleagues and 58 nationalities. We embrace difference and celebrate individuality. By encouraging open mindedness and authenticity we enable a true learning culture and prepare the ground for personal development. Mistakes are a chance to grow and to innovate. Together we act proactively, strive for improvement, and take responsibility. We talk about success and challenge while treating each other with respect because we are #oneteam.

If this sounds interesting to you, we would love to see you joining us! Even if you may not tick all the boxes of the job requirements, we are happy to hear about the value you can add to the team. Grow with us!. Welcome home!

Aside from our people and company culture we are offering awesome benefits that make Scout24 a great place to work!


Compensation: A competitive salary package and a bonus on top.
Flexibility: Decide for yourself where you work most effectively. We offer you a hybrid working model, autonomous working time management and 30 days of vacation annually.
Work from abroad: Our remote working policy includes the possibility to work from abroad for a few weeks per year (if it gets along with the business and team needs)
Relocation: Our relocation agency supports you with your visa process and an attractive relocation package.
Use our products: As an employee you can take advantage of our plus membership for tenants on ImmoScout24 to find a new place to live.
Development: Dedicated learning time per month, online courses on our ScoutAcademy, regular book challenges, structured feedback, ‚ÄúLunch & Learn‚Äù-Events and individual career paths to push your career to the next level. ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ
Have kids? We'll support you with a professional family service, which helps you to find a childcare center or offers emergency childcare.‚ÄØ‚ÄØ
Furry feel good manager: Bring your dog to work (upon approval, as we prioritise the well-being of our employees and ensure that our dog policy is considerate of allergic individuals and prevents overcrowding on each office floor).
Mobility: We subsidize public transport or Job Bikes.
Commitment to sustainability and Diversity, Equity & Inclusion (DEI): We have clear environmental and climate protection goals and are involved in social activities and charitable organizations throughout the year. We live the diversity. Our theme weeks on diversity, mental well-being, and other social issues give us time and space to develop ourselves on DEI and sustainability.
Pension scheme: We offer a company pension scheme and support your own contribution with an attractive subsidy.
Most innovative office: Our office is barrier-free and in the heart of Berlin right at the central station. It was awarded for the most innovative office concept. We have an own gym with regular courses, napping room, rooftop terrace, organic coffee, cafeteria, 100% green electricity and a massage therapist that comes in once a week.
Health: Life Situation Coaching, regular health check ups
We are a tech company: We work with the latest technical tools and hardware.‚ÄØ


How Your Role Will Look Like


Serve as the subject matter expert on app analytics within a larger team of analysts, product managers, designers and software engineers
Collaborate with business owners to understand their objectives, strategies, and KPI requirements to translate them into data solutions and actionable insights
Build metrics around user journeys (e.g. customer lifetime value) and provide insights about cohorts like registered / non-registered users
Design data models, reports and visualizations by using technologies like Google Analytics/BigQuery, SQL and BI-Tools (e.g. MicroStrategy)
Contribute to a valuable, robust, and high-performing app analytics environment by optimizing code, debugging anomalies, and creating documentation
Provide training and support to team members on app analytics methodologies, tools, and best practices ‚ÄØ


What You Need To Succeed


Minimum of 3 years of experience in a data analytics setting with mobile apps, preferably in a similar industry
Great understanding of eCommerce products and challenges
Expertise in GA4 user tracking is a must, ideally including how to deal with technical challenges such as tracking bugs or consent management
Experience with user journey concepts & metrics
Highly skilled in "working and telling with data" - statistical methods, data modelling, visualization and ability to turn complex topics into simple stories
Very good SQL skills are required. Additional languages and working with best-practice coding approaches (such as Git) are a plus
Expertise in GA4 user tracking in apps, including dealing with technical challenges such as consent management or SDK issues
Strong proficiency in English language, German is a plus


We aim to further enhance the diversity of our company and support the professional development of people with disabilities. We have a disability representative who will assist you throughout the application process. If you require this support, please let us know in advance.
Show more
HTML:
Why Scout24?

Scout24 is home of ImmoScout24, Germany‚Äôs #1 for real estate. With ImmoScout24 we have been revolutionizing the real estate market in Germany and Austria for more than 25 years. Our goal is to build a digital ecosystem that brings homeowners, seekers, and agents together. Finding the right home and property is one of the most important decisions in life. So is your career! #WorkingatScout24 means being part of a diverse and inclusive team of 1,060 colleagues and 58 nationalities. We embrace difference and celebrate individuality. By encouraging open mindedness and authenticity we enable a true learning culture and prepare the ground for personal development. Mistakes are a chance to grow and to innovate. Together we act proactively, strive for improvement, and take responsibility. We talk about success and challenge while treating each other with respect because we are #oneteam.

If this sounds interesting to you, we would love to see you joining us! Even if you may not tick all the boxes of the job requirements, we are happy to hear about the value you can add to the team. Grow with us!. Welcome home!

Aside from our people and company culture we are offering awesome benefits that make Scout24 a great place to work!

  • Compensation: A competitive salary package and a bonus on top.
  • Flexibility: Decide for yourself where you work most effectively. We offer you a hybrid working model, autonomous working time management and 30 days of vacation annually.
  • Work from abroad: Our remote working policy includes the possibility to work from abroad for a few weeks per year (if it gets along with the business and team needs)
  • Relocation: Our relocation agency supports you with your visa process and an attractive relocation package.
  • Use our products: As an employee you can take advantage of our plus membership for tenants on ImmoScout24 to find a new place to live.
  • Development: Dedicated learning time per month, online courses on our ScoutAcademy, regular book challenges, structured feedback, ‚ÄúLunch & Learn‚Äù-Events and individual career paths to push your career to the next level. ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ
  • Have kids? We'll support you with a professional family service, which helps you to find a childcare center or offers emergency childcare.‚ÄØ‚ÄØ
  • Furry feel good manager: Bring your dog to work (upon approval, as we prioritise the well-being of our employees and ensure that our dog policy is considerate of allergic individuals and prevents overcrowding on each office floor).
  • Mobility: We subsidize public transport or Job Bikes.
  • Commitment to sustainability and Diversity, Equity & Inclusion (DEI): We have clear environmental and climate protection goals and are involved in social activities and charitable organizations throughout the year. We live the diversity. Our theme weeks on diversity, mental well-being, and other social issues give us time and space to develop ourselves on DEI and sustainability.
  • Pension scheme: We offer a company pension scheme and support your own contribution with an attractive subsidy.
  • Most innovative office: Our office is barrier-free and in the heart of Berlin right at the central station. It was awarded for the most innovative office concept. We have an own gym with regular courses, napping room, rooftop terrace, organic coffee, cafeteria, 100% green electricity and a massage therapist that comes in once a week.
  • Health: Life Situation Coaching, regular health check ups
  • We are a tech company: We work with the latest technical tools and hardware.‚ÄØ

How Your Role Will Look Like

  • Serve as the subject matter expert on app analytics within a larger team of analysts, product managers, designers and software engineers
  • Collaborate with business owners to understand their objectives, strategies, and KPI requirements to translate them into data solutions and actionable insights
  • Build metrics around user journeys (e.g. customer lifetime value) and provide insights about cohorts like registered / non-registered users
  • Design data models, reports and visualizations by using technologies like Google Analytics/BigQuery, SQL and BI-Tools (e.g. MicroStrategy)
  • Contribute to a valuable, robust, and high-performing app analytics environment by optimizing code, debugging anomalies, and creating documentation
  • Provide training and support to team members on app analytics methodologies, tools, and best practices ‚ÄØ

What You Need To Succeed

  • Minimum of 3 years of experience in a data analytics setting with mobile apps, preferably in a similar industry
  • Great understanding of eCommerce products and challenges
  • Expertise in GA4 user tracking is a must, ideally including how to deal with technical challenges such as tracking bugs or consent management
  • Experience with user journey concepts & metrics
  • Highly skilled in "working and telling with data" - statistical methods, data modelling, visualization and ability to turn complex topics into simple stories
  • Very good SQL skills are required. Additional languages and working with best-practice coding approaches (such as Git) are a plus
  • Expertise in GA4 user tracking in apps, including dealing with technical challenges such as consent management or SDK issues
  • Strong proficiency in English language, German is a plus

We aim to further enhance the diversity of our company and support the professional development of people with disabilities. We have a disability representative who will assist you throughout the application process. If you require this support, please let us know in advance.

Title: Marketing Data Analyst
Description:
We are a mobile game company, based in both Helsinki and Berlin, creating world-class entertainment by building a portfolio of hit games. Since our launch in 2020, our first chart-topping game Merge Mansion has been entertaining over 55 million players worldwide, and we have grown into a team of over 200.

Our mission is to entertain hundreds of millions of people for decades, with our games, and also through our creative marketing, community, and beyond ‚Äì while having fun with it.

We‚Äôre ordinary people crafting extraordinary games with passion and ambition, united by our culture of trust, psychological safety and wellbeing.

We are looking for an innovative Data Analyst to help us understand the performance of our marketing activities and how to optimize them to improve our business. You will join the Business & Growth team, ensuring we make data-driven decisions that maximize ROI and drive business growth.

More about Metacore crafts: https://metacoregames.com/our-crafts

Responsibilities


Analyzing data for competitive advantages and flagging underperforming sources and tactics
Understanding what makes creative content successful
Supporting the marketing team in fully utilizing new attribution methods and models to determine the contribution of different activities
Ensuring quality and consistency of data, predictions, and targets
Building and maintaining reports and data models that assist in evaluating campaign and creative performance, allocating budgets, and setting targets



Requirements


A keen interest in staying up-to-date with the latest trends in the User Acquisition landscape
Knowledge of MMP, SKAN, and Google Privacy Sandbox
Extensive experience with data, either in gaming or digital marketing
Technical know-how in:
SQL at scale (Snowflake, BigQuery, Redshift)
Python, R, or Julia
Looker, Tableau, or equivalent visualization tool



In addition to these, it would be nice but not mandatory for you to have some of these as well:


Past work experience in F2P mobile gaming business
Familiarity with:
Data modeling and transformation with tools such as dbt
Version control using Git

Statistics or ML experience with skewed distributions, such as ROAS modeling


What We Offer


Workplace where we aim high, without taking ourselves too seriously
Autonomy and accountability with support to foster professional development
Great opportunities to grow with the company
Work-life balance and strong emphasis on wellbeing
Approachable leaders with low ego
Flexible hybrid workplace where people enjoy working at the office



Basics


Location: Helsinki, Finland or Berlin, Germany
Relocation: Relocating to Finland or Germany expected, full support provided
Work model: Mix of office and remote work
Working language: English



Our equal opportunity statement

To entertain hundreds of millions of people for decades, we need diverse teams that understand our diverse audiences. The key to unleash our creativity is a diverse, equitable, and inclusive culture of trust where Metacoreans from all walks of life can be themselves. We celebrate our differences and believe they are the strength that drives us forward.

We are committed to offering equal opportunities for all, regardless of background, age, race, color, ethnicity, religion, disability, gender, sexual orientation, family status, education, socioeconomic status or any other characteristic. We build and maintain a workplace and industry free of harassment and discrimination.

We also aspire to have DE&I as a fundamental part of our game design process to enable us to create even better and more inclusive games, communities and entertainment.

If you require any support or have specific needs during the application process, please don't hesitate to let us know. We look forward to hearing from you!

Our culture

Our culture is based on trust, psychological safety and wellbeing. At Metacore, autonomy and accountability go firmly hand in hand, and we cultivate a diverse and inclusive workplace where you can be yourself.

We are collaborative and humble, and think ‚Äúwe‚Äù before ‚Äúme‚Äù. We enable focus through transparency and ownership. We aim high, and aspire to be nothing less than the best game company in the world to work for.

To create even better games, communities and entertainment, we welcome talent with diverse experiences, who are passionate about their roles and bold in their ambition.

We have collectively defined our culture and values, and we uphold them together, every day.

Read more about our culture: https://metacoregames.com/culture
Show more

Title: Data Analyst (w/m/d)
Description:
We are Billie, the leading provider of Buy Now, Pay Later (BNPL) payment methods for businesses, offering B2B companies innovative digital payment services and modern checkout solutions. We are to create a new standard for business payments and have made it our mission to simplify the purchasing experience for all businesses making it a tool for growth. Our solutions are based on proprietary, machine-learning-supported risk models, fully digitized processes and a highly scalable tech platform. This makes us a deep-tech company building financial products, not the other way around. We love building simple and elegant solutions and we strive for automation and scalability.

About The Role

In light of rapidly evolving and scaling up its development trajectory, Billie has recently set up a Portfolio Risk Management function. The main objective is to measure, control and drive decisions to optimize one of the core business metrics - portfolio losses. In order to do so, the team manages risk by researching and innovating, strategizing and recommending risk mitigating actions to relevant stakeholders (Decision science, Business Development and Account Management, Collection and Underwriting teams) in an integrated, scalable, secure and compliant way to enable the company's sustainable growth.

We are looking for a diligent Data (Risk) Analyst to join our Portfolio Management team and contribute to the development and enhancement of our portfolio risk management system.

In this role, you will look for solutions, establish relationships to be able to guide risk decisions within the company values and expectations and be able to mitigate risks while at the same time embrace growth opportunities.

The role is for someone who is a self-starter, enjoys exploring data for insights to support strategic decision making, is passionate about building data structures, analyzing and reporting on key performance indicators, comfortable to work on operational matters, willing to develop expertise in fraud and credit risk prevention, has excellent communication and strong interpersonal skills, is able to document effectively.

Responsibilities


Perform in-depth portfolio data analysis from various angles (credit risk, fraud, acceptance rate and funnel) to develop a deep understanding of business processes and product, and to support risk optimisation
Design data models as part of data business warehouses to support reporting and analysis needs
Create, maintain and update Portfolio management dashboards and reports using BI tools to communicate insights effectively
Collect, consolidate, and closely track KPI metrics regarding portfolio performance, communicate key insights and recommendations to relevant stakeholders
Perform in-depth data analysis to support Risk and Fraud systems optimization
Identify and analyze potential sources of loss to minimize risk and estimate the potential financial consequences of a loss
Connect all business stakeholders in order to present portfolio‚Äôs KPIs and drive the business approach to managing risk
Communicate issues in an independent and timely manner with appropriate internal and external partners


Who We Are Looking For


You have at least 3-4 years proven experience in data analytics, data engineering or quantitative risk analytics
You have excellent proficiency in SQL
Proficiency in data and analytics concepts, tools, and methodologies
Experience in designing KPI dashboards for all types of audiences up to C-level
Proven track record of managing complex initiatives with strong emphasis on data, providing actionable insights and tracking success of those initiatives
Able to communicate complex problems in a simple and relevant manner at all levels
Experience with translating analytical insights into data driven business prioritization
You are proficient in data visualization and analytics tools, like Tableau, Power BI, Looker
You have strong business acumen coupled with highly analytical mindset
You had the chance to work in a fast-paced and dynamic environment
Strong sense of responsibility, self-starter, well organized, good planner, able to work independently and meet deadlines
Excellent organization skills, and ability to manage multiple responsibilities
Previously experience in a fraud, risk & payment management environment is an advantage


What We Offer


Flexible work hours and trust in your ability to deliver, empowering you to take control of your work-life balance
Hybrid working approach enabling a good balance working from home and the office
One of the best Virtual Shares Incentive Programs in the market, so that everyone at Billie is invested in our success
Our ‚ÄúCatch a Ride with Billie‚Äù program, that enables discounted access to Berlin Public Transport (BVG)
A yearly development budget to broaden your skill set and horizons
Free German group classes
An English-speaking, multicultural team with more than 46 nationalities
Great office space at Checkpoint Charlie with free gym access, barista coffee, drinks and more


Billie offers you the opportunity to be a part of one of the fastest-growing Fintech startups in Europe following the mission to innovate to create new freedom for businesses of all sizes. Our combined decades of experience in B2B Financing and Payments in a market thirsty for innovation and change make this a fantastic possibility to get into the most dynamic space in tech.

Join an international team of talented, passionate people where drive and merit matter. We work in nimble, cross-functional teams with open communication lines across the company. You‚Äôll be surrounded by smart people from a wide variety of backgrounds from which you can learn and that want to learn from you.

Are you ready to join Billie?

Billie is proud to be an equal-opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment in our workplace. By embracing talents and abilities of all kinds, we aim to boost motivation and team creativity. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, national origin, age, marital status, gender, political views, beliefs, sexual orientation, color, disability status, or any other demographic factors.
Show more

Title: Data Analyst Lead, Go-to-market Strategy
Description:
Remerge helps leading mobile app marketers increase revenue and retention by activating, re-engaging and retaining high-value users through programmatic in-app ads. Founded in 2014, Remerge has established itself as a leading app retargeting player globally, with offices spanning Berlin, New York, Singapore, Seoul and Tokyo. Our international team of experts has contributed to the growth of hundreds of apps across all major verticals, including gaming, on-demand delivery, e-commerce, and finance.

Job mission

We're seeking a highly organised Data Analyst Lead, Go-to-market Strategy to join our team. In this role, you'll redesign how data is presented within the revenue department and lead the definition and implementation of a collective, data-driven and decision-making culture.

Job Responsibilities


Analyse revenue team performance every quarter, identifying key abnormalities and trends that impact revenue or profitability for discussion.
Regularly analyse customer characteristics to provide recommendations for refining our ICP
Track and report the impact of completed revenue initiatives
Generate monthly performance reports detailing sales, marketing, and account management outcomes. Suggest performance targets using historical data and benchmark comparisons
Lead the alignment of top-down and bottom-up revenue and profitability planning on an annual basis
Manage and mentor a Salesforce CRM specialist, guiding their professional development and ensuring best practices in CRM management


Job Requirements


Innate interest in understanding the business context
Ability to create precise business narratives based on data analysis
Strong project management and organisational skills
Advanced qualitative and quantitative research skills
Proven practices for effective internal communication
Proficiency in data analysis tools such as Excel, PowerBI, or other data visualisation tools
Proficiency in Salesforce


Our promise


Direct Impact: Accelerate your career in a fast-paced environment with a high degree of responsibility.
Competitive Remuneration: Enjoy a top-tier package including stock option awards in a profitable company.
Personal Growth: Take advantage of our budget for books, conferences, and other training materials.
Flexible Schedule: We offer flexible working hours, unlimited home office days, and the ability to take as much time off as you need.
Office Exchange: Travel to our global offices for short-term assignments.
Team Events: Celebrate achievements and enjoy team off-sites with an amazing team.


Remerge is an Equal Opportunity Employer: all qualified applicants are considered for positions regardless of race, ethnic origin, gender, age, religion or belief, marital status, gender identification, sexual orientation, veteran status or disability. We're looking forward to your application!

Important notice: Protect yourself from scammers representing Remerge

Do not respond to job offers from third parties claiming to recruit on behalf of Remerge, or individuals impersonating as Remerge employees offering freelance or remote work opportunities. We do not ask job applicants for personal information like bank account numbers, address, money transfer requests, or other confidential details on any messaging platform. If someone reaches out to you to offer you a job, make sure that they are a verified Remerge employee by checking their identity on official Remerge channels.

Please note that the only job openings we offer are listed on our official website: remerge.io/careers

Stay vigilant and protect yourself from potential scams.

Please review our Applicants Privacy Policy.
Show more

Title: Data Analyst Finanzdaten (m/w/d)
Description:
Du bist auf der Suche nach einer neuen Herausforderung, brauchst neuen Input und spielst deshalb mit dem Gedanken an einen Jobwechsel? Wir begleiten Dich dabei mit unserer Expertise bei der Suche nach hochattraktiven Jobs f√ºr Fach- und F√ºhrungskr√§fte.




F√ºr unseren Auftraggeber, SIEMENS, suchen wir Dich als Spezialist (m/w/d) f√ºr Finanzdaten in einer IT-gest√ºtzten Dateninfrastruktur im Rahmen der Arbeitnehmer√ºberlassung mit einer vorl√§ufigen Projektlaufzeit bis August 2025.




Data Analyst Finanzdaten (m/w/d) in Berlin




Aufgaben:

Du stellst eine zielgerichtete Anwendung von Data-Analytics- Ans√§tzen f√ºr das Management-Reporting und -Controlling zur Unterst√ºtzung der Entscheidung und Optimierung der Finanzfunktion sicher
Du arbeitest mit Finanzexperten, Gesch√§ftsexperten und anderen internen und externen Stakeholdern zusammen, um die Anforderungen an die Datenanalyse zu verstehen und die M√∂glichkeiten der Datenanalyse zu identifizieren
Du untersuchst relevante Datenquellen und bestimmst Prozesse zur Unterst√ºtzung schnell wachsender Datenmengen, um eine hohe Datenqualit√§t sicher zu stellen
Du entwickelst analytische Modelle, die f√ºr die gegebenen Szenarien am besten geeignet sind
Du testest Prototypen in einer realen Umgebung und validierst die Ergebnisse

Title: Senior Data Analyst (f/m/x)
Description:
CarOnSale is a start-up in the heart of Berlin. As a tech company, we have made it our mission to enable smooth digital processes in the automotive trade across Europe. Join us and develop new, innovative solutions for the B2B sector.

For our Data team based at our HQ in Berlin, we are looking for a Senior Data Analyst (f/m/x)

Your tasks:

Data Analysis:


Analyse and interpret data from various sources to extract meaningful insights.
Identify opportunities for data-driven decision-making within the organisation.
Define and maintain key performance indicators (KPIs) to measure success.



Project Leadership:


Lead data exploration projects to uncover actionable insights.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify and define data needs for various business initiatives.



Dashboard Creation:


Develop and maintain dashboards that enable stakeholders to monitor and analyse critical business metrics.



Report Generation:


Generate reports that provide valuable insights to support decision-making across multiple teams.



Stakeholder Management:


Engage with internal stakeholders to ensure their expectations align with our deliverables.
Manage multiple projects simultaneously, setting clear expectations for scope and timeline.
Cultivate and maintain strong relationships with stakeholders and product managers.



Enablement:


Provide support to enhance daily reporting and analytics tasks within the company.
Offer training and education to team members on data analysis tools and techniques for better decision-making



Your profile


4+ years‚Äô experience as a data analyst
Proven experience in data analysis, interpretation, and visualisation.
Proficiency in data analysis tools and languages (e.g., SQL, Tableau).
Experience working with Python.
Strong communication and presentation skills.
Ability to manage multiple projects with attention to detail.
Strong problem-solving and critical-thinking skills.
Familiarity with Google Analytics & tracking data
Fluency in English (C1)



Nice to have:


Being able to communicate in German



Why COS?


First things first: You‚Äôll be taken seriously from day one and will play an important role in our mission, because we want to disrupt Europe‚Äôs automotive market together with you
Growth and development: benefit from a detailed on-boarding program, systematic feedback cycles and individual coaching
Your gear, your choice: you will be provided with a MacBook or Windows laptop and all the hardware and software you need to work
Become a COSie: be part of a motivated team with ambitious goals and enjoy lots of fun, lots of awesome team events and a unique COS team spirit
Truly diverse and inclusive: Diversity is important to you? It is important to us too! Diversity in which everyone feels comfortable, is absolutely central to us

Title: Data Analyst VI (f/m/d)
Description:
GOhiring is the leading software company for automated job posting and recruiting analytics. With our tool, recruiters can manage the entire job posting process in one place ‚Äì from data-driven multiposting campaigns to in-depth analysis along the candidate journey. We help recruiters make the most out of their online job postings.




Your role

Developing analyses, visualisations, and reporting for internal and external clients
Creating and tuning dashboards, using Power BI, that visualise and analyse data from HR processes
Automating reports and data transformations with Airflow
Gathering and defining data pipeline requirements
Managing the scalability and rollout of our analytics dashboards
Grow with your role




Your profile

BSc or MSc in a data-oriented field of studies or statistics
2+ years of professional experience in a similar role
Profound experience with SQL, PowerBI, and Data Modeling
Proven track record of hands-on development of PowerBI dashboards
Experience with an orchestration tool, preferably Airflow
Experience with Data Visualization
Ideally, experience with embedded PowerBI solutions or capacity planning
You are curious about the data world and are not afraid to ask questions and like to research to find solutions to arising challenges
The quality of your work is important to you
Interest in growing and learning with a team long-term
Fluent in English




We offer

Remote Work:¬†Work from where you are most productive - be it at home, while traveling or in our office in Berlin.
Flexibility:¬†Look forward to processes and mindsets that are 100% geared towards time-flexible and location-independent work.
Making a big difference in a small team:¬†We believe that small teams are more fun. Direct collaboration, lots of creative freedom, learning from each other - that's our understanding of productivity.
More than a job - discovering the future:¬†You'll work at the heart of digitalization in recruiting and perhaps discover the job of a lifetime.
Choose your device - we pay:¬†For your remote job you‚Äôll get a laptop and a technical setup of your choice.
World-class team and onboarding:¬†Your team members Lucas and R√©my will guide you through our hands-on onboarding, so you feel in good hands from the very beginning.¬†Here¬†you can meet the team.
Two Offsites a year:¬†Twice a year you will spend a week with all your coworkers in different locations within Europe.
Keep growing:¬†Take advantage of our training opportunities using various training platforms.




Want to work together on the future of recruiting?

Simply send us your CV or LinkedIn / Xing profile. No cover letter needed. We are happy to hear from you. Diversity and equal opportunity are very important to us. We are happy about the interest of all candidates and strive to provide feedback as quickly as possible.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Job Description

If you are passionate about data and eager to tackle some of the most existing data analytics use cases in the fashion retail industry, COS is the place for you!

We are seeking a Data Analyst to join COS Data & Analytics team. In this role you will play a crucial part in driving data-driven decision-making across various business functions within COS from customer, sales, commercial, merchandising, product, supply chain, sustainability, finance and beyond. You will be responsible for identifying strategic challenges, conducting in-depth analysis and collaborating with stakeholders to turn data into actionable insights that support business objectives.

Key responsibilities: ‚ÄØ


Proactively identify strategic challenges where decision support anchored in data is needed.‚ÄØ
Be the driver for data driven decision making in your product team by turning data into insights and provide the team with clear, data driven recommendations.
Apply advanced analytics methods and tools to model, execute and follow up initiatives from idea to industrialisation.
Be responsible for the full analysis process from problem and scope definition to data extraction, cleaning, analysis, visualization, creating recommendations, and presenting results.‚ÄØ
Turn business challenges into structured data analyse. Define and setup measurable KPIs and OKRs, own and maintain their visualization for value reporting.
Be the data analytics expert in cross-functional teams and collaborate with business stakeholders to solve business challenges using data analytics.‚ÄØ
Work on a broad variety of business challenges with a wide range of business stakeholders (customer, sales, marketing, merchandizing, finance etc.).‚ÄØ
Participate in wider analytics community, both within COS and H&M Group



Qualifications

We believe you are a business-minded, ambitious team player, analytical, curious, and very supportive. We also believe you are structured, thorough with good communication and interpersonal skills. You are highly solution-oriented, quickly adapting to changes in scope and time plan. To be successful in this role we believe that you have:


Proven several years of experience as either as Data Analyst, Product/Business Analyst or similar
Strong business sense and business interest with the ability of making sound interpretations of data and other information.‚ÄØ
Excellent communication skills and are skilled in translating and explaining complex data analysis to non-technical and/or senior stakeholders.
Hands-on working experience writing advanced SQL queries to extract, prep, validate, and analyze large data sets.
Hands on experience in Analytical tools such as powerBI or Looker studio etc.
Have hands on experience building data analytics solutions using programming languages such Python, or R
Previous working experience or comfortable working with one of cloud platform data analytics stack i.e. Azure (Azure - SQL Server) or GCP ‚Äì big query
Have skills in Microsoft excel functions such as: power pivot, power query. Tabular Editor, DAX etc.
Are prestige less and enjoy collaborating with others to solve problems.‚ÄØ



Additional Information

This is a full time permanent contract based at our Head Office in London

Benefits

We offer all our employees attractive benefits with extensive development opportunities around the globe. All our employees receive a 25% staff discount usable on all our H&M Group brands in stores and online. In addition to our staff discount, all our employees are included in our H&M Incentive Program ‚Äì HIP. You can read more about our H&M Incentive Program here.

In addition to this UK based colleagues also receive


Up to 25 days holiday
Annual health checks
Pension scheme
Discounts on various activities and financial/lifestyle products via our benefits hub
Cycle to work scheme
Discounted gym membership
Employee assistance via retail trust
Private health & dental care



Inclusion & Diversity

At COS we‚Äôre determined to create and maintain inclusive, diverse and equitable workplaces throughout our organisation. Our teams should consist of a variety of people that share and combine their knowledge, experience and ideas. Having a diverse workforce leads to a positive impact on how we address challenges, on what we perceive possible and on how we choose to relate to our colleagues and customers all over the world. Hence all diversity dimensions are taken into consideration in our recruitment process.

Company Description

About COS: Since our launch in 2007 we have opened stores and sell online in over 40 countries worldwide. Our collection offers elevated essentials, iconic pieces and innovative design. The creative soul of the brand is visualised through our storytelling, seasonal runway shows and connect with contemporary culture to create an experience beyond the expected. From the beginning, our design ethos has always put lasting style, quality and sustainability first. Today 92% of the materials in our collection are more sustainably sourced.

Ready to apply? Click on the I‚ÄôM INTERESTED link where you can upload your CV securely. Once we have received your application, we will keep you updated regularly about the status of your application so please look out for our email.

We are looking forward to hearing from you!

Title: Junior Insight Analyst
Description:
The Insight Analyst will be a junior role; supporting Liberty and the Insights & Analytics team by providing actionable insight to help the business deliver an unparalleled customer experience, as well as driving improvement in key business metrics.




The successful candidate will be someone with excellent communication skills, engaging with stakeholders at all levels of the business. They will play an integral role in influencing both business and customer strategies through quantitative data analysis.




They will work closely with the Insights & Analytics Manager to develop key analytics strategies and approaches to improving processes within the business.




Key Responsibilities:

Communicate with stakeholders to capture requirements and identify key opportunities for improvement
Use analytical and storytelling skills, taking the business owners on a journey to better understand the customer
Ownership of regular and ad-hoc customer insight reports
Work closely with the Insights & Analyst Manager to deliver action orientated insights
Analysis of CRM campaigns across all marketing channels including the post campaign analysis to ensure ROI on activity
Continuously improve existing reporting methods within Liberty
Improve the efficiency of existing reporting methods using data visualisation and techniques in SQL, Microsoft Excel and BI
Help monitor customer data quality and ensure any issues are appropriately resolved or escalated with IT stakeholders.




Acting as a provider of insights and reporting, the successful candidate will show the ability to work with a wide range of stakeholders across the business. They will show an interest in customer insights, product performance and the entire purchasing journey on the Liberty website and in the Flagship store. They will be willing to use new tools and approaches to insights.

Knowledge, Skills and Abilities

Analysing data sets in Excel
Presenting results and key recommendations in Powerpoint (or equivalent tool)
SQL and data interrogation of data sets
Communication with stakeholders
E-commerce analytics experience




Desirables

Data Visualisation and BI (eg Power BI, Tableau, Pyramid Analytics)
Google Analytics
Retail and Customer Experience
Marketing campaign analysis
Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
The Role

At Deliveroo we have an outstanding data science organisation, with a mission to enable the highest quality human and machine decision-making. We work throughout the company - in product, business and platform teams - using analysis, experimentation, causal inference and machine learning techniques. We are uniquely placed to use data to help make better decisions and improve data literacy across Deliveroo.

We are looking for a Data Analyst that is passionate about metrics and telling the stories behind the data. We have several roles open across different teams (grocery, loyalty, restaurants). Data Analysts at Deliveroo report into our data science management team.

You will be a professional in insights storytelling, communication and visualisation and know how to create action from metrics. Crafting effective intelligent benchmarks, understanding performance, caring about data quality, enabling automation and creating phenomenal visualisations and stories are things that drive you.

What you'll be doing



Work closely with commercial stakeholders to create value and business impact through better data availability, visualisation and analysis
Discover, analyse, and interpret trends or patterns in complex datasets to perform ad-hoc analyses and deliver insights to the executive team and senior management
Understand key drivers of the business and provide data driven guidance on key levers
Identify and specify data needs and quality requirements and work closely with Analytics Engineers to ensure data is available, accurate and corresponds to the business needs
Consolidate and distribute best analytical practices from different teams and countries



Requirements



Experience identifying the root cause of problems, assessing risks/impacts and determining and implementing effective solutions.
A good understanding of querying in SQL and understanding of database structure - you'll be expected to be able to extract the data you need for your analysis.
Compelling story-telling skills, and an eye for powerful visualisations - you'll need to translate your findings for all levels of stakeholder (business and technical)
Good knowledge of Excel/GSheets - depending on the task, there is a good chance that this is where some of your exploratory analysis will take place. Being comfortable with pivot tables and functions will be essential.
Developer experience with a data visualisation tool (Looker, Tableau, Periscope)



Why Deliveroo

Our mission is to transform the way you shop and eat, bringing the neighbourhood to your door by connecting consumers, restaurants, shops and riders. . We are transforming the way the world eats and shops by making access to food and products more convenient and enjoyable. We give people the opportunity to buy what they want, as they want it, when and where they want it.

We are a technology-driven company at the forefront of the most rapidly expanding industry in the world. We are still a small team, making a very large impact, looking to answer some of the most interesting questions out there. We move fast, value autonomy and ownership, and we are always looking for new ideas.

Workplace & Benefits

At Deliveroo we know that people are the heart of the business and we prioritise their welfare. Benefits differ by country, but we offer many benefits in areas including healthcare, well-being, parental leave, pensions, and generous annual leave allowances, including time off to support a charitable cause of your choice. Benefits are country-specific, please ask your recruiter for more information. This role in a Hybrid position.

Diversity

At Deliveroo, we believe a great workplace is one that represents the world we live in and how beautifully diverse it can be. That means we have no judgement when it comes to any one of the things that make you who you are - your gender, race, sexuality, religion or a secret aversion to coriander. All you need is a passion for (most) food and a desire to be part of one of the fastest-growing businesses in a rapidly growing industry.

We are committed to diversity, equity and inclusion in all aspects of our hiring process. We recognise that some candidates may require adjustments to apply for a position or fairly participate in the interview process. If you require any adjustments, please don't hesitate to let us know. We will make every effort to provide the necessary adjustments to ensure you have an equitable opportunity to succeed.
