Title: Data Analyst
Description:
SUMMARY STATEMENT

We offer an exciting role within our Insights team for an individual seeking to combine their strong data management, analytical and visualisation capabilities within a genuinely global environment and to advance their career with technical development and leadership opportunities.




This role will be responsible for managing the delivery of outputs for multiple Global Insights programmes; with the aim of ultimately being able to manage and run a complete programme. The position will work closely with a team of programmers to support consultants in the analysis and delivery of insights to our clients. It is expected that the incumbent will contribute project experience, research and analysis skills to the team.




KEY RESPONSIBILITIES

Own and manage the analysis and reporting of assigned insights programmes

Analyse survey data using descriptive and inferential statistics (SAS)
Summarise analyses through professional looking charts shown in static reports (PowerPoint) and interactive dashboards (PowerBI)
Deliver insights to clients (internal and external) showing trends and action areas
Manage survey data from different sources ‚Äì face-to-face interviews, online and phone studies. This includes data import, storage, review and cleansing




Interact proactively and positively with programme managers and colleagues from other areas of NMG to gain better understanding of the various programmes and deliver accurate outputs

Create and maintain continuous improvement actions
Review and enhance codes and data structure for more efficient work flow




Applying a creative and curious mindset, applying new and evolving approaches to improve the effectiveness and efficiencies of our insights studies




Living the NMG Values of Collaboration, Make it Count, Curiosity and ‚ÄòGo for it!‚Äô




YOUR EXPERIENCE

The successful candidate for this role will be able to demonstrate:

Qualifications & Experience

The ideal candidate should:

have hands-on experience in using MS Power BI, and related MS technologies
have at least 1 year of practical knowledge and expertise of SAS (Base or EG) and in using SQL and macros. Practical SAS programming expertise is a MUST.
have experience in the gathering and documenting of business logics/methodologies
have strong visualisation skills (dashboard and/or graph designing)
have a strong academic performance




The following are also valued:

Knowledge in other programming languages like Python and R
UI/UX experience
Experience in analysing and reporting survey data




Competencies

Outstanding communication skills at all levels - able to build excellent working relationships with clients, team members and other stakeholders
Ability to solve problems effectively, think creatively and deliver quality outputs in a timely manner
Ability to make decisions independently in a fast-paced environment
Excellent attention to detail
Excellent organizational, prioritization and time management skills
Fast and keen learner ‚Äì able to work individually and in a team




ABOUT NMG

The NMG Group is a global advisory and intermediary firm focused exclusively on the financial services sector. Established in 1992, NMG has enjoyed rapid expansion internationally and now has over 800 employees in 18 cities worldwide. Our guiding principle is to always ‚ÄòFind a Better Way‚Äô.




NMG Consulting is a leading multinational insurance, reinsurance and investments consultancy, integrating consulting, insights and analytics. Our consultants provide strategy consulting, insights, analytics and actuarial services to financial institutions including banks, insurers, reinsurers and fund managers.




We are constantly evolving and the range of work that we do challenges and expands our peoples‚Äô knowledge at lightning speed. Our flat, team-based structures encourage participation from all experience levels ‚Äì everyone is encouraged to contribute, regardless of their role. We advocate hearing different points of view, collaboration and constructive debate.

Title: Associate Data Analyst
Description:
Collaborating with the Director, Data Design and Investment Division Data Lake (IDDL) Business Support, the Associate Data Analyst, will be a key member of a team of data professionals responsible for delivering key critical initiatives and establishing the data quality program for Manulife GWAM. They will couple their data analysis experience with a solid understanding of the Investment Division‚Äôs business and operations to implement the data strategy.

Responsibilities


You will work with Global Wealth Asset Management Operational Business &Technical Support teams, GWAM Business Teams (Finance and Risk) and the GWAM Chief Data Office to support the Investment Division Data Lake [IDDL] Daily Production activities to ensure data is available, reliable, consistent, accessible, secure, and timely through daily Data Issue Identification, Analysis and Action Planning.
You will partner with the GWAM Chief Data Office Data Governance and Data Analytics, support on-going IDDL process improvements, including enhancements to GWAM Operational Capabilities, GWAM Data Quality Monitoring and Controls and GWAM Meta Data Management Tools such as the Business Glossary and Data Lineage.
Working with different GWAM teams to support IDDL Design and Development for GWAM Strategic Initiatives.


How will you create impact?

The Chief Data Office (CDO) provides centralized oversight and coordination for any activities related to investment data. We provide standardized framework, operating structures, policies, and process to consistently govern and manage GWAM and GA data assets. The individual will be a key member of data design team to lead and support the growth of GWAM and GA data assets and critical data processes such as daily data quality deployment and monitoring.

What motivates you?


You obsess about customers, listen, engage and act for their benefit.
You think big, with curiosity to discover ways to use your agile approach and enable business outcomes.
You thrive in teams and enjoy getting things done together.
You take ownership and build solutions, focusing on what matters.
You do what is right, work with integrity and speak up.
You share your humanity, helping us build a diverse and inclusive work environment for everyone


What We Are Looking For


Highly analytical with strong consulting and problem-solving abilities; tenacity to identify the root cause of problems and apply innovative approaches to solve business data problems
Strong service orientation
Take personal accountability for issue analysis and resolution
Asset management or financial services industry experience
Previous experience in the management of large, firm-wide processes
Strong communication skills
Constructive challenge and influencing skills
Experience in translating between business and technology worlds
Champion of change and effectively managing the implementation of new ideas / improvements
Confident when dealing with investment professionals, senior management and other partners
Knowledge and experience with asset management systems and platforms such as trading/order management, portfolio accounting, client reporting, performance analytics and master data management
Technical Skills, such as knowledge, of SQL required to perform data analysis


What can we offer you?


A competitive salary and benefits packages.
A growth trajectory that extends upward and outward, encouraging you to follow your passions and learn new skills.
A focus on growing your career path with us.
Flexible work policies and strong work-life balance.
Professional development and leadership opportunities.


Our commitment to you


Values-first culture We lead with our Values every day and bring them to life together.
Boundless opportunity We create opportunities to learn and grow at every stage of your career.
Continuous innovation We invite you to help redefine the future of financial services.
Delivering the promise of Diversity, Equity and Inclusion We foster an inclusive workplace where everyone thrives.
Championing Corporate Citizenship We build a business that benefits all stakeholders and has a positive social and environmental impact.


About Manulife And John Hancock

Manulife Financial Corporation is a leading international financial services provider, helping people make their decisions easier and lives better. To learn more about us, visit https://www.manulife.com/en/about/our-story.html.

Manulife is an Equal Opportunity Employer

At Manulife/John Hancock, we embrace our diversity. We strive to attract, develop and retain a workforce that is as diverse as the customers we serve and to foster an inclusive work environment that embraces the strength of cultures and individuals. We are committed to fair recruitment, retention, advancement and compensation, and we administer all of our practices and programs without discrimination on the basis of race, ancestry, place of origin, colour, ethnic origin, citizenship, religion or religious beliefs, creed, sex (including pregnancy and pregnancy-related conditions), sexual orientation, genetic characteristics, veteran status, gender identity, gender expression, age, marital status, family status, disability, or any other ground protected by applicable law.

It is our priority to remove barriers to provide equal access to employment. A Human Resources representative will work with applicants who request a reasonable accommodation during the application process. All information shared during the accommodation request process will be stored and used in a manner that is consistent with applicable laws and Manulife/John Hancock policies. To request a reasonable accommodation in the application process, contact recruitment@manulife.com.

Primary Location

Toronto, Ontario

Working Arrangement

Hybrid

Salary range is expected to be between

$59,570.00 CAD - $110,630.00 CAD

If you are applying for this role outside of the primary location, please contact recruitment@manulife.com for the salary range for your location. The actual salary will vary depending on local market conditions, geography and relevant job-related factors such as knowledge, skills, qualifications, experience, and education/training. Employees also have the opportunity to participate in incentive programs and earn incentive compensation tied to business and individual performance.

Manulife offers eligible employees a wide array of customizable benefits, including health, dental, mental health, vision, short- and long-term disability, life and AD&D insurance coverage, adoption/surrogacy and wellness benefits, and employee/family assistance plans. We also offer eligible employees various retirement savings plans (including pension and a global share ownership plan with employer matching contributions) and financial education and counseling resources. Our generous paid time off program in Canada includes holidays, vacation, personal, and sick days, and we offer the full range of statutory leaves of absence. If you are applying for this role in the U.S., please contact recruitment@manulife.com for more information about U.S.-specific paid time off provisions.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
This is a hybrid position in Vancouver. Candidates must be in British Columbia to be considered for this role.







This is a new role with a large healthcare organization in Vancouver. You will be joining a stable and tenured team and will support financial planning, applications and analyses. You will be working with internal financial data, and previous experience with this is required. About 70% of your role will be analytical, and 30% will involve working with SQL and writing SQL queries.







What you will do and how you will make an impact ‚Ä¶







[-] You will use SQL for data cleansing and exploration, and prepare the data for analysis.







[-] You will deep dive into this organization‚Äôs financial information and reports.







[-] You will conduct statistical analysis. You will look at cost patterns and variances, and identify trends.







[-] You will present your insights and recommendations to internal stakeholders, and ensure that business needs are met.







[-] You will collaborate with internal and external stakeholders, and identify additional areas of opportunity. You will ensure that internal systems and operations are optimized.







[-] You will write SQL queries and create custom reports, as needed.







[-] You will support any system changes and develop documentation, and training materials.







Why we are excited about you ‚Ä¶







[-] You have strong problem-solving skills, and can perform well under minimal guidance







[-] You have previous experience with Microsoft SQL







[-] You have worked with financial data previously, such as revenue and expenses information







[-] You have strong presentation skills, and have experience sharing your findings with senior managers







Qualifications







[-] Minimum 3 years of experience in a data analytics / similar position







[-] Proven experience working with SQL







[-] Familiarity with Power BI or Tableau







Nice to have:







[-] Educational background, or previous experience with economics and statistics







Does this sound like it was written for you? Excellent! Please apply and let‚Äôs explore this together.







The interview process ‚Ä¶







A bit about myself - my name is Tanvi Krishna, and I am a recruitment consultant based in Vancouver, BC. I am constantly working on IT and creative roles, and I am always looking to meet new people.




If you're interested in pursuing this role, please apply to this posting. If you are selected for the next stage, I will contact you for an initial discussion. This will be a chance for us to discuss the job requirements in greater detail, as well as your career goals and preferences for your next position. We can also discuss other opportunities which may fit what you're looking for.




Please feel free to reach out and find me on LinkedIn by searching my name: Tanvi Krishna







Compensation & benefits ‚Ä¶







This is a full-time and permanent position that includes a competitive base salary, extended health and dental benefits, pension plan, and paid vacation.

Title: Data Analyst (12 month contract)
Description:
WHAT ON EARTH IS DECIEM?

Known as ‚ÄúThe Abnormal Beauty Company‚Äù, DECIEM is the parent company of The Ordinary, NIOD, and other beauty brands & is an industry disruptor with a science first approach to innovation. DECIEM was Co-Founded in 2013 by the late Brandon Truaxe, a visionary who set out to change the beauty industry through authenticity and transparency. He developed DECIEM to be a happy family (of people and beauty brands), rooted in kindness, creativity, diversity, and respect, alongside Co-Founder and CEO, Nicola Kilner.

We are growing rapidly and we‚Äôre looking for someone who shares this vision and wants to grow with us!

WHAT WE'RE LOOKING FOR

We are looking for a Data Analyst to join our Demand Planning Team on a 12-month contract ending August 29th, 2025. This position will be based out of our Head Office located in Liberty Village and allows for a hybrid working schedule of 2-days a week in office and 3-days a week work from home.

WHAT YOU'D BE DOING IN THIS ROLE


Develop a thorough end to end understanding of Supply Chain Operations process flow, from Demand Planning, to Distribution Planning, Customer Ordering, Distribution Centre operation and Inventory control, by interacting with key stakeholders and access to data that is critical to measuring operational success
Focus on Demand Planning processes, supporting the team with analysis of Sales History to identify and explain trends, in order to feed into future forecasting insights.
Compile large amounts of data to enable rapid analysis through pivot tables, graphing and statistical forecasting
Work collaboratively with internal stakeholders to support the monthly forecasting cycle by reviewing sales & shipment trends, seasonality, promotions, expansion, new product launch, cannibalization, and delists
Perform other duties as assigned


SKILLS AND QUALIFICATIONS NEEDED TO GET THE JOB DONE


University/College degree in Engineering, Business, or Supply Chain Management
Advanced skills in Microsoft Office (Excel, Access, Word and PowerPoint), with proficiency with Power BI as a strong asset
Strong verbal and written communication skills including the ability to communicate and influence using data-driven insights to multiple levels of management with appropriate level of detail
Effective collaboration skills to building strong relationships with cross functional stakeholders to align on common goal
Ability to work individually as well as part of a team in a fast-pace, dynamic environment


WHAT YOU'LL BE GAINING BY JOINING OUR TEAM

There‚Äôs a lot of good stuff that comes along with being a DECIEM team member. Here‚Äôs a few of our favourite perks and benefits, in no particular order‚Ä¶


Generous Vacation & Personal Days, plus additional time off for volunteering in your community, voting, peaceful protesting, celebrating your birthday, and more.
6 months of paid time off for new parents (inclusive of all genders).
Work from anywhere 4 weeks per year.
A hybrid work model (for applicable roles).
Summer Friday‚Äôs - get off at 1pm all summer long! (for applicable roles).
Unlimited access to an Employee Assistance Program that includes mental health care, mindfulness programs, and more.
Access to Development Grants & a LinkedIn Learning membership to help you keep growing and learning.
A generous discount on DECIEM products for you, your family, and your friends.


BUILDING GROWTH TO POWER GOOD

We are a People first company that lives by our core values to‚Ä¶


üòä Do the right thing
üí° Create impact
üå± Respect small things
‚ù§Ô∏è Care too much
üöÄ Be the future


These values continue to guide us in all that we do. Along the way, we‚Äôve been honoured to win some pretty incredible awards, including a CEW Achiever Award, Best Skincare Brand at Sunday Times Style Beauty Awards, and Most Popular Sustainable Brand by The Cosmetify Index Global. We‚Äôre still blushing!

SUSTAINABILITY AND SOCIAL IMPACT

DECIEM‚Äôs objective is to build growth and do good things while prioritizing people, animals, and the Earth.

Our Sustainability strategy is focused on fighting climate change, improved waste management, responsible packaging, responsible sourcing and product lifecycle, and water conservation.

In 2020, DECIEM established the Good Fund to support both large and grassroots charities in response to global events.

CREATING A HUMAN WORLD OF BEAUTY

DECIEM is committed to diversity, equity, and inclusion (DEI) by creating meaningful, measurable change in the lives of our team members and in the communities where we operate. Achieving equality is critical to DECIEM and our future. You can learn more about our DEI commitment in our open letter, "

DECIEM is an equal opportunity employer. We prohibit discrimination based on age, colour, disability, national origin, race, religion, sex, gender, sexual orientation, and any other legally protected class in accordance with applicable federal, provincial and local laws. We are also committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible workplace. If you are contacted to be part of our recruitment process and require accommodation, please let us know.

WANT TO JOIN US?

Thank you for reading the whole thing! If you liked what you heard, kindly send us your resume. We really appreciate your effort in applying for this position. However, only those who have been shortlisted for interviews will be contacted. <3

Title: Business Data Analyst
Description:
Hi ,




I hope you are doing well.




Iris's client, one of the world's largest multinational investment banking and financial services corporation is looking to hire an Business Data Analyst Our direct client is a is a world-leading financial services company, provides consumers, corporations, governments and institutions with a broad range of financial services and products.




Title: Business Data Analyst

Location: Toronto, ON (Hybrid)

Duration: 24+ Months




Job Description:

Experience working in ETL projects doing data mapping across source and target systems.
Know-how of SQL is must to understand data and relationships between entities and define right mapping.
Experience working with multiple upstream and downstream systems defining the mapping requirements for implementation.
Work closely with business stakeholders to understand business needs and enhancements and translate them into requirements.
Good communication skills and stakeholder management experience.
Knowledge of Financial data / Credit risk data and functionality is a plus and good to know.




About Iris Software Inc.

Iris Software, Inc. (registered as SSA Infosystems in Canada) is a CMMi Level 5 New Jersey based company providing information technology solutions to clients nationwide for over 30 years. Iris has been growing at over 100% annually. In a program sponsored by Price Waterhouse, PNC Bank and Marsh, Iris has been honored for being

- One of New Jersey's Finest 25 companies for the year 2001 and 2002.

- Iris is also ranked 75th among Inc 500 s list of privately held companies for year 2001.

- NJ Technology FAST 50 Company for year 2002.

In a competitive industry, we distinguish ourselves by reliability, technical expertise and a history of successfully completed projects for clients ranging from mid-sized to Fortune 1000 companies.




Best regards,




Neeraj Singh

Iris Software

200 Metroplex Drive, Suite #300

Edison, NJ 08817

www.irissoftware.com

Title: Data Analyst & BI Specialist
Description:
Who Are We?

UniUni is a Canadian courier for e-commerce and logistics companies that is full of energy and determination. Our team and technology elevates and streamlines fulfillment services in Canada to meet customers' demanding expectations. With tens of thousands of parcels fulfilled daily, we have established ourselves as a leader in the last mile delivery and e-commerce fulfillment operation in Canada.




What Do We Offer?

At UniUni, we offer exciting opportunities to our employees to achieve their career goals. We value lateral moves as much as vertical promotions ‚Äì we believe all roles should develop your skills, broaden your experience, and help you build a rewarding career. We know you are not only seeking a job, but a career to pursue. If you are ready to join UniUni‚Äôs dynamic team, while working hard and having fun doing it, we invite you to apply online and let us know how you can be part of our success story.




ResponsibilitiesÔºö

Quickly understand business needs and translate them into data, develop and optimize logistics data dashboards and data analysis systems, support data-driven operations, and enhance business decision-making efficiency.
Develop diverse data analysis methodologies and produce analytical reports during regular operations and peak periods, deeply analyze and identify business issues, opportunities, and breakthroughs, and collaborate on horizontal optimization.
Collaborate with data product and algorithm teams to build multi-dimensional analysis, offline modeling, and visualization tools to uncover opportunities, identify risks, provide predictive warnings, and evaluate ROI, thereby enhancing data application value.
Utilize industry, business, operational, and experiential perspectives to proactively discover opportunities through business insights, data analysis, and data modeling, formulate methodologies, and propose solutions and implementation plans.




RequirementsÔºö

Over 5 years of relevant experience, preferably with a background in Statistics, Mathematics, Information Technology, or Business Analysis.
Extensive experience in commercial analysis with strong business acumen and data sensitivity, capable of developing comprehensive data analysis strategies and solutions, and driving their implementation to achieve results.
Proficient in AWS cloud services and SQL, capable of extracting key results from large datasets, with strong data analysis skills and extensive experience in commercial data analysis and modeling.
Excellent logical thinking and rapid learning abilities, capable of quickly acquiring and adapting to new domain knowledge, adept at deconstructing complex problems and applying analytical methods to solve them in a work setting.
Self-driven with strong teamwork spirit, excellent communication and coordination skills, and ability to communicate and drive projects across functions and departments.




Compensation and BenefitsÔºö

The hiring range for this position ranges from CA$70,000 - CA$97,000. Your actual level and salary will be determined on a case-by-case basis and may vary based on the following considerations: job-related knowledge and skills, education, and experience.




All interested applicants are requested to submit a resume. We thank all applicants in advance for their interest but only those selected for the interview process will be contacted.

Title: Data Analyst (12-Month Contract)
Description:
Requisition ID: 205874

Join a purpose driven winning team, committed to results, in an inclusive and high-performing culture.

Purpose

Contributes to the overall success of the Global Operations Analytics & Business Intelligence team in Canada, ensuring specific individual goals, plans, and initiatives are executed & delivered in support of the team‚Äôs business strategies and objectives. Ensures all activities conducted are in compliance with governing regulations, internal policies and procedures.

Reporting to the Senior Manager, Analytics & Business Intelligence, the Data Analyst assists with the design, development, deployment, and sustainment of data solutions and the technology roadmap ‚Äì in support of the data strategy ‚Äì to effectively monitor, assess, and deploy analytics & reporting solutions for internal partners across Global Operations and International Banking units.

The Data Analyst is responsible for supporting the operational and strategic needs of the Analytics & Business intelligence program, and providing data analytics/reporting services to a variety of operating units across business functions and international geographies.

Is this role right for you? In this role, you will:


Champions a customer focused culture to deepen client relationships and leverage broader Bank relationships, systems and knowledge.
Develops, deploys, and sustains data analytics / reporting solutions and associated data flows, in alignment with strategic and tactical needs of the business
Leads sessions with both technical and non-technical stakeholders to gather business requirements, identify root causes to problems, and recommend data solutions in support of business processes
Develops and maintains strong knowledge of operational policies and procedures across Canadian Banking, International Banking, and other Global Operations units
Actively contributes to ongoing projects and programs, ad-hoc initiatives, and partner workstreams across the GO Analytics & Business Intelligence service portfolio
Documents, analyzes and recommends improvements to existing business processes with the aim of increasing process efficiency, improving productivity and/or reducing costs
Understand how the Bank‚Äôs risk appetite and risk culture should be considered in day-to-day activities and decisions.
Actively pursues effective and efficient operations of their respective areas in accordance with Scotiabank‚Äôs Values, its Code of Conduct and the Global Sales Principles, while ensuring the adequacy, adherence to and effectiveness of day-to-day business controls to meet obligations with respect to operational, compliance, AML/ATF/sanctions and conduct risk.
Contributes to a high performance and inclusive work environment.


Skills

Do you have the skills that will enable you to succeed in this role? ‚Äì We‚Äôd love to work with you if you have:


Bachelor‚Äôs degree in engineering, business administration, finance, or another quantitative field (i.e. STEM)
3+ years of experience in data analytics, data engineering, and/or reporting in the financial services industry
Advanced knowledge of Power BI (DAX), Microsoft Excel (Power Query, Data modelling/Power Pivot, advanced formulas), and SharePoint (Data flow set up and maintenance)
Experience with SQL (preferably Microsoft SQL Server Management Studio, SSMS) in querying, structuring tables, and interacting with relational databases
Demonstrated experience in the following areas: dashboard development, operational and executive reporting, data analysis and visualization, KPI production, data management and governance
Strong interpersonal and communication skills; fluency in Spanish preferred
Ability to manage multi-dimensional projects and workstreams from concept to completion within a matrix environment and across business lines


Work Arrangement


Work in a standard office-based environment; non-standard hours are a common occurrence.


Interested?

At Scotiabank, every employee is empowered to reach their fullest potential, respected for who they are and, embraced for their differences. That is why we work to grow and diversify talent and engage employees in a performance-oriented culture.

What's in it for you?

Scotiabank wants you to be able to bring your best self to work ‚Äì and life, every day. With a focus on holistic well-being, our many flexible benefit programs are designed to help support your unique family, financial, physical, mental, and social health needs.

Location(s): Canada : Ontario : Mississauga

Scotiabank is a leading bank in the Americas. Guided by our purpose: "for every future", we help our customers, their families and their communities achieve success through a broad range of advice, products and services, including personal and commercial banking, wealth management and private banking, corporate and investment banking, and capital markets.

At Scotiabank, we value the unique skills and experiences each individual brings to the Bank, and are committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible environment for everyone. If you require accommodation (including, but not limited to, an accessible interview site, alternate format documents, ASL Interpreter, or Assistive Technology) during the recruitment and selection process, please let our Recruitment team know. If you require technical assistance, please click here. Candidates must apply directly online to be considered for this role. We thank all applicants for their interest in a career at Scotiabank; however, only those candidates who are selected for an interview will be contacted.

Title: Data Analyst, Reporting
Description:
Join Hotspex Media!

üôå #1 Ranked Media Buying and Planning Agency on Clutch.co

üî• Finalist 'Best AI Tool', 2024 Digiday Technology Awards

üéâ Deloitte Fast 500

Job Summary

Hotspex Media Agency seeks an experienced Data Analyst specializing in web analytics reporting to join our innovative team. This role requires a seasoned professional with over 2 years of experience in digital analytics and reporting, particularly with GA4 and Adobe Analytics. The successful candidate will play a crucial role in our data-driven decision-making processes, spearheading the creation and maintenance of insightful reports that support our clients' marketing strategies.

Job Responsibilities


Spearhead the creation and maintenance of comprehensive analytics reports using GA4 and Adobe Analytics to support various digital marketing campaigns.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify key metrics, performance indicators, and develop custom reporting solutions.
Conduct advanced data analysis to provide actionable insights and strategic recommendations for campaign optimization.
Design and implement automated reporting processes to streamline data collection and presentation across multiple analytics platforms.
Perform regular audits of reporting methodologies to ensure accuracy, consistency, and alignment with evolving analytics best practices.
Mentor junior team members on analytics tools, methodologies, and best practices.
Present data insights and recommendations to internal teams and clients, translating complex analytics into actionable business strategies.


Required Skills


Bachelor's degree in Marketing, Data Analytics, Statistics, Computer Science, or a related field.
Minimum of 2 years of experience in digital analytics and reporting, with proficiency in both GA4 and Adobe Analytics.
Advanced knowledge of digital marketing concepts, web analytics, and data visualization techniques.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with a proven track record of deriving actionable insights from complex datasets.
Expertise in data visualization tools such as Google Data Studio, Tableau, or PowerBI.
Proficiency in SQL and experience with BigQuery for advanced data analysis.
Excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to effectively convey technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.
Experience managing multiple projects and prioritizing effectively in a fast-paced environment.
Demonstrated ability to stay current with evolving analytics technologies and methodologies.


Our Values:

We know our people are what allows us to achieve all that we do and that‚Äôs why it‚Äôs important that everyone we bring onto our team lives our values with us.


ü¶Å Courage
1Ô∏è‚É£ One Team
üí™ Resilience
üöÄ Empowerment


Hotspex Media Inc. is an equal opportunity employer and values diversity in its workforce.

  • Experience managing multiple projects and prioritizing effectively in a fast-paced environment.
  • Demonstrated ability to stay current with evolving analytics technologies and methodologies.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
‚ÄúPBS is the fastest growing ‚ÄúAll Inclusive Business Platform‚Äù vendor in North America and we‚Äôve only just begun!‚Äù

The Opportunity

We are changing the way people buy and service cars one dealership at a time. In business for over 30 years, PBS is the third largest DMS (Dealership Management System) provider to the North American retail automotive industry. Each month we welcome hundreds of new users to our software platform, and we need your help.

We are unique in the industry because we view our customers as business partners, technology innovators, and friends. Our software can run all aspects of an automotive dealership with sales, service, inventory management, and accounting modules.

And that's where you come into the picture. While specific roles are posted, PBS is always open to pivoting with quality people and adding to the team based on your skills and the needs of our customers. After you join the team, we will continue the process of moving you into new roles based on your talents, growth, and interests.

The Role

PBS Systems is looking for an enthusiastic and organized individual to join our Data Conversions team. As a Data Analyst, you will deliver top quality knowledge and expertise to our clients who contact our call center for issues or service by providing them with immediate solutions to their issues, services, or escalating if necessary to other departments.

Based in our Calgary HQ office, this is a full time permanent position that provides you with the opportunity to expand your knowledge in a growing and established company.

This is not a remote work opportunity.

Job Responsibilities


Identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets
Ensure accuracy and integrity of data & applications through analysis, writing clear documentation and problem resolution
Acquiring data from primary or secondary data sources and maintaining databases
As a member of the Data Conversion team, the Data Analyst will be responsible for participating in the ETL (Extract, Transform and Load) for new clients into our software, will also be part of creating and maintaining ETL tools


Qualifications


High school diploma, college preferred
Beginner knowledge of SQL Database
Excellent communication, analytical and organizational skills
Effective self-starter and strong team player
Ability to embrace variety, structure, change and innovation
Ability to analyze a company‚Äôs big-picture data needs
Ability to troubleshoot and solve complex technical problems
Ability to work 40-hours per week with occasional Sunday work


What We Offer


Internal promotion and growth opportunities
An education department dedicated to helping you with professional and personal development
The opportunity to travel
Access to an onsite gym at some locations and/or corporate membership to Goodlife
Free parking
Staff events
Bonus for product certification up to $4,800 per year
Great referral bonus
Staff discounts with GM, Dell, and more


Should you be selected for an interview, you will be contacted via email. Please monitor your junk/spam folder.

PBS is an equal opportunity employer. Accommodations will be provided during the hiring process as required.

Title: Data Analyst - Fully remote
Description:
Scandinavian Building Services has been a Canadian leader in retail and commercial cleaning for the last 60 years. Starting as a small family owned and operated business in Edmonton Alberta in 1982 to offering full service janitorial and building maintenance across Canada today. We attribute our success to staying true to our core values of Service, Motivate, Respect, and Connect. As we continue to grow we are looking to add a Data Analyst to the Scandi Family!




** Please note candidates must be currently based in and legally able to work in Canada to be considered for this position **




What‚Äôs in it for you:

Awarded one of Canada‚Äôs Best Managed Companies: We‚Äôre committed to a high level standard of excellence for both clients and our Scandi Family.
Growth Opportunities: A place to hang your hat. We want our employees to grow with us long term.
Stability and Job Security: Even through tough economic times we‚Äôve continued to steadily grow, and we aren‚Äôt slowing down any time soon. With a strong national presence across Canada
Family First Culture: We are and have always been a family owned and operated business. We have family friendly events year-round and affectionately call our team members the Scandi Family.
Benefits: We offer a comprehensive medical and dental plan as well as personal days off.




What your day to day will look like:




Working permanently fully remote you will be reporting directly to our Business Intelligence Reporting Manager. Working Monday to Friday 8am ‚Äì 4:30pm EST.




Review, monitor, and analyze various reports including; KPI compliance on operational targets and compliance audits on all daily reports.
Improving Excel reporting templates for maximum efficiency on a continuous basis.
Maintain and edit KPI dashboards in Power BI on a continuous basis.
Utilizing field driven operational data from our industry specific system Lighthouse and following up with Account Manager on specific reports when needed.
Compile and forward reports on an ad hoc basis when needed.
All other duties as required.




What you‚Äôll need to succeed:

Minimum of 2 years experience in a previous Data Analyst role with previous experience with Power BI. Working with KPI‚Äôs, large scale data analysis, data cleansing and data reconciliations from multiple sources.
Post secondary education; diploma or degree in a relevant field. Happy to consider a mix of experience and education.
Must have advanced level Excel skills.
Strong knowledge of systems and data integrity.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills with the ability to demonstrate a sense of urgency in completing tasks.




What you can expect for our interview process:

20 minute preliminary phone interview with our Recruiter
20-40 minute assessment (depending on optional practice questions or breaks)
30 minute MS Teams video interview with the Hiring Manager and direct Supervisors for the role




At Scandinavian Building Services we are an equal opportunity employer who values a diverse workplace. We recognize the strength that comes from different experiences, backgrounds and perspectives and welcome all candidates to apply. We feel it is important that all people have access and opportunity to be employed, to be valued and to be respected.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Field Customer Support/Data Analyst

9 Month Contract + Extensions

100% Remote




** Looking for someone with an agriculture/farming background**




Job Summary: The Field Customer Support is a critical role responsible for ensuring the integrity and accuracy of asset data across multiple divisions. This position involves a combination of data verification, asset monitoring, and support activities that are essential for the smooth operation and optimization of our supply chain processes.

Key Responsibilities:

‚Ä¢ Conduct initial asset audits and collaborate with Division Administrators to clean and prepare asset lists for installation and tracking.

‚Ä¢ Verify and monitor asset data during installation and throughout the process to ensure accuracy and consistency.

‚Ä¢ Maintain data cleanliness for asset transfers, sales, and rental terms.

‚Ä¢ Compare and reconcile data across Systems of Record to ensure alignment with division asset lists.

‚Ä¢ Address data discrepancies in collaboration with the Optimization and Process Lead.

‚Ä¢ Track and verify asset numbers and movements post-ingestion in the DSC Front End.

‚Ä¢ Coordinate installation windows with Deere and Dealerships for hardware installation.

‚Ä¢ Manage and resolve any maintenance issues or discrepancies noted during asset installation.

‚Ä¢ Revisit and refine the onboarding process based on lessons learned to enhance efficiency.

‚Ä¢ Confirm the correct setup of each Division‚Äôs branches in the JD OPS Center.

‚Ä¢ Provide feedback to the Field Point of Contact Lead, Product Owner, and Project Manager regarding any defects or enhancements.

‚Ä¢ Transition divisions to the Optimization Lead once monthly data verification is complete.

‚Ä¢ Develop Standard Operating Procedures tailored to the needs of the field, fleet, and agronomy.

‚Ä¢ Support the field in maximizing the use of JD Op Centre and Ag Logic.

‚Ä¢ Notify the Field Point of Contact Lead when Division asset lists are clean and installations are complete.

‚Ä¢ Liaise with the Hardware Lead on any M-Modem challenges or data gaps.

‚Ä¢ Facilitate User Acceptance Testing and coordinate field testing efforts.

‚Ä¢ Train and support all RTK-based activities and promote the value of RTK to divisions.

Must Haves

‚Ä¢ High Energy and passionate personality

‚Ä¢ Proven experience in data management and support. (Excel skills are required)

‚Ä¢ Agricultural experience

‚Ä¢ Strong organizational and communication skills.

‚Ä¢ Ability to work collaboratively with various teams and stakeholders.

‚Ä¢ Knowledge of JD Op Centre, Ag Logic, or RTK technologies is a plus.

‚Ä¢ Willingness to travel to different divisions as required.

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Our mission is to provide a secure, valuable, and sustainable workplace retirement solutions for Canadians. At CAAT, we live our values of integrity, impact, and teamwork every day.




The Senior Data Analyst is integral to the success of the Business Development Research & Data team, and to CAAT‚Äôs guiding mission and growth strategy.




This role‚Äôs primary focus will be data management and reporting to assist the Pension Solutions team in proactively managing relationships with external organizations and reporting on activities. The role provides additional support in performing research and documenting processes as required.




The role works closely with the Manager, Business Development Research & Data and guides the team‚Äôs other analysts and co-op students in a fast-paced environment with concurrent deliverables.




We are looking for someone with:

A degree or diploma in data management, data analytics, statistics, or a related field.
At least five (5) years of experience in data analysis, preferably within the pension or finance sectors.
Experience with Salesforce and either holding or working towards Salesforce certification.
Proven ability to manage multiple tasks efficiently, set priorities, and oversee team projects independently.
Familiarity with CRM tools and/or Power BI is a plus.
Exceptional attention to detail and accuracy.
Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite, with advanced Excel skills.
A knack for innovative thinking and problem-solving.
Knowledge of pension plans, group benefits, or labor relations is advantageous.
Strong written and verbal communication skills.




The successful candidate will demonstrate:

Excellent organizational skills with a proactive and solution-oriented approach to task and project management.
Effective communication and training skills, with the ability to convey complex information clearly.
A strategic mindset and resourcefulness in addressing challenges and improving processes.
Dedication to CAAT‚Äôs values and organizational culture, including integrity, teamwork, respect, and optimism.




Once here you will:

Guide the team in maintaining, processing, and analyzing stakeholder data, ensuring accuracy and attention to detail.
Train and support new team members and internal stakeholders on tools and processes, providing clear documentation and updates.
Analyze and report on key performance indicators to support strategic initiatives and inform decision-making.
Investigate and implement improvements in Salesforce, working with relevant teams to develop and test new features.
Develop and apply best practices to enhance department efficiency and effectiveness, contributing to process improvements.
Coordinate with internal teams on various projects, initiatives, and training efforts, ensuring effective communication and documentation.
Review and provide feedback on the work of data analysts and co-op students, ensuring high-quality outputs.
Conduct research to address data gaps and support organizational needs, contributing to a comprehensive understanding of data requirements.




Step into CAAT - where your work is both rewarding and meaningful, growth is a constant, fun is the way we roll, and your impact is real! If you meet most of the criteria above, we would love to connect with you.




Our commitment to you as a CAATster:




We‚Äôre about growing together and creating impact in a collaborative and caring environment!




Comprehensive & Holistic Care: Your dedication deserves appreciation! At CAAT, we celebrate the complete you, prioritizing your well-being above all. Our all-encompassing employee programs are designed to cater to every aspect of your life and well-being, ensuring you feel cherished and valued. We provide a competitive Total Rewards program based around your physical, mental, and financial wellness. This includes, but is not limited to, your compensation, paid time off, health and dental benefits, wellness programs, wellness incentives, and (of course) a defined benefit pension plan.




Growth Opportunities: Embrace a vibrant, ever-evolving environment at CAAT, where growth is not just a goal, but our way of life! We're expanding and transforming constantly, which means endless opportunities for you to adapt, innovate, and learn. As we grow, so do you. Let‚Äôs make a difference together!




A Culture of Collaboration and Fun: We're a team that works, grows, and celebrates together. At CAAT, you belong to a collaborative, inclusive and lively environment that sparks creativity and fosters open communication.




Making a Difference, Together: We're on a mission to secure a better future for Canadians. Your meaningful contributions go beyond the workplace, touching lives and making a significant societal impact. Work that truly counts!




But don't just take our word for it! We‚Äôve consistently been recognized as one of Canada's Most Admired Corporate Cultures, as one of Greater Toronto's Top Employers, and one of the Best Places to Work.

Learn more about us by visiting www.caatpension.ca/careers

Diversity, Equity, Inclusion, and Belonging:

Diversity, Equity, Inclusion, and Belonging (DEIB) at CAAT means we respect and value the broadest range of experiences, geographies, gender, ethnicities, backgrounds, and perspectives as key elements of our culture. Our vision is to provide an environment where employees can bring their best, professional, authentic, selves to work.




CAAT Pension Plan is an equal opportunity employer, and we will accommodate any needs under the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act and the Ontario Human Rights Code. Hiring processes will be modified to remove barriers to accommodate those with disabilities, if requested. Should any applicant require accommodation through the application processes, please contact us at hr@caatpension.ca or call Human Resources at 416-673-9000for assistance.

  • Excellent organizational skills with a proactive and solution-oriented approach to task and project management.
  • Effective communication and training skills, with the ability to convey complex information clearly.
  • A strategic mindset and resourcefulness in addressing challenges and improving processes.
  • Dedication to CAAT‚Äôs values and organizational culture, including integrity, teamwork, respect, and optimism.


Once here you will:

  • Guide the team in maintaining, processing, and analyzing stakeholder data, ensuring accuracy and attention to detail.
  • Train and support new team members and internal stakeholders on tools and processes, providing clear documentation and updates.
  • Analyze and report on key performance indicators to support strategic initiatives and inform decision-making.
  • Investigate and implement improvements in Salesforce, working with relevant teams to develop and test new features.
  • Develop and apply best practices to enhance department efficiency and effectiveness, contributing to process improvements.
  • Coordinate with internal teams on various projects, initiatives, and training efforts, ensuring effective communication and documentation.
  • Review and provide feedback on the work of data analysts and co-op students, ensuring high-quality outputs.
  • Conduct research to address data gaps and support organizational needs, contributing to a comprehensive understanding of data requirements.


Step into CAAT - where your work is both rewarding and meaningful, growth is a constant, fun is the way we roll, and your impact is real! If you meet most of the criteria above, we would love to connect with you.


Our commitment to you as a CAATster:


We‚Äôre about growing together and creating impact in a collaborative and caring environment!


Comprehensive & Holistic Care: Your dedication deserves appreciation! At CAAT, we celebrate the complete you, prioritizing your well-being above all. Our all-encompassing employee programs are designed to cater to every aspect of your life and well-being, ensuring you feel cherished and valued. We provide a competitive Total Rewards program based around your physical, mental, and financial wellness. This includes, but is not limited to, your compensation, paid time off, health and dental benefits, wellness programs, wellness incentives, and (of course) a defined benefit pension plan.


Growth Opportunities: Embrace a vibrant, ever-evolving environment at CAAT, where growth is not just a goal, but our way of life! We're expanding and transforming constantly, which means endless opportunities for you to adapt, innovate, and learn. As we grow, so do you. Let‚Äôs make a difference together!


A Culture of Collaboration and Fun: We're a team that works, grows, and celebrates together. At CAAT, you belong to a collaborative, inclusive and lively environment that sparks creativity and fosters open communication.


Making a Difference, Together: We're on a mission to secure a better future for Canadians. Your meaningful contributions go beyond the workplace, touching lives and making a significant societal impact. Work that truly counts!


But don't just take our word for it! We‚Äôve consistently been recognized as one of Canada's Most Admired Corporate Cultures, as one of Greater Toronto's Top Employers, and one of the Best Places to Work.

Learn more about us by visiting www.caatpension.ca/careers

Diversity, Equity, Inclusion, and Belonging:

Diversity, Equity, Inclusion, and Belonging (DEIB) at CAAT means we respect and value the broadest range of experiences, geographies, gender, ethnicities, backgrounds, and perspectives as key elements of our culture. Our vision is to provide an environment where employees can bring their best, professional, authentic, selves to work.


CAAT Pension Plan is an equal opportunity employer, and we will accommodate any needs under the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act and the Ontario Human Rights Code. Hiring processes will be modified to remove barriers to accommodate those with disabilities, if requested. Should any applicant require accommodation through the application processes, please contact us at hr@caatpension.ca or call Human Resources at 416-673-9000for assistance.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Position Description

Are you ready to join an outstanding culture that cares about diversity and inclusion, corporate social responsibility and gives the freedom to innovate, influence decisions, and chart an exciting career?

CGI is more than just an IT consulting company; be part of a team that supports the local community with the ability draw on global best-in-class talent. CGI is looking for a Data Analyst for its expanding team to assist our clients with their data and analytics journey. Benefits include a share purchase program, profit sharing, wellness credits, training and development programs, and flexible work schedules and locations.

The responsibilities and requirements that follow provide insight into what a Member at CGI will typically experience in this role and the characteristics they have that lead to success. We are looking for candidates that have a similar mix of experience and qualifications. These are individuals who have a passion to create value for clients by helping them unlock the value in their data assets.

Your future duties and responsibilities


Solve challenging and impactful problems using your data expertise, and ability to communicate compelling insight through data visualizations, reports, and dashboards
Help create the platform, tools, and APIs necessary to enable other teams to work with data
Efficiently handle vast amounts of data from multiple sources and destinations, including relational and NoSQL databases as well as external systems, both in batch processing and real-time delivery
Work on high priority initiatives using advanced analytics, predictive modeling, and data from a variety of data sources to produce actionable business insights
Provide guidance to a customer and project team with respect to technical feasibility, complexity, and level of effort required to deliver a solution
Work closely with other team members to further develop metrics, KPIs, and insights that measure business performance improvements
Assist in the development and delivery of pre and post sales POCs (proof of concept), presentations and proposals for client engagements
Analytical curiosity, strong data-oriented skills, and a statistical programming background


Education:


Bachelor's degree in mathematics, business, statistics, economics, computer science or information systems (or equivalent combination of skill and experience)


Build your career with us:

As digital transformation continues to accelerate, CGI is at the center of this change‚Äîsupporting our clients‚Äô digital journeys and offering our professionals exciting career opportunities.

At CGI, our success comes from the talent and commitment of our professionals. As one team, we share the challenges and rewards that come from growing our company, which reinforces our culture of ownership. All of our professionals benefit from the value we collectively create.

Be part of building one of the largest independent technology and business services firms in the world.

Learn more about CGI at www.cgi.com.

No unsolicited agency referrals please.

CGI is an equal opportunity employer. In addition, CGI is committed to providing accommodations for people with disabilities in accordance with provincial legislation. Please let us know if you require a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during any aspect of the recruitment process and we will work with you to address your needs.

Required Qualifications To Be Successful In This Role


Experience doing data analysis, reporting and advanced analytical modeling
Hands on experience in deploying reporting and analytical solutions to on premise and cloud-based infrastructure
Hands-on experience writing complex SQL queries and working with relational databases such as Oracle, DB2, SQL Server, etc.
Hands-on experience with data reporting and visualization tools like Power BI, Tableau, Qlik‚Ä¶etc.
Experience with modern software development techniques and methodologies: DevSecOps, Agile, etc.
Knowledge and practice of secure software development processes


Attributes:


Up to date with the latest technology trends and have a strong desire to constantly learn
Highly detailed-oriented with exceptional organizational and follow-through skills
Self-starter and able to execute without a lot of direction or oversight - demonstrable problem-solving skills
Value teamwork and urgency, with a passion for driving impact
Ability to handle multiple priorities and deadlines
Exceptional communication skills, with an ability to make technical concepts accessible and understandable to non-technical business users


Together, as owners, let‚Äôs turn meaningful insights into action.

Life at CGI is rooted in ownership, teamwork, respect and belonging. Here, you‚Äôll reach your full potential because‚Ä¶

You are invited to be an owner from day 1 as we work together to bring our Dream to life. That‚Äôs why we call ourselves CGI Partners rather than employees. We benefit from our collective success and actively shape our company‚Äôs strategy and direction.

Your work creates value. You‚Äôll develop innovative solutions and build relationships with teammates and clients while accessing global capabilities to scale your ideas, embrace new opportunities, and benefit from expansive industry and technology expertise.

You‚Äôll shape your career by joining a company built to grow and last. You‚Äôll be supported by leaders who care about your health and well-being and provide you with opportunities to deepen your skills and broaden your horizons.

At CGI, we recognize the richness that diversity brings. We strive to create a work culture where all belong and collaborate with clients in building more inclusive communities. As an equal-opportunity employer, we want to empower all our members to succeed and grow. If you require an accommodation at any point during the recruitment process, please let us know. We will be happy to assist.

Come join our team‚Äîone of the largest IT and business consulting services firms in the world.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About The Company




At BiblioCommons, we build SaaS solutions for public libraries directly impacting the lives of millions and fostering learning, literacy and culture within the digital world. We are constantly improving our products through user research, client interaction, and the input of our creative staff.

BiblioCommons offers an opportunity to work in an environment that combines the challenges and complexity of large-scale, data-intensive applications with the creativity and fun of a sophisticated consumer web offering, central to the daily web interactions of millions of users.

We‚Äôre a highly collaborative team that applies innovative solutions to challenging problems. We‚Äôre committed to doing things right and always looking for ways to do them better. We take the time to optimize and redesign systems to ensure they are robust and scalable.




Job Summary:

We are looking for a Data Analyst to work with our Data Engineering team and provide support in completing a variety of functions relating to new data and reporting initiatives.




Job Description:

We are looking for a Data Analyst to work with our Data Engineering team and provide support in completing a variety of functions relating to new data and reporting initiatives.

The position will be responsible for aggregating data from multiple sources and turning it into insightful, actionable reporting.




How you‚Äôll make an impact:

Turn large data sets into relevant, actionable reporting that is easy to understand.
Design and create visual reports for internal and external stakeholders.
Hypothesize about and analyze data to gain insights on past and future library user trends.
Collaborate with the team to develop and productize new data reports from user and library data.
Take part in requirements analysis directly with customers.
Develop reporting and visualizations for customers and internal use.
Contribute towards establishing data best practices at BiblioCommons.




This is a remote 6-month contract role based out of Canada.







What you bring to the team:

Bachelor‚Äôs degree in computer science, Information Systems, or a related field.
3+ years of experience in data analysis, BI reporting, and visualization.
Strong SQL skills.
Understanding of databases and data modelling, including understanding of interdependencies across database tables and attributes.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with a keen attention to detail.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to work effectively in a team environment.
Familiarity with Agile development methodologies is a plus.




Bonus points for experience with:

GA4 and its BigQuery data model
Apache Superset, PowerBI, or similar visualization tools
GCP data services (ie. BigQuery, Cloud Composer, etc) or AWS equivalents
Data analysis and statistics tools (ie. R, Pandas, Statsmodels, etc)
Modelling and data quality tools (ie. DBT, Great Expectations, or similar)
Dagster, Airflow, or other data orchestration frameworks




BiblioCommons is an equal opportunity employer, we recruit, hire, train, promote and provide all other privileges of employment to qualified people without regard to age, race, colour, creed, national origin, gender, gender identity, gender expression, disability, marital status, citizenship status, ethnicity, familial status, religion, sexual orientation or any other classification for which discrimination is prohibited.

Title: Data Analyst / Engineer
Description:
Data SEA Consulting ‚Äì Data Analyst




Company Description

Data SEA Consulting focuses on helping mid-sized businesses harness the power of their data by leveraging the latest analytics tools and techniques. We work with Private Equity Funds and Independent Business Owners to find the unique data solutions that will drive the most value for their business. After creating the data strategy and proposing solutions, we use our technical expertise to execute on building out these solutions into analytics infrastructure and tools that can help drive the business forward.




For more information about Data SEA, please visit our website: dataseaconsulting.com




If you are passionate about working with data, delivering great analytics solutions, and solving challenging problems, then we would love to hear from you.




Job Description

In this role as a full-time Data Analyst, you will work with members of the Data SEA team to design, develop and deploy high-quality data solutions and data infrastructure that will drive value for our clients‚Äô businesses.




Responsibilities

Directly engage with clients to lead the implementation of analytics solutions, ensuring a successful user experience.
Assist in the design and development of data architecture to optimize data flow, storage, and accessibility, meeting business needs and improving decision-making processes.
Construct robust Data Pipelines to efficiently transfer data from source systems to a centralized Data Lakehouse, utilizing best practices in Data Engineering and implementing a medallion architecture
Oversee the training, deployment, and monitoring of Machine Learning models, ensuring they provide accurate and timely predictions
Help in establishing and managing data governance policies to maintain data integrity, quality, and security, while ensuring compliance with data access and usage regulations
Create data visualizations and analyses by merging various data sets to present key insights through different reporting techniques
Dive into clients' data and develop strategic plans to maximize value for clients, balancing hands-on work with big-picture thinking
Innovate by prototyping new frameworks and technologies, enabling Data SEA to rapidly equip its clients with state-of-the-art infrastructure




Qualifications

Should Have

A background in computer science and/or relevant work experience in the field of Data Analytics, Data Engineering and/or Data Science
Ability to pick up new technologies with ease
A strong SQL knowledge and experience working with relational databases
Experience with object-oriented & functional scripting languages such as Python
A history of manipulating, processing, and extracting value from large, disconnected datasets
A natural curiosity about how to improve systems and processes
A keen interest in learning about our clients' businesses and a passion for finding the right solutions
Strong oral and written communication skills
Experience working with Power BI, Tableau, and/or Looker




Nice to Have

Experience with Databricks
Experience working on AWS, Azure, and/or Google Cloud infrastructure
Experience working in a Dev, UAT and Prod configuration when writing and deploying code
Experience in applying Data Engineering best practices to create robust data pipelines and implement a medallion architecture for efficient data storage and retrieval.
A solid understanding of Data Architecture best practices, including data modeling techniques, design principles for data warehousing and lakes, and strategies for data integration and lifecycle management to build robust and scalable data ecosystems.
Knowledge and experience in implementing Data Governance best practices, including developing and enforcing data policies, standards, and procedures to ensure data accuracy, consistency, and security, while promoting compliant data usage and management.
Proficiency in Machine Learning best practices, including approaches to training, deploying, tuning, and monitoring Machine Learning models for optimal performance and accuracy.




What You Can Expect from Us

At Data SEA Consulting, we are passionate about finding the right people and helping them grow so that they can help us solve the complex analytical problems that we tackle on behalf of our clients. As a key member of a small but growing team, you would receive extensive 1:1 coaching and the chance to work on a wide variety of projects across a number of different industries.

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst
Description:
Role: Business Intelligence Analyst

Job Type: Contract

Rate: up to $70 CAD per hour

Location: Canada (Remote)

Sector: Veterinary

Contact: Lucy.davies@forsythbarnes.com

Overview:

Forsyth Barnes is partnered with a Giant in the Veterinary space! As the Business intelligence analyst, you will be at the front and centre of their global payment migration project! your primary responsibility will be collecting and analysing data to identify trends and patterns that inform future business decisions, Designing data analysis methodologies and compiling reports to present to senior management & stakeholders whilst fostering collaboration with cross-functional teams.

Requirements:

MUST be based in Canada. And able to work EST time zone.
strong communication skills & soft skills able to use initiative and clear solutions of dashboarding
Extensive experience in Power BI
Extensive experience in DAX
Extensive experience in M code
Advanced in Excel
Self-starter who is able to work independently
Proven track record of stakeholder engagement
Experience in facilitating and leading coaching sessions
Strong background in either Healthcare or pet healthcare industry

If you are interested, please apply by emailing me with a copy of your most up-to-date Profile.

Please feel free to pass this on to anyone you think it may suit / anyone you know who may be interested.

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst
Place: Regional Municipality of York, Ontario, Canada
Description:
About telMAX Inc.:

telMAX has been designing and building a cutting-edge telecommunications platform using the most advanced technology available. Recognized for two consecutive years as Canada‚Äôs Fastest ISP, telMAX has ambitious plans to bring its 100% fibre networks to residential and business customers in Ontario.




Your Position & How You Will Contribute:

Based in York Region in a hybrid working environment ‚Äì Reporting to the Corporate Applications Manager, the Business Intelligence Analyst will be creating and managing dashboards (PowerBI), corporate level reporting, providing valuable insights into metrics/user behaviors, and identifying areas for growth. They will be utilizing their expertise to transform data sets into compelling visualizations such as graphs, maps and charts.







Responsibilities & Key Duties include:




Responsibilities:

Analyze business information requirements and develop proposed solutions.
Collaborate with teams to gather requirements and ensure applications meet business needs.
Design and develop data models, dashboards, reports and presentations to effectively communicate findings.
Develop and maintain Power BI elements including reports, dashboards and datasets.
Prepare and update documentation for applications, processes, and procedures and reporting catalogue.
Present findings and recommendations to senior management and other key stakeholders.
Write complex SQL queries.
Assist in training end-users on application functionalities and best practices.
Supports the business on KPI development and analysis.
Manage relevant KPI‚Äôs (including sales, revenue, work orders, productivity).
Conduct quality checks on visual content to ensure accuracy, consistency and adherence to brand guidelines




Attributes:

Advanced knowledge of Microsoft Office products (Word, Excel, PowerPoint)
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.
Experience developing and implementing enterprise-scale reports and dashboards
Ability to work independently and as part of a team in a dynamic environment.
Strong written and verbal communications skills, with an ability to effectively communicate and problem solve with different parts of the business.
Attention to detail and high aptitude for problem solving
Very high personal standards, with an ethical approach to work, and a commitment to honesty and integrity.
Capable team player with an ability to independently prioritize and problem solve.
Commitment to excellence and transparency in maintaining relationships with internal and external stakeholders.
Knowledge of telecommunications industry standards and practices is a plus.







Education:

Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Software Engineering or a related field (or comparable).




Experience:

+1 year experience with BI tools (proficiency in PowerBI dashboard creation and maintenance)
+1 year of hands-on coding in SQL
+1 year of experience as an Applications Analyst or similar role.




Why you Should Join telMAX Inc.

We are a dynamic organization that is growing and you don‚Äôt want to miss out on the fun.

We offer a competitive compensation package!

Flexible working environment, yes you can work from home or the office‚Ä¶ what works for you?
Benefits (Medical, Dental, and Vision)
Health Spending Account (HSA)
RRSP matching program
Bonuses
And so much more‚Ä¶

telMAX has been designing and building a cutting-edge telecommunications platform using the most advanced technology available. Recognized for two consecutive years as Canada‚Äôs Fastest ISP, telMAX has ambitious plans to bring its 100% fibre networks to residential and business customers in Ontario.


Your Position & How You Will Contribute:

Based in York Region in a hybrid working environment ‚Äì Reporting to the Corporate Applications Manager, the Business Intelligence Analyst will be creating and managing dashboards (PowerBI), corporate level reporting, providing valuable insights into metrics/user behaviors, and identifying areas for growth. They will be utilizing their expertise to transform data sets into compelling visualizations such as graphs, maps and charts.



Responsibilities & Key Duties include:


Responsibilities:

  • Analyze business information requirements and develop proposed solutions.
  • Collaborate with teams to gather requirements and ensure applications meet business needs.
  • Design and develop data models, dashboards, reports and presentations to effectively communicate findings.
  • Develop and maintain Power BI elements including reports, dashboards and datasets.
  • Prepare and update documentation for applications, processes, and procedures and reporting catalogue.
  • Present findings and recommendations to senior management and other key stakeholders.
  • Write complex SQL queries.
  • Assist in training end-users on application functionalities and best practices.
  • Supports the business on KPI development and analysis.
  • Manage relevant KPI‚Äôs (including sales, revenue, work orders, productivity).
  • Conduct quality checks on visual content to ensure accuracy, consistency and adherence to brand guidelines


Attributes:

  • Advanced knowledge of Microsoft Office products (Word, Excel, PowerPoint)
  • Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.
  • Experience developing and implementing enterprise-scale reports and dashboards
  • Ability to work independently and as part of a team in a dynamic environment.
  • Strong written and verbal communications skills, with an ability to effectively communicate and problem solve with different parts of the business.
  • Attention to detail and high aptitude for problem solving
  • Very high personal standards, with an ethical approach to work, and a commitment to honesty and integrity.
  • Capable team player with an ability to independently prioritize and problem solve.
  • Commitment to excellence and transparency in maintaining relationships with internal and external stakeholders.
  • Knowledge of telecommunications industry standards and practices is a plus.



Education:

  • Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Software Engineering or a related field (or comparable).


Experience:

  • +1 year experience with BI tools (proficiency in PowerBI dashboard creation and maintenance)
  • +1 year of hands-on coding in SQL
  • +1 year of experience as an Applications Analyst or similar role.


Why you Should Join telMAX Inc.

We are a dynamic organization that is growing and you don‚Äôt want to miss out on the fun.
