Title: Data Analyst
Description:
SUMMARY STATEMENT

We offer an exciting role within our Insights team for an individual seeking to combine their strong data management, analytical and visualisation capabilities within a genuinely global environment and to advance their career with technical development and leadership opportunities.




This role will be responsible for managing the delivery of outputs for multiple Global Insights programmes; with the aim of ultimately being able to manage and run a complete programme. The position will work closely with a team of programmers to support consultants in the analysis and delivery of insights to our clients. It is expected that the incumbent will contribute project experience, research and analysis skills to the team.




KEY RESPONSIBILITIES

Own and manage the analysis and reporting of assigned insights programmes

Analyse survey data using descriptive and inferential statistics (SAS)
Summarise analyses through professional looking charts shown in static reports (PowerPoint) and interactive dashboards (PowerBI)
Deliver insights to clients (internal and external) showing trends and action areas
Manage survey data from different sources ‚Äì face-to-face interviews, online and phone studies. This includes data import, storage, review and cleansing




Interact proactively and positively with programme managers and colleagues from other areas of NMG to gain better understanding of the various programmes and deliver accurate outputs

Create and maintain continuous improvement actions
Review and enhance codes and data structure for more efficient work flow




Applying a creative and curious mindset, applying new and evolving approaches to improve the effectiveness and efficiencies of our insights studies




Living the NMG Values of Collaboration, Make it Count, Curiosity and ‚ÄòGo for it!‚Äô




YOUR EXPERIENCE

The successful candidate for this role will be able to demonstrate:

Qualifications & Experience

The ideal candidate should:

have hands-on experience in using MS Power BI, and related MS technologies
have at least 1 year of practical knowledge and expertise of SAS (Base or EG) and in using SQL and macros. Practical SAS programming expertise is a MUST.
have experience in the gathering and documenting of business logics/methodologies
have strong visualisation skills (dashboard and/or graph designing)
have a strong academic performance




The following are also valued:

Knowledge in other programming languages like Python and R
UI/UX experience
Experience in analysing and reporting survey data




Competencies

Outstanding communication skills at all levels - able to build excellent working relationships with clients, team members and other stakeholders
Ability to solve problems effectively, think creatively and deliver quality outputs in a timely manner
Ability to make decisions independently in a fast-paced environment
Excellent attention to detail
Excellent organizational, prioritization and time management skills
Fast and keen learner ‚Äì able to work individually and in a team




ABOUT NMG

The NMG Group is a global advisory and intermediary firm focused exclusively on the financial services sector. Established in 1992, NMG has enjoyed rapid expansion internationally and now has over 800 employees in 18 cities worldwide. Our guiding principle is to always ‚ÄòFind a Better Way‚Äô.




NMG Consulting is a leading multinational insurance, reinsurance and investments consultancy, integrating consulting, insights and analytics. Our consultants provide strategy consulting, insights, analytics and actuarial services to financial institutions including banks, insurers, reinsurers and fund managers.




We are constantly evolving and the range of work that we do challenges and expands our peoples‚Äô knowledge at lightning speed. Our flat, team-based structures encourage participation from all experience levels ‚Äì everyone is encouraged to contribute, regardless of their role. We advocate hearing different points of view, collaboration and constructive debate.

Show more
HTML:
SUMMARY STATEMENT

We offer an exciting role within our Insights team for an individual seeking to combine their strong data management, analytical and visualisation capabilities within a genuinely global environment and to advance their career with technical development and leadership opportunities.


This role will be responsible for managing the delivery of outputs for multiple Global Insights programmes; with the aim of ultimately being able to manage and run a complete programme. The position will work closely with a team of programmers to support consultants in the analysis and delivery of insights to our clients. It is expected that the incumbent will contribute project experience, research and analysis skills to the team.


KEY RESPONSIBILITIES

Own and manage the analysis and reporting of assigned insights programmes

  • Analyse survey data using descriptive and inferential statistics (SAS)
  • Summarise analyses through professional looking charts shown in static reports (PowerPoint) and interactive dashboards (PowerBI)
  • Deliver insights to clients (internal and external) showing trends and action areas
  • Manage survey data from different sources ‚Äì face-to-face interviews, online and phone studies. This includes data import, storage, review and cleansing


Interact proactively and positively with programme managers and colleagues from other areas of NMG to gain better understanding of the various programmes and deliver accurate outputs

  • Create and maintain continuous improvement actions
  • Review and enhance codes and data structure for more efficient work flow


Applying a creative and curious mindset, applying new and evolving approaches to improve the effectiveness and efficiencies of our insights studies


Living the NMG Values of Collaboration, Make it Count, Curiosity and ‚ÄòGo for it!‚Äô


YOUR EXPERIENCE

The successful candidate for this role will be able to demonstrate:

Qualifications & Experience

The ideal candidate should:

  • have hands-on experience in using MS Power BI, and related MS technologies
  • have at least 1 year of practical knowledge and expertise of SAS (Base or EG) and in using SQL and macros. Practical SAS programming expertise is a MUST.
  • have experience in the gathering and documenting of business logics/methodologies
  • have strong visualisation skills (dashboard and/or graph designing)
  • have a strong academic performance


The following are also valued:

  • Knowledge in other programming languages like Python and R
  • UI/UX experience
  • Experience in analysing and reporting survey data


Competencies

  • Outstanding communication skills at all levels - able to build excellent working relationships with clients, team members and other stakeholders
  • Ability to solve problems effectively, think creatively and deliver quality outputs in a timely manner
  • Ability to make decisions independently in a fast-paced environment
  • Excellent attention to detail
  • Excellent organizational, prioritization and time management skills
  • Fast and keen learner ‚Äì able to work individually and in a team


ABOUT NMG

The NMG Group is a global advisory and intermediary firm focused exclusively on the financial services sector. Established in 1992, NMG has enjoyed rapid expansion internationally and now has over 800 employees in 18 cities worldwide. Our guiding principle is to always ‚ÄòFind a Better Way‚Äô.


NMG Consulting is a leading multinational insurance, reinsurance and investments consultancy, integrating consulting, insights and analytics. Our consultants provide strategy consulting, insights, analytics and actuarial services to financial institutions including banks, insurers, reinsurers and fund managers.


We are constantly evolving and the range of work that we do challenges and expands our peoples‚Äô knowledge at lightning speed. Our flat, team-based structures encourage participation from all experience levels ‚Äì everyone is encouraged to contribute, regardless of their role. We advocate hearing different points of view, collaboration and constructive debate.

Title: Analyst, Data Solutions
Description:
About Klick Health

Meet a different kind of workplace. Klick Health is an ecosystem of brilliant minds working to realize the full potential of their people and clients in life sciences since 1997. And we‚Äôre still growing fast, even after two decades. What does that mean for you? As Klick experiences exponential growth year-over-year, so do the people who help make it happen. Because we‚Äôre constantly evolving and changing, we invest in talent early and often, to develop future leaders at all levels. We‚Äôre one of the country‚Äôs Top 10 Great Workplaces, 10 Most Inspiring Cultures, Best Workplace for Innovators, Best Managed, and Fastest Growing. We know that career paths are seldom simple and straightforward. And that's an asset. If you feel like you'd be a good fit for this role, we encourage you to apply and take the first steps to starting your career journey at Klick!

As part of our Analytics team, you'll be at the forefront of the big data revolution, guiding marketing strategies for our diverse range of clients. If you're ready to unleash your creativity and expertise in a fast-paced environment, we invite you to embark on your career journey with us at Klick.

As an integral part of our forward-thinking team, you'll collaborate closely with top-tier professionals to design, develop, and maintain cutting-edge data solutions. Embrace the challenge of handling growing datasets and navigating the ever-evolving media landscape, all while pushing the boundaries of digital transformation.

This role isn't just about crunching numbers ‚Äì it's about driving real impact by merging data solutions into client engagements and marketing sciences products. You'll work hand-in-hand with stakeholders to craft tailored solutions that meet our clients' unique needs, all while showcasing your expertise in both individual and team settings. Your code will serve as the bedrock of our service offering, ensuring optimal performance and maintenance of our systems.

But it's not just about technical prowess ‚Äì we're seeking individuals with insatiable curiosity, a drive to challenge the status quo, and a passion for uncovering insights that drive real change. If you're ready to dive deep, tackle complex challenges, and share your discoveries with peers and clients alike, then come join us on the forefront of analytics innovation. At Klick, your love for data will be celebrated and your potential truly unleashed.

Responsibilities:


Work in a collaborative manner and Interact with other analytic team members, Data Analysts, Project Managers, and Business Analysts to learn project data needs and define project scope
Design, develop, optimize, and maintain data architecture and pipelines that adhere to ETL principles and business goals (Python and SQL)
Maintain enterprise data warehouse (Snowflake preferred but not required)
Build analytic products in the form of presentations, data outputs, system integrations, business intelligence platforms, and AI outputs
Foster a culture of sharing, re-use, design for scale stability, and operational efficiency of code, queries, and data engineering processes (Git Management, SOP creation, Requirement Maintenance)



Qualifications:


4-5 years‚Äô of hands-on practical experience with a minimum of 2 years‚Äô of experience in ETL processing to be used for data analysis and modeling
Minimum 2 years of working knowledge in Python and SQL is a must
Experience working with clickstream data sets and data lakes is a must
Ability to gather requirements from non technical stakeholders and clients
Experience with Business Intelligence platforms such as Power BI, Microsoft Fabric, and Tableau



Bonus Points!


Healthcare experience
Post-secondary education in computer science
Demonstrate working knowledge in database design and management



Klick is consciously creating a culture where everyone can thrive and grow in their careers. We believe that our best work comes from our diverse backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. We strongly encourage members of historically underrepresented communities to apply, including Black people, Indigenous peoples, and other people of colour, people with disabilities, people from gender and sexually diverse communities and people with intersectional identities.

We‚Äôre also committed to developing an inclusive, barrier-free recruitment process and work environment. Should you require any accommodation, please contact us at careers@klick.com and we will work with you to meet your accessibility needs and ensure you have a positive experience.

Title: Data Analyst, Reporting
Description:
Join Hotspex Media!

üôå #1 Ranked Media Buying and Planning Agency on Clutch.co

üî• Finalist 'Best AI Tool', 2024 Digiday Technology Awards

üéâ Deloitte Fast 500

Job Summary

Hotspex Media Agency seeks an experienced Data Analyst specializing in web analytics reporting to join our innovative team. This role requires a seasoned professional with over 2 years of experience in digital analytics and reporting, particularly with GA4 and Adobe Analytics. The successful candidate will play a crucial role in our data-driven decision-making processes, spearheading the creation and maintenance of insightful reports that support our clients' marketing strategies.

Job Responsibilities


Spearhead the creation and maintenance of comprehensive analytics reports using GA4 and Adobe Analytics to support various digital marketing campaigns.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify key metrics, performance indicators, and develop custom reporting solutions.
Conduct advanced data analysis to provide actionable insights and strategic recommendations for campaign optimization.
Design and implement automated reporting processes to streamline data collection and presentation across multiple analytics platforms.
Perform regular audits of reporting methodologies to ensure accuracy, consistency, and alignment with evolving analytics best practices.
Mentor junior team members on analytics tools, methodologies, and best practices.
Present data insights and recommendations to internal teams and clients, translating complex analytics into actionable business strategies.


Required Skills


Bachelor's degree in Marketing, Data Analytics, Statistics, Computer Science, or a related field.
Minimum of 2 years of experience in digital analytics and reporting, with proficiency in both GA4 and Adobe Analytics.
Advanced knowledge of digital marketing concepts, web analytics, and data visualization techniques.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with a proven track record of deriving actionable insights from complex datasets.
Expertise in data visualization tools such as Google Data Studio, Tableau, or PowerBI.
Proficiency in SQL and experience with BigQuery for advanced data analysis.
Excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to effectively convey technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.
Experience managing multiple projects and prioritizing effectively in a fast-paced environment.
Demonstrated ability to stay current with evolving analytics technologies and methodologies.


Our Values:

We know our people are what allows us to achieve all that we do and that‚Äôs why it‚Äôs important that everyone we bring onto our team lives our values with us.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Bring your Data Analysis Knowledge and Expertise

To our Information Technology Team

CPA Ontario is currently in search of a Data Analyst who will be responsible for extracting, analyzing, and interpreting financial data from various sources to support strategic decision-making and operational initiatives. As part of our Enterprise Architecture team, you will work closely with other cross-functional departments including IT, Finance and Operations, collaborating with business stakeholders to provide actionable insights and recommendations. As a Data Analyst you will be accountable for understanding data needs, working to design and develop reports and dashboards, and conducting thorough data analysis to identify trends, patterns, and opportunities for improvement.

What You‚Äôll Be Doing

Working collaboratively with business stakeholders within IT, Business Intelligence and Finance departments and other operational teams to understand business requirements and translate them into data-driven solutions.

Extracting, cleaning, and manipulating large datasets from multiple sources including financial databases, CRM systems, ERP systems, and spreadsheets.

Performing analysis of data to identify trends, anomalies, and opportunities for improvement.

Designing and developing reports, dashboards, and data visualizations to present findings in a clear and concise manner.

Preparing regular and ad-hoc reports and dashboards to communicate findings to stakeholders.

Conducting variance analysis and performance reporting to support budgeting and forecasting processes.

Assisting in the design and implementation of data collection systems and strategies to optimize efficiency and data quality.

Administering, monitoring, supporting and maintaining SQL servers in our environment.

Staying current in industry trends and best practices in data analysis and modeling.

Who You Are

A post-secondary graduate preferably in information systems, information technology, computer science, or related field.

Experienced in working with databases and ERP systems with a minimum of 3 years‚Äô experience in a Data Analyst role.

Proficient in SQL, Power BI, Microsoft Excel , SQL Management Studio and other data processing tools and s oftware .

Proficient in Microsoft Dynamics 365 and SharePoint. Experience with Salesforce or other CRM considered an asset.

Highly organized and able to manage projects and timelines within tight deadlines in a fast-paced environment.

Able to work efficiently and effectively as a team member, as well as independently.

An excellent communicator with the ability to convey ideas succinctly and conveying complex findings and insights to technical and non-technical stakeholders with ease.

A self-starter with excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to think analytically about solutions.

Committed to ongoing training and a desire to learn new skills and continually expand upon knowledge and expertise.

What We Offer

A fast-paced environment. Collaboration, innovation and passionate professionals are at our core. We relentlessly pursue what‚Äôs next to unlock the full potential of you and us together.

Flexible work environments. As part of our Hybrid work culture, we provide flexible, remote work options to support you in your career, in addition to in-office teamwork and collaboration.

Diversity and inclusion. We recognize the value in our differences and prioritize inclusivity to bring together the best talent to protect the public, advance the profession and enable CPAs to lead business and society forward.

Ongoing learning and career growth. We want your career to skyrocket. We support career advancement and professional development opportunities with learning investments to promote your future growth. Thrive with us.

Focus on your well-being. With industry leading benefits and wellness programs, including a healthy lifestyle allowance, mental health resources and more, we‚Äôre committed to your well-being.

Who We Are

We protect the public. We advance the profession. We enable CPAs to lead business and society forward. We ensure that our 103,000 members and 18,000 students meet the highest standards of integrity and expertise. We help them stay ahead of global market trends and abreast of regulatory change. CPAs represent a globally recognized, premium designation. Our Chartered Professional Accountants are valued by organizations in all industries for their financial expertise, strategic thinking, management skills and leadership. We believe that success happens when both business and society benefit. For information on the profession visit: cpaontario.ca.

We Appreciate Your Interest In CPA Ontario And This Position:

At CPA Ontario, we are committed to building high-performance teams. Our selection process is thorough, and all candidate applications are reviewed. Should your qualifications and experience meet the requirements of this role, a member of our recruitment team will contact you. We encourage you to set up CPA Ontario job alerts for positions that align to your experience and career goals.

CPA Ontario is an inclusive employer. Accommodation is available under the Ontario Human Rights Code. If you require a disability-related accommodation to participate in the recruitment process, please email accessibility@cpaontario.ca with ‚ÄúAccommodation Required‚Äù in the subject line to provide your contact information. A member of the Recruitment team will contact you within 48 hours.

Ongoing learning and career growth. We want your career to skyrocket. We support career advancement and professional development opportunities with learning investments to promote your future growth. Thrive with us.

Focus on your well-being. With industry leading benefits and wellness programs, including a healthy lifestyle allowance, mental health resources and more, we‚Äôre committed to your well-being.

Who We Are

We protect the public. We advance the profession. We enable CPAs to lead business and society forward. We ensure that our 103,000 members and 18,000 students meet the highest standards of integrity and expertise. We help them stay ahead of global market trends and abreast of regulatory change. CPAs represent a globally recognized, premium designation. Our Chartered Professional Accountants are valued by organizations in all industries for their financial expertise, strategic thinking, management skills and leadership. We believe that success happens when both business and society benefit. For information on the profession visit: cpaontario.ca.

We Appreciate Your Interest In CPA Ontario And This Position:

At CPA Ontario, we are committed to building high-performance teams. Our selection process is thorough, and all candidate applications are reviewed. Should your qualifications and experience meet the requirements of this role, a member of our recruitment team will contact you. We encourage you to set up CPA Ontario job alerts for positions that align to your experience and career goals.

CPA Ontario is an inclusive employer. Accommodation is available under the Ontario Human Rights Code. If you require a disability-related accommodation to participate in the recruitment process, please email accessibility@cpaontario.ca with ‚ÄúAccommodation Required‚Äù in the subject line to provide your contact information. A member of the Recruitment team will contact you within 48 hours.

Title: Staff Data Analyst
Description:
As a Staff Data Analyst, you will help drive the acquisition strategy of one of the fastest-growing e-commerce businesses in the US. Data-driven decision making is at the core of our company culture and you will have a fundamental part in extracting insights and shaping our success. You will work with marketing and analytics to build capabilities for one of the fastest-growing US food brands and be the champion of a data-centric approach to our marketing and digital product operations. You will work collaboratively with data engineering, business intelligence and data science, to provide effective and high impact insights to drive business performance.

You will ‚Ä¶


Complete proactive analysis of performance & brand marketing data to identify gaps and opportunities for KPI improvement (acquisition, CACs, brand awareness, LTV, etc.).
Work closely with senior management to understand business problems, identify opportunities for analysis, present clear action plans, and influence stakeholders to help drive forward key initiatives.
Drive forward innovative analysis approaches in order to solve some of the most challenging marketing data problems in the business.
Stay up-to-date with industry and market developments that might impact business performance.
Play a key role in driving the insights generated by the analytics team to tangible action and projects adopted by the rest of the marketing team.
Be a leading voice for the analytics department, supporting the broader US marketing team in understanding new metrics and teaching foundational analysis skills.
Work with other analytics departments, driving cross-team collaboration, best practice sharing, and insight generation.
Analyze customer data to identify pain points and opportunities in the customer journey, helping to determine customer segmentation and personalization strategies.
Actively support the marketing annual strategic planning process, from analysis to storytelling.


You are...


Results-oriented - You love transforming data into meaningful outcomes
Gritty - When you encounter obstacles you find creative solutions
Intellectually curious ‚Äì You love to understand why things are the way they are, how things work, and challenge the status quo
A team player ‚Äì You favor team victories over individual success
A structured problem solver ‚Äì You possess strong organizational skills and consistently demonstrate a methodical approach to all your work
Agile ‚Äì You thrive in fast-paced and dynamic environments and are comfortable working autonomously
A critical thinker ‚Äì You use logic to identify opportunities, evaluate alternatives, and synthesize and present critical information to solve complex problems


At a minimum, you have...


6+ years in a highly analytical role (bonus if you‚Äôve worked in a Start-Up or in a high-growth environment)
Expert abilities in Excel, SQL and python, and the ability to use statistical modeling techniques for robust analysis
A strong business acumen and can translate insights into actionable recommendations that align with business objectives
Ability to support, mentor and work collaboratively with other junior team members to drive forward high quality and thoughtful analysis
Expertise in data visualization and data storytelling, including experience with dashboarding tools (Tableau preferred)
Experience working with a range of business stakeholders and communicating technical results in business language
A BS in computer science, mathematics, economics, statistics, engineering, or similar program


You‚Äôll get‚Ä¶


Box Discount - Amazing discounts on 1 box per week! 75% discount on weekly HelloFresh and Chefs Plate meal kits AND 50% off weekly Factor meal box
Health & Wellness - Health & Dental benefits from day 1, a Health Spending Account, unlimited access to the Headspace app to meet your self-care needs, and 25% discount on GoodLife fitness memberships
Vacation & PTO - Time off is also an important part of self-care! We offer generous vacation and PTO to help you create a good work-life balance.
Family Benefits - A parental leave top-up program for expectant parents
Growth & Development - We support your career progression, provide development opportunities, and invest in your continued learning through our organization wide L&D fund
Work Hard & Have Fun - From team socials to engaging company days, you‚Äôll have plenty of opportunity to experience the fun!
Diversity & Inclusion Initiatives - With impactful ERG‚Äôs like FreshPride, Women Empowered and LIMES, we are committed to our diversity, equity & inclusion effort


This job description is intended to provide a general overview of the responsibilities. However, the Company reserves the right to adjust, modify, or reassign work tasks and responsibilities as needed to meet changing business needs, operational requirements, or other factors.

JR101450

Title: Data Analyst (12-Month Contract) [Scotiabank]
Description:
Requisition ID: 205874

Join a purpose driven winning team, committed to results, in an inclusive and high-performing culture.

Purpose

Contributes to the overall success of the Global Operations Analytics & Business Intelligence team in Canada, ensuring specific individual goals, plans, and initiatives are executed & delivered in support of the team's business strategies and objectives. Ensures all activities conducted are in compliance with governing regulations, internal policies and procedures.

Reporting to the Senior Manager, Analytics & Business Intelligence, the Data Analyst assists with the design, development, deployment, and sustainment of data solutions and the technology roadmap ‚Äì in support of the data strategy ‚Äì to effectively monitor, assess, and deploy analytics & reporting solutions for internal partners across Global Operations and International Banking units.

The Data Analyst is responsible for supporting the operational and strategic needs of the Analytics & Business intelligence program, and providing data analytics/reporting services to a variety of operating units across business functions and international geographies.

Is this role right for you? In this role, you will:


Champions a customer focused culture to deepen client relationships and leverage broader Bank relationships, systems and knowledge.
Develops, deploys, and sustains data analytics / reporting solutions and associated data flows, in alignment with strategic and tactical needs of the business
Leads sessions with both technical and non-technical stakeholders to gather business requirements, identify root causes to problems, and recommend data solutions in support of business processes
Develops and maintains strong knowledge of operational policies and procedures across Canadian Banking, International Banking, and other Global Operations units
Actively contributes to ongoing projects and programs, ad-hoc initiatives, and partner workstreams across the GO Analytics & Business Intelligence service portfolio
Documents, analyzes and recommends improvements to existing business processes with the aim of increasing process efficiency, improving productivity and/or reducing costs
Understand how the Bank's risk appetite and risk culture should be considered in day-to-day activities and decisions.
Actively pursues effective and efficient operations of their respective areas in accordance with Scotiabank's Values, its Code of Conduct and the Global Sales Principles, while ensuring the adequacy, adherence to and effectiveness of day-to-day business controls to meet obligations with respect to operational, compliance, AML/ATF/sanctions and conduct risk.
Contributes to a high performance and inclusive work environment.


Skills

Do you have the skills that will enable you to succeed in this role? ‚Äì We'd love to work with you if you have:


Bachelor's degree in engineering, business administration, finance, or another quantitative field (i.e. STEM)
3+ years of experience in data analytics, data engineering, and/or reporting in the financial services industry
Advanced knowledge of Power BI (DAX), Microsoft Excel (Power Query, Data modelling/Power Pivot, advanced formulas), and SharePoint (Data flow set up and maintenance)
Experience with SQL (preferably Microsoft SQL Server Management Studio, SSMS) in querying, structuring tables, and interacting with relational databases
Demonstrated experience in the following areas: dashboard development, operational and executive reporting, data analysis and visualization, KPI production, data management and governance
Strong interpersonal and communication skills; fluency in Spanish preferred
Ability to manage multi-dimensional projects and workstreams from concept to completion within a matrix environment and across business lines


Work Arrangement


Work in a standard office-based environment; non-standard hours are a common occurrence.


Interested?

At Scotiabank, every employee is empowered to reach their fullest potential, respected for who they are and, embraced for their differences. That is why we work to grow and diversify talent and engage employees in a performance-oriented culture.

What's in it for you?

Scotiabank wants you to be able to bring your best self to work ‚Äì and life, every day. With a focus on holistic well-being, our many flexible benefit programs are designed to help support your unique family, financial, physical, mental, and social health needs.

Location(s): Canada : Ontario : Mississauga

Scotiabank is a leading bank in the Americas. Guided by our purpose: "for every future", we help our customers, their families and their communities achieve success through a broad range of advice, products and services, including personal and commercial banking, wealth management and private banking, corporate and investment banking, and capital markets.

At Scotiabank, we value the unique skills and experiences each individual brings to the Bank, and are committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible environment for everyone. If you require accommodation (including, but not limited to, an accessible interview site, alternate format documents, ASL Interpreter, or Assistive Technology) during the recruitment and selection process, please let our Recruitment team know. If you require technical assistance, please click here . Candidates must apply directly online to be considered for this role. We thank all applicants for their interest in a career at Scotiabank; however, only those candidates who are selected for an interview will be contacted.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
WOW 1 DAY PAINTING is looking for a Data Analyst in Vancouver or Toronto to join our growing team! Working cross-functionally with the Marketing, Technology and Operations teams, you will support the team with various reporting needs.

We are looking for someone with strong reporting and analytical skills who can support decision-making by offering strong insights from new and existing data sources. WOW 1 DAY PAINTING is an exciting, fast-growing House detailing franchise, part of O2E Brands, the parent company of the hugely successful 1-800-GOT-JUNK?

When we say It‚Äôs All About People, we mean it. We have created a hybrid work model that helps us get together to Collaborate, Celebrate and Connect while enjoying the flexibility of working where it makes sense for you. For this role‚Äôs duty and responsibility, we anticipate that you will be in the office 25% of the time.

Day in the Life


Cross Functional Collaboration: Engage with all areas of the brand, including marketing, finance, sales center, and operations, to organize, analyze and report on data across departments. Liaise with technology teams to help support business initiatives, adding clarity to technology requirements and communicating priority related to support requirements for data.Collaborate and coordinate data request processes to ensure requested audiences, segmentations, and exclusions are clearly defined and understood.
Reporting: Design, develop, maintain and optimize reports and dashboards. Create ad hoc reports measuring the performance of strategic initiatives. These initiatives may include projects within our digital roadmap, marketing campaigns and customer journey funnels.
Analysis: Provide fact-based, data-driven insights and analysis to formulate meaningful conclusions and recommendations. Identify trends in the data and proactively concisely communicate them. Develop KPI measures to track achievement. Build, test, and run SQL queries to deliver data extracts for analysis needs. Build or edit data views in the data warehouse.
Data Governance: Identify and support standardization of key performance indicators to measure and support new and existing business initiatives. Support standardization of Goal tracking and input tools (Google Sheets) among business units. Partner with data stewards and data owners by monitoring and drawing attention to real or potential data quality issues.". Partner with the data warehouse manager to ensure customer records in both marketing automation platforms and POS (Salesforce) are cleansed and that segmentation is intact
Technology: Tableau Online server, user and content management. Supporting Data Flows, identifying and resolving errors in daily updates for key sources. Salesforce report development (not administration). Explore data at the source (warehouse) to validate and inform data engineering requests.


What You Bring To The Table


Proficiency in SQL
Experience with BI tools such as Tableau and Power BI. Tableau certification preferred.
Detail-oriented, with the ability to manage multiple projects


Compensation & Benefits


Salary is $ $53,000 to $66,000 (The actual salary offered will be commensurate with education, experience, and internal parity).
The Total Compensation Package includes Extended Health and dental. Focus on your development through our professional development programs. Enjoy a variety of health and wellness initiatives, including access to gym facilities at our corporate head office. Please speak to us to learn more about what we offer.


About Us

Did you know O2E Brands has been voted one of the Best Workplaces in Canada 15 times!? Take a sneak peek into why that is, here: (YouTube) Check us out on social! At O2E Brands, we know that great talent comes in many forms, and we want to meet you at your best. We will provide reasonable accommodations to applicants with disabilities at any time throughout the recruitment and selection process. Please contact our Talent Acquisition Team at talentacquisition@o2ebrands.com or notify the Talent Acquisition team member you are working with if unique arrangements will enable your equal participation.

Title: Business Analyst/Data Analyst
Description:
In this dynamic role, you will be responsible for client data ingestion, ensuring seamless integration of external client data to enhance our analytics capabilities and provide valuable insights to our stakeholders. Join us in our data-driven journey.

About The Role

As a Business Analyst, you'll be at the forefront of transforming raw data into actionable insights and innovative products. With a keen eye for detail and passion for problem solving, you'll play a pivotal role in shaping the company's data strategy and driving business success

In This Role, Your Key Business Responsibilities Will Include


Identify data product opportunities, including new products and product enhancements, through design thinking sessions and stakeholder engagement
Collaborate with cross-functional stakeholders, such as Technical Accounting, Experience Studies, Valuation, and Inforce Optimization, to gather and document product requirements
Translate product requirements into clear and actionable user stories or product specifications
Develop and implement tactical data products using available tools and support user onboarding
Develop and maintain key metrics to measure product success
Understand L&H Re systems and processes to advise and assist IT in system enhancements and migrating tactical products into strategic ones
Design, map, and code complex and unique client data setups


About The Team

The Data Management & Insights [DMI] team is part of Business Excellence delivering on the promise of a stable end-to-end operating platform for Life & Health Reinsurance [L&H Re]. Their mission is to make client data accessible to stakeholders by systematically acquiring and ingesting it. The team utilizes advanced analytics techniques to generate valuable insights for L&H Re. With a continuous improvement mindset, they strive to enhance data, systems, and processes for both their own use and their stakeholders.

About You

You have proven strategic, analytical, and conceptual thinking abilities. You have effective communication skills, with the ability to present complex data and insights to stakeholders clearly and concisely.

Essential Skills


Bachelor of Science degree with 5+ years of relevant experience
Proficient in data mapping, ETL processing, and data integration
Strong understanding of data structures and testing methodologies for onboarding large and complex client datasets
Proficient in SQL, Python/R coding


Nice To Have


Good understanding of relational databases, such as Oracle and SQL Server
Experience in handling large volumes of structured and unstructured data
Familiarity with best practices of data management and governance
Experience working in Waterfall and Agile projects, while leading projects being a plus
Hands-on experience with Data Integration tools (e.g. Palantir) and techniques (e.g. EDA, predictive & prescriptive analysis), and visualization software such as Power BI


Our company has a hybrid work model where the expectation is that you will be in the office two to three days per week on average.

This role will be unable to offer any assistance with relocation or visa sponsorship.

About Swiss Re

Swiss Re is one of the world‚Äôs leading providers of reinsurance, insurance and other forms of insurance-based risk transfer, working to make the world more resilient. We anticipate and manage a wide variety of risks, from natural catastrophes and climate change to cybercrime. We cover both Property & Casualty and Life & Health. Combining experience with creative thinking and cutting-edge expertise, we create new opportunities and solutions for our clients. This is possible thanks to the collaboration of more than 14,000 employees across the world.

Our success depends on our ability to build an inclusive culture encouraging fresh perspectives and innovative thinking. We embrace a workplace where everyone has equal opportunities to thrive and develop professionally regardless of their age, gender, race, ethnicity, gender identity and/or expression, sexual orientation, physical or mental ability, skillset, thought or other characteristics. HTML:
In this dynamic role, you will be responsible for client data ingestion, ensuring seamless integration of external client data to enhance our analytics capabilities and provide valuable insights to our stakeholders. Join us in our data-driven journey.

About The Role

As a Business Analyst, you'll be at the forefront of transforming raw data into actionable insights and innovative products. With a keen eye for detail and passion for problem solving, you'll play a pivotal role in shaping the company's data strategy and driving business success

In This Role, Your Key Business Responsibilities Will Include

  • Identify data product opportunities, including new products and product enhancements, through design thinking sessions and stakeholder engagement
  • Collaborate with cross-functional stakeholders, such as Technical Accounting, Experience Studies, Valuation, and Inforce Optimization, to gather and document product requirements
  • Translate product requirements into clear and actionable user stories or product specifications
  • Develop and implement tactical data products using available tools and support user onboarding
  • Develop and maintain key metrics to measure product success
  • Understand L&H Re systems and processes to advise and assist IT in system enhancements and migrating tactical products into strategic ones
  • Design, map, and code complex and unique client data setups

About The Team

The Data Management & Insights [DMI] team is part of Business Excellence delivering on the promise of a stable end-to-end operating platform for Life & Health Reinsurance [L&H Re]. Their mission is to make client data accessible to stakeholders by systematically acquiring and ingesting it. The team utilizes advanced analytics techniques to generate valuable insights for L&H Re. With a continuous improvement mindset, they strive to enhance data, systems, and processes for both their own use and their stakeholders.

About You

You have proven strategic, analytical, and conceptual thinking abilities. You have effective communication skills, with the ability to present complex data and insights to stakeholders clearly and concisely.

Essential Skills

  • Bachelor of Science degree with 5+ years of relevant experience
  • Proficient in data mapping, ETL processing, and data integration
  • Strong understanding of data structures and testing methodologies for onboarding large and complex client datasets
  • Proficient in SQL, Python/R coding

Nice To Have

  • Good understanding of relational databases, such as Oracle and SQL Server
  • Experience in handling large volumes of structured and unstructured data
  • Familiarity with best practices of data management and governance
  • Experience working in Waterfall and Agile projects, while leading projects being a plus
  • Hands-on experience with Data Integration tools (e.g. Palantir) and techniques (e.g. EDA, predictive & prescriptive analysis), and visualization software such as Power BI

Our company has a hybrid work model where the expectation is that you will be in the office two to three days per week on average.

Reference Code: 130238

Title: Data Analyst - Fully remote
Description:
Scandinavian Building Services has been a Canadian leader in retail and commercial cleaning for the last 60 years. Starting as a small family owned and operated business in Edmonton Alberta in 1982 to offering full service janitorial and building maintenance across Canada today. We attribute our success to staying true to our core values of Service, Motivate, Respect, and Connect. As we continue to grow we are looking to add a Data Analyst to the Scandi Family!




** Please note candidates must be currently based in and legally able to work in Canada to be considered for this position **




What‚Äôs in it for you:

Awarded one of Canada‚Äôs Best Managed Companies: We‚Äôre committed to a high level standard of excellence for both clients and our Scandi Family.
Growth Opportunities: A place to hang your hat. We want our employees to grow with us long term.
Stability and Job Security: Even through tough economic times we‚Äôve continued to steadily grow, and we aren‚Äôt slowing down any time soon. With a strong national presence across Canada
Family First Culture: We are and have always been a family owned and operated business. We have family friendly events year-round and affectionately call our team members the Scandi Family.
Benefits: We offer a comprehensive medical and dental plan as well as personal days off.




What your day to day will look like:




Working permanently fully remote you will be reporting directly to our Business Intelligence Reporting Manager. Working Monday to Friday 8am ‚Äì 4:30pm EST.




Review, monitor, and analyze various reports including; KPI compliance on operational targets and compliance audits on all daily reports.
Improving Excel reporting templates for maximum efficiency on a continuous basis.
Maintain and edit KPI dashboards in Power BI on a continuous basis.
Utilizing field driven operational data from our industry specific system Lighthouse and following up with Account Manager on specific reports when needed.
Compile and forward reports on an ad hoc basis when needed.
All other duties as required.




What you‚Äôll need to succeed:

Minimum of 2 years experience in a previous Data Analyst role with previous experience with Power BI. Working with KPI‚Äôs, large scale data analysis, data cleansing and data reconciliations from multiple sources.
Post secondary education; diploma or degree in a relevant field. Happy to consider a mix of experience and education.
Must have advanced level Excel skills.
Strong knowledge of systems and data integrity.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills with the ability to demonstrate a sense of urgency in completing tasks.




What you can expect for our interview process:

20 minute preliminary phone interview with our Recruiter
20-40 minute assessment (depending on optional practice questions or breaks)
30 minute MS Teams video interview with the Hiring Manager and direct Supervisors for the role




At Scandinavian Building Services we are an equal opportunity employer who values a diverse workplace. We recognize the strength that comes from different experiences, backgrounds and perspectives and welcome all candidates to apply. We feel it is important that all people have access and opportunity to be employed, to be valued and to be respected.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
We‚Äôre Hiring!

Data Analyst

Toronto, ON

www.socan.com

Full-Time

Remote

Who We Are

SOCAN is a not-for-profit copyright collective dedicated to ensuring music creators and publishers receive what they have rightfully earned for the use of their work. SOCAN supports and represents more than 180,000 songwriters, composers, and music publishers. Through licensing, global royalty collection and advocacy, we help creators to keep making the music that entertains, moves, and inspires us

OUR COMMITMENT TO DIVERSITY, EQUITY, INCLUSION, AND ANTI-RACISM

SOCAN thrives with a variety of viewpoints, identities, and backgrounds, and we are committed to anti-racism. Everyone is welcome to apply for our wide range of roles, regardless of gender identity, gender expression, ethnicity, race, age, culture, sexual orientation, religious belief, or physical ability. Learn more about SOCAN‚Äôs commitment to Inclusion & Anti-Racism .

WHY WORK WITH US?


Make a difference by supporting and collaborating with a vibrant and creative community
Enjoy many options for workplace flexibility and work-life balance
Get involved in the rapidly changing creative space
Advocate for and empower the creative community
Together, we‚Äôll help music creators earn more income and make a living


What We Offer


35-hour workweek schedule (possible flexible work options i.e., 4-day work week (position based)
Twelve paid sick days annually (including five personal days)
Virtual My Wellness program, including access to SOCAN‚Äôs Toronto fitness facility
Annual Performance Incentive bonus (dependent on a personal and company performance)
Defined contribution Pension Plan
Comprehensive, health and dental benefits program
Inclusive and collaborative working environment


About The Role

SOCAN is seeking a Data Analyst to join our Data Strategy and Analytics team. In this role, you‚Äôll collect, model, analyze and visualize data to enable business strategy and operational efficiency. Working on a centralized team, you‚Äôll operate cross functionally throughout the organization to identify realistic solutions to real time business problems. The ideal candidate is curious, emotionally intelligent, and possesses a drive for continuous learning and self-improvement.


Within the first 3 months you will be expected to understand SOCAN‚Äôs high level business model and be able to design and deliver data analysis using various pre-existing datasets.
Within 6 months you must be fully integrated into the analytics team and have independently delivered and end-to-end data analysis / business intelligence solution.
By the end of year one, you‚Äôll be expected to execute analysis projects independently, and become the primary data analysis expert for one or more lines of business


What You‚Äôll Do / Key Responsibilities


Work directly with business users and subject matter experts to document reporting requirements, understand business processes and how they affect data.
Collaborate with developers to design models‚Äô datasets within our cloud data lakehouse environment.
Communicate insights and recommendations to executive leaders by creating clear and concise visual reports and presentations.
Contribute to large corporate projects and initiatives that involve data analytics and reporting.
Identify opportunities for process improvements and data-driven decision-making, while continuously monitoring data quality and integrity.
Stay up to date with the latest industry trends and best practices in data analysis and business intelligence.


What You Will Bring / Qualifications & Experience


2-4 years of working experience in a similar role
Completion of a post-secondary degree, Preferably in Finance, Economics, Business or a STEM field
Strong quantitative skills with the ability to analyze large data sets, while keeping the big picture in mind
Proficiency performing data analysis using SQL, Python or PySpark.
Demonstrated experience with business intelligence tools such as Power BI or Tableau.
Previous experience leveraging cloud Data Lakehouse‚Äôs to build scalable analytical models (i.e. Databricks, Snowflake)
Strong communicator, with a proven ability to tackle loosely defined problems
Fluency in French an asset


Accessibility & Accommodation

SOCAN is committed to providing an inclusive workplace environment that meets the accessibility needs of employees with disabilities. Should you require accommodations please contact us directly at hr@socan.com and we will make the necessary accommodations. Applications submitted to this email address will not be accepted.

EQUAL EMPLOYMENT OPPORTUNITY

SOCAN is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Hiring and other employment decisions at SOCAN are made without regard to race, colour, religion, sex, ancestry, national origin, ethnic origin, age, disability, citizenship, veteran status, sexual orientation, record of offences, marital status, family status, or any other characteristic protected by federal, provincial, or local law, regulation, or ordinance.

If you don‚Äôt see yourself fully reflected in every job requirement listed on the posting above, we still encourage you to reach out and apply. Research has shown underrepresented groups often only apply when they feel 100% qualified. We are committed to creating a more equitable, inclusive, and diverse company and we strongly encourage applicants of all genders, ages, ethnicities, cultures, abilities, sexual orientations, and life experiences to apply

How To Apply

If you‚Äôre interested in joining us, we‚Äôd love to hear from you: http://www.socan.com/careers/

Thank you for your interest in our company; we will be in touch with those candidates we wish to interview.

To learn more about SOCAN, go to www.socan.com . You can also follow us on LinkedIn, X, Instagram, and Facebook (@SOCANmusic/@SOCANmusique).

Title: Data Analyst / Engineer
Description:
Data SEA Consulting ‚Äì Data Analyst




Company Description

Data SEA Consulting focuses on helping mid-sized businesses harness the power of their data by leveraging the latest analytics tools and techniques. We work with Private Equity Funds and Independent Business Owners to find the unique data solutions that will drive the most value for their business. After creating the data strategy and proposing solutions, we use our technical expertise to execute on building out these solutions into analytics infrastructure and tools that can help drive the business forward.




For more information about Data SEA, please visit our website: dataseaconsulting.com




If you are passionate about working with data, delivering great analytics solutions, and solving challenging problems, then we would love to hear from you.




Job Description

In this role as a full-time Data Analyst, you will work with members of the Data SEA team to design, develop and deploy high-quality data solutions and data infrastructure that will drive value for our clients‚Äô businesses.




Responsibilities

Directly engage with clients to lead the implementation of analytics solutions, ensuring a successful user experience.
Assist in the design and development of data architecture to optimize data flow, storage, and accessibility, meeting business needs and improving decision-making processes.
Construct robust Data Pipelines to efficiently transfer data from source systems to a centralized Data Lakehouse, utilizing best practices in Data Engineering and implementing a medallion architecture
Oversee the training, deployment, and monitoring of Machine Learning models, ensuring they provide accurate and timely predictions
Help in establishing and managing data governance policies to maintain data integrity, quality, and security, while ensuring compliance with data access and usage regulations
Create data visualizations and analyses by merging various data sets to present key insights through different reporting techniques
Dive into clients' data and develop strategic plans to maximize value for clients, balancing hands-on work with big-picture thinking
Innovate by prototyping new frameworks and technologies, enabling Data SEA to rapidly equip its clients with state-of-the-art infrastructure




Qualifications

Should Have

A background in computer science and/or relevant work experience in the field of Data Analytics, Data Engineering and/or Data Science
Ability to pick up new technologies with ease
A strong SQL knowledge and experience working with relational databases
Experience with object-oriented & functional scripting languages such as Python
A history of manipulating, processing, and extracting value from large, disconnected datasets
A natural curiosity about how to improve systems and processes
A keen interest in learning about our clients' businesses and a passion for finding the right solutions
Strong oral and written communication skills
Experience working with Power BI, Tableau, and/or Looker




Nice to Have

Experience with Databricks
Experience working on AWS, Azure, and/or Google Cloud infrastructure
Experience working in a Dev, UAT and Prod configuration when writing and deploying code
Experience in applying Data Engineering best practices to create robust data pipelines and implement a medallion architecture for efficient data storage and retrieval.
A solid understanding of Data Architecture best practices, including data modeling techniques, design principles for data warehousing and lakes, and strategies for data integration and lifecycle management to build robust and scalable data ecosystems.
Knowledge and experience in implementing Data Governance best practices, including developing and enforcing data policies, standards, and procedures to ensure data accuracy, consistency, and security, while promoting compliant data usage and management.
Proficiency in Machine Learning best practices, including approaches to training, deploying, tuning, and monitoring Machine Learning models for optimal performance and accuracy.




What You Can Expect from Us

At Data SEA Consulting, we are passionate about finding the right people and helping them grow so that they can help us solve the complex analytical problems that we tackle on behalf of our clients. As a key member of a small but growing team, you would receive extensive 1:1 coaching and the chance to work on a wide variety of projects across a number of different industries.

Title: Commercial Data Analyst
Description:
Founded in 2013, Organigram first began as a medical cannabis provider. Today, the Company is focused on winning in the Canadian recreational market and dynamically expanding the company‚Äôs global footprint and influence.

Organigram has developed a portfolio of adult-use recreational cannabis brands including Edison, Big Bag o‚Äô Buds, SHRED, Monjour, Holy Mountain and Trailblazer. Quebec‚Äôs top-selling hash brand Tremblant Cannabis, and artisanal craft brand, Laurentian are also additions to Organigram‚Äôs brand portfolio. Organigram operates facilities in three provinces across the country. The primary indoor growing facility is in Moncton, New Brunswick, the premium hash production and premium cultivation facility is in Lac-Sup√©rieur, Quebec and there is a highly automated facility dedicated to edibles manufacturing in Winnipeg, Manitoba. The Company is regulated by Health Canada under the Cannabis Act (Canada) and the Cannabis Regulations (Canada).

Organigram is focused on translating operational excellence into strong financial results and return on investment for shareholders.

Job Summary

As a Commercial Analyst based in Toronto, Ontario, you will be at the heart of our data-driven decision-making processes. You‚Äôll collaborate closely with the Commercial and IT teams to extract, transform, and analyze data, providing actionable insights that optimize our recreational cannabis commercial strategies. Your work will directly inform sales, marketing, finance, and supply chain decisions, helping to drive growth and efficiency across the company.

This role is perfect for someone who enjoys working with data, is eager to develop their skills in a dynamic environment and is excited about making a tangible impact on one of Canada‚Äôs leading licensed producer.

Key Responsibilities

Analyze commercial performance data to support decision-making across sales, marketing, commercialization and supply chain teams.
Develop and enhance Power BI dashboards and other analytical tools, transforming data into clear, actionable insights.
Extract, clean, maintain, and transform data from multiple internal and external sources for analysis.
Create and maintain data models to ensure accurate reporting and forecasting.
Translate business questions into analytical projects and deliver data-driven recommendations.
Conduct ad-hoc analysis to support strategic initiatives and solve specific business challenges.
Ensure data accuracy, consistency, and integrity in all analysis and reporting.
Continuously seek opportunities to improve data analytics processes and tools in collaboration with IT and business teams.

Key Requirements

Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Business, Economics, Statistics, Computer Science, or a related field.
2-4 years of experience in a data analytics role, ideally within consumer packaged goods (CPG) / fast-moving consumer goods (FMCG), or a similar industry.
Strong Power BI skills: Experience with DAX, Power Query, and building dashboards and data visualizations is essential.
Proficiency in MS Excel, including advanced functionalities such as pivot tables, complex formulas, and data analysis tools.
Proficiency in SQL, with experience in writing and optimizing queries.
Exposure to Extract, Transform, Load (ETL) processes, data modelling, data warehousing and data management.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to interpret data and make actionable recommendations.
Effective communication skills, able to present complex data insights to non-technical stakeholders.
Experience in the cannabis industry is a strong plus but not required.
Basic knowledge of Python for scripting or automating tasks (preferred).Basic knowledge of Azure Data Factory and data ingestion architecture within an Azure Cloud environment (preferred).
Ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously, work in a collaborative environment and meet tight deadlines.

Why Join Us?

Growth Opportunity:This role offers the chance to deepen your expertise in analytics and gain hands-on experience in a fast-paced industry.
Impact:Your work will directly influence commercial strategies and contribute to the company's success.
Collaborative Environment:Work closely with a passionate team that values innovation, creativity, and continuous improvement.

Title: Employer Data Analyst
Description:
Employer Data Analyst (Pensions)

Client Services ‚Äì Employer Services & Data Management




The Ontario Pension Board (OPB) administers the Public Service Pension Plan (the PSPP), a major defined benefit pension plan sponsored by the Government of Ontario. With 100,000 members and $31 billion in assets, the PSPP is one of Canada‚Äôs largest pension plans. It is also one of the country‚Äôs oldest, successfully delivering the pension promise since the early 1920s. Learn more about OPB.




We have an exciting opportunity for an Employer Data Analyst who is client focused with strong analytical and problem-solving skills who can expertly reconcile employment history and financial data.




Key Responsibilities:




‚Ä¢ Analyze, investigate and complete corrections to all rejected transactions received from Employer interfaces.

‚Ä¢ Determine information/data needed to correct member‚Äôs records.

‚Ä¢ Validate information using detailed/practical knowledge of pension administration requirements, human resources policies and Employer‚Äôs payroll procedures.

‚Ä¢ Validate information for the enrolments received from the Employer Portal.

‚Ä¢ Validate corresponding contributions and ensure it is received in a timely manner.

‚Ä¢ Identify any discrepancies and work with Employers to resolve them; conduct follow-ups by phone and portal messages on a timely basis.

‚Ä¢ Resolve any data clean up identified by the automated processes for leaves, immediate pensions and pre-retirement termination cases.

‚Ä¢ Establish and maintain good working relationships with internal business partners and designated Employer contacts.

‚Ä¢ Provide on-going advocacy, information and education to Employers of our plan.

‚Ä¢ Follow established criteria to ensure the quality and integrity of the information used by Client Services, identify issues and trends, and make recommendations to improve efficiency and service.

‚Ä¢ Working within a team, aim to meet or exceed client service expectations and provide data management support as needed.




Key Qualifications:




‚Ä¢ Working knowledge with federal tax legislation, the Pension Benefits Act, Public Service Pension Plan Act and have a general understanding of the pensions industry.

‚Ä¢ Your background will include processing client transactions in accordance with established best practices/policies and explaining complex issues through a variety of channels.

‚Ä¢ You have strong knowledge and proficiency with MS Excel, Word and Outlook.

‚Ä¢ You have strong mathematical, analytical, and problem-solving skills and initiative.

‚Ä¢ You are someone with excellent time management, strong communication, and interpersonal skills that embrace teamwork with the ability to meet established timelines and to process large volumes of detailed information with minimal errors.

‚Ä¢ You are self-directed but recognize the importance of relationship building with your team as well as with those across the organization.







Please submit your resume if you are interested in this exciting opportunity. The competition will remain open until a successful candidate is selected or until the competition is closed.




This competition is open to all employees of OPB and has been posted on LinkedIn. OPB is committed to providing accommodation for people with disabilities in its recruitment process. Please advise OPB if you require an accommodation, and we will work with you to meet your needs. OPB is committed to fostering a culture of diversity, equity and inclusiveness that reflects the diverse communities we serve. We welcome and encourage applications from those who may contribute to the further diversification of ideas. Candidates being considered for this position will be required to submit to a background screening. We thank all applicants, however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Bring your Knowledge of Power BI and Data Analysis

To our Information Technology Team




CPA Ontario is currently in search of a Data Analyst who will be responsible for extracting, analyzing, and interpreting financial data from various sources to support strategic decision-making and operational initiatives. As part of our Enterprise Architecture team, you will work closely with other cross-functional departments including IT, Finance and Operations, collaborating with business stakeholders to provide actionable insights and recommendations. As a Data Analyst you will be accountable for understanding data needs, working to design and develop reports and dashboards, and conducting thorough data analysis to identify trends, patterns, and opportunities for improvement.




What You‚Äôll Be Doing:

Working collaboratively with business stakeholders within IT, Business Intelligence and Finance departments and other operational teams to understand business requirements and translate them into data-driven solutions.




Extracting, cleaning, and manipulating large datasets from multiple sources including financial databases, CRM systems, ERP systems, and spreadsheets.




Performing analysis of data to identify trends, anomalies, and opportunities for improvement.




Designing and developing reports, dashboards, and data visualizations to present findings in a clear and concise manner.




Preparing regular and ad-hoc reports and dashboards to communicate findings to stakeholders.




Conducting variance analysis and performance reporting to support budgeting and forecasting processes.




Assisting in the design and implementation of data collection systems and strategies to optimize efficiency and data quality.




Administering, monitoring, supporting and maintaining SQL servers in our environment.




Staying current in industry trends and best practices in data analysis and modeling.




Who You Are:

A post-secondary graduate preferably in information systems, information technology, computer science, or related field.




Experienced in working with databases and ERP systems with a minimum of 3 years‚Äô experience in a Data Analyst role.




Proficient in SQL, Microsoft Excel and data processing tools and software ‚Äì in particular Power BI.




Proficient in Microsoft Dynamics 365 and SharePoint. Experience with Salesforce or other CRM considered an asset.




Highly organized and able to manage projects and timelines within tight deadlines in a fast-paced environment.




Able to work efficiently and effectively as a team member, as well as independently.




An excellent communicator with the ability to convey ideas succinctly and conveying complex findings and insights to technical and non-technical stakeholders with ease.




A self-starter with excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to think analytically about solutions.




Committed to ongoing training and a desire to learn new skills and continually expand upon knowledge and expertise.




What We Offer:

A fast-paced environment. Collaboration, innovation and passionate professionals are at our core. We relentlessly pursue what‚Äôs next to unlock the full potential of you and us together.




Flexible work environments. As part of our Hybrid work culture, we provide flexible, remote work options to support you in your career, in addition to in-office teamwork and collaboration.




Diversity and inclusion. We recognize the value in our differences and prioritize inclusivity to bring together the best talent to protect the public, advance the profession and enable CPAs to lead business and society forward.




Ongoing learning and career growth. We want your career to skyrocket. We support career advancement and professional development opportunities with learning investments to promote your future growth. Thrive with us.




Focus on your well-being. With industry leading benefits and wellness programs, including a healthy lifestyle allowance, mental health resources and more, we‚Äôre committed to your well-being.




Who We Are:

We protect the public. We advance the profession. We enable CPAs to lead business and society forward. We ensure that our 103,000 members and 18,000 students meet the highest standards of integrity and expertise. We help them stay ahead of global market trends and abreast of regulatory change. CPAs represent a globally recognized, premium designation. Our Chartered Professional Accountants are valued by organizations in all industries for their financial expertise, strategic thinking, management skills and leadership. We believe that success happens when both business and society benefit. For information on the profession visit: cpaontario.ca.




We Appreciate Your Interest In CPA Ontario And This Position:

At CPA Ontario, we are committed to building high-performance teams. Our selection process is thorough, and all candidate applications are reviewed. Should your qualifications and experience meet the requirements of this role, a member of our recruitment team will contact you. We encourage you to set up CPA Ontario job alerts for positions that align to your experience and career goals.




CPA Ontario is an inclusive employer. Accommodation is available under the Ontario Human Rights Code. If you require a disability-related accommodation to participate in the recruitment process, please email accessibility@cpaontario.ca with ‚ÄúAccommodation Required‚Äù in the subject line to provide your contact information. A member of the Recruitment team will contact you within 48 hours.

Title: Investment Data Analyst
Description:
Reporting to the Senior Manager, Investment Data Management (IDM) ‚Äì Data Delivery, the Business Data Analyst is responsible for providing trading application support to the Investment Management (IM) division. The incumbent will manage relationships with IM, external vendors, securities operational and IT teams to address production issues and execute on projects. End to end knowledge of trading workflows will be leveraged support the activities of all stakeholders involved in the trading process.




The incumbent will also be an integral part of data operations that ensures investment applications have complete information for business users daily. This includes operational activities such as setting up securities, portfolios and maintaining data in trade and book of record systems. The incumbent will further contribute to monitoring and responding to the daily cycle of events, ensure data integrity and availability within investment applications, data reconciliation, pricing integrity, security master, integrity of reference data, market data and straight-through trade capture. The Business Data Analyst will assist in the design and implementation of data quality best practices. Data governance practices ensures the integrity, usability and transparency of investment data. Business Data Analyst will be involved in reviewing data governance processes and practices keeping current on industry standards in the data governance space. The Business Data Analyst will assist in the design, build, support and use data quality checks in support of governance process and integrity of investment data across multiple systems.




The position requires strong problem solving and analytical skills coupled with experience in the capital market space. The candidate should have solid investment operations knowledge, securities modelling, managing reference data, market data and systems testing experience. The candidate should be SQL literate and comfortable navigating databases. This position requires the individual to be on support during some holidays depending on investment market activity. There may also be the occasional weekend work for system testing or implementations.




What you will do:

Create and maintain trade support data in investment systems.
Resolve data integrity issues on a timely basis, escalate as needed and work cross team to resolve issues. Candidate should be able to contribute to finding root causes and resolutions for improving controls and efficiency.
Review data integrity checks to assess potential data issues resident in the various investment applications. Create, develop, implement and test data quality checks, processes and procedures to manage data, content quality and reconciliation requirements.
For Production systems the Business Data Analyst is responsible for security master, reference data, maintaining tables and data translations. The controls must be executed for static data, pricing, market data and automated trade capture on an ongoing basis.
Participate in daily operational support scrums to ensure solid support of clients that support the firm's investment activities.
Where changes to application functions are identified, the Business Data Analyst is responsible to work with IT by assisting in the preparation of specifications, providing test cases, testing finished product and signing off.
Document operational processes, data flows, controls and test cases and results.
Develop effective working relationships with the investment management teams, operational teams, custodians, auditors, IT and external vendors and business partners.
Develop a detailed understanding of the investment business and the various systems and operation processes used to support it.
Respond timely, accurately and clearly to questions and problems that arise in the availability, integrity or completeness of Investment Data.
Primary back up and support for Senior Analysts as required.




What you bring:

Knowledge of investment management principles and practices with solid knowledge of marketable securities, derivatives, private placements, infrastructure and real estate.
Experience in the capital market space. Your experience in investment operations, fund valuations or data operations will be especially valuable.
Highly analytical with strong consulting and problem-solving skills.
Solid communication skills verbal and written. Ability to understand and articulate complex topics.
Experience working with databases and knowledge of report development concepts.
Competency in SQL language.
Competency in Python a definite asset.
Advanced Excel knowledge using macros, pivot tables and lookup functions.
Proactive and results oriented with proven time management skills and the ability to work well under pressure and manage multiple tasks concurrently.
Post-secondary training in finance such as the Canadian Securities Course or equivalent experience.
Completion of professional training (CFA, BABOK) is not required though will be an asset.
3 to 5 years in investment and financial systems administration, implementation and reporting.
A team player. Must be able to work cross team.
Comprehensive understanding of middle and back-office processes and technical applications.
Competence with database report writers and software tools in the data quality and data governance space.
An understanding of the accounting and performance reporting requirements will be an asset to this position.
Experience with or proficiency with systems being utilized for the Investment business (SAP HANA,
Eagle PACE, SIMCORP Dimension, Bloomberg, UC4, PagerDuty and SQL query analyzer).
This position requires an above average, technically inclined individual who is a self-starter and highly motivated to manage financial data/systems in an integrated environment.
