HTML:
THE TEAM

The mission of the Data & Analytics Department is to provide the business with actionable and accurate information to enable data-driven decision-making.


THE OPPORTUNITY

Aritzia is growing and our Data & Analytics team is growing with it. This is a unique opportunity to be part of the team responsible for bridging the gap between business strategy and data. As a Sr. Data Analyst, you will combine your deep understanding of who our clients are with your passion for data and masterful analytics skills to uncover opportunities that will enable Aritzia to create long lasting relationships with clients. With the skills you gain in this role, the opportunities are endless ‚Äì from a rewarding career in Analytics to continued growth and development with Aritzia.

*Please note this role could also be based out of New Westminster.


THE ROLE

As the Sr. Data Analyst, you will:

  • Partner closely with business leaders and cross-functional partners to enable data-driven decisions that will enable efficiencies, enhance customer experience and grow the business
  • Consider where we can adopt advanced analytical approaches and influence deployed models through feature engineering and modeling
  • Work independently to deliver on requirements with the highest quality, as well as collaboratively to raise the acumen across data & analytics
  • Clearly visualize and communicate data through reports, dashboards, and presentations
  • Identify and refine modeling requirements to enable insight creation that clearly communicate outcomes and value to stakeholders
  • Understand and transform complex business problems into data & analytics requirements
  • Leverage advanced analytics to derive data driven insights, predict outcomes and recommend actions


THE QUALIFICATIONS

The Sr. Data Analyst has:

  • Proven skills, certifications, education, and/or experience:
  • SQL
  • Visualization tools (Tableau, Looker, Power BI)
  • Google Analytics or Adobe Analytics
  • Python, R or other related analysis tools
  • Familiarity working with AI/ML models
  • Experience working in Retail, eCommerce, or Customer driven industries would be an added benefit
  • A commitment to learn and apply Aritzia's Values and Business and People Leadership principles


THE COMPENSATION

The typical hiring range for this position is $75,000 - 125,000 CAD per year. The final agreed upon salary may vary based on factors such as job-related knowledge, skills and experience. Additionally, this position may be eligible for bonus and equity.


We are always looking for top talent - if your qualifications differ from those listed above, the scope of work and final agreed upon [salary/wage] may be adjusted to reflect your individual qualifications.


Aritzia‚Äôs Everyday Luxury compensation package goes beyond the base salary with endless growth and recognition opportunities through our pay-for-performance philosophy. Along with comprehensive benefits, aspirational workspaces and elevated employee perks and experiences - we provide it all.


THE PERKS

Some of the industry-leading benefits you will receive working at Aritzia:

  • Product Discount ‚Äì Maybe you‚Äôve heard of our famous product discount? Or our exclusive private shopping events? You have now.
  • A-OK Commissary & Caf√© ‚Äì Everyday Luxury dining, exclusive to Aritzia. Our in-house bistro and caf√© is a private oasis where employees can enjoy curated, subsidized Everyday Luxury dining.
  • The SET ‚Äì Our in-office fitness studio and gym with state-of-the-art equipment, custom-created classes, and optional personal training. Open 7 days a week, works out well.
  • Aritzia Virtual Wellness ‚Äì Because your health, happiness, and safety matter ‚Äì 24/7 resources to support you in your wellbeing goals, be it physical, mental, social, or financial.
  • Aspirational Workplace ‚Äì Our offices are specially designed to be spaces of creativity, productivity, and inspiration. They‚Äôre also dog friendly. Woof.
  • Amenities ‚Äì Additional amenities include a private parent‚Äôs room, shower facilities with elevated complementary conveniences, bike rooms, and more.
  • The Extras ‚Äì We also offer a multitude of other perks like dry-cleaning, hotel and restaurant discounts, self-care promos and on-site medical care.




ARITZIA


Aritzia is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer. Our goal is to be inclusive, diverse, and representative of the communities where we work while creating an environment where every person can enjoy a successful career. This commitment applies to all candidates and employees regardless of race, ethnicity, citizenship, creed, place of origin, religion, sex, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, family status, marital status, disability, age, and any other protected characteristic.


Requests for accommodation due to a disability or any other protected characteristic can be made at any stage of the recruitment process and during employment by contacting our People & Culture Team.

Title: Data Analyst, Investment Data Management
Description:
Connor, Clark & Lunn Financial Group (CCLFG)

Vancouver, BC

We are looking for a Data Analyst to join our Vancouver based Investment Data Management team.

The Investment Data Management Team (IDM) resides within the middle office and is responsible for managing data centric processes and data quality that supports the investment management business. Connor, Clark & Lunn Financial Group Ltd. (CCLFG) manages a wide range of global assets and heavily relies on the output of the DMT for a variety of functions from the front office to the back. This is a fantastic opportunity to be part of a dynamic strategic team whose scope and importance continues to grow enterprise wide.

We place a high value on maintaining an entrepreneurial spirit and creating a culture where each of us have opportunities to succeed. We are a solution orientated and collaborative team seeking likeminded individuals who thrive in a challenging and dynamic environment. This is a Vancouver based role, which offers a flexibility between working from home and the office.

What You‚Äôll Be Doing

This role operates in a unique position, working closely with front office traders, investment managers and a wide range of investment-operation business unit in the middle and back-office. You will use your financial and technical knowledge, to provide critical investment data inputs to the whole investment operations process. Our analysts are empowered to thrive as process owners, with both the creativity and responsibility that comes with delegation. Our

team continuously strives to identify improvements to operations to scale and grow with the business; you will work highly collaboratively with your team members and dedicated development teams to execute.

Key Responsibilities Include


Security Master: Maintain and validate accuracy of equity/fixed income/derivative data across multiple systems/databases to enable Investment Manager modeling, trading, and risk monitoring.
Process Manager: Manage and enable a myriad of scheduled processes for vendor systems, internal and market data transfers, valuation, and benchmarking data inputs to the investment process.
Data Quality Expert: Deliver timely data signoffs to investment teams; develop and analyze data-quality exceptions and ensure timely resolution.
Stakeholder Servicer: Provide analysis on operational needs, ad-hoc data/data-history requests for multiple business partners to support pre- and post-trade portfolio management functions.
Process Improver: Identify process/workflow improvements to increase operational efficiency, mitigate risk, improve data-quality, and increase service levels provided to stakeholders.
Supporter of other operational or engineering staff, senior or managers on a variety of ad-hoc tasks and projects.


About You


Education ‚Äì You have a degree in Finance, Commerce, Business Administration, Business Operations, or a related field. Relevant designation, such as the MBA, CFA, or FRM is an asset.
Industry Knowledge ‚Äì Some experience in the investment management industry with exposure to equity, fixed income, and/or derivatives would be ideal. 1-2 years would be an asset.
Problem Solver / Technical ‚Äì You possess an analytical mindset and able to break down complex processes into components to logically deduce the root cause of issues in data and technology.
Collaborative ‚Äì You have a collaborative spirit that helps you to work well with others and you communicate effectively to team/cross-team members, and upward to key stakeholders.
Self-Motivated ‚Äì You have a passion for advancing the quality, scale, and efficiency of data processes and can take ownership of multiple processes with keen attention to detail.
Continuous Process Improvement Mindset ‚Äì You constantly take a critical eye to processes with the goal of finding improvement opportunities and bring an ability to manage multiple projects.


The salary range for this position is 60-90k. The salary range provided reflects the base salary range for this position as required by legislation. In addition, there is an annual performance bonus which contributes to the total compensation of this position. Further questions may be directed to the HR team during the interview process.

About Connor, Clark & Lunn Financial Group

At Connor, Clark & Lunn Financial Group, we understand the value of opportunity ‚Äì for our clients and our team. Independent and employee-owned, we partner with investment professionals to grow successful asset management businesses, giving them the space to innovate and truly make an impact.

With more than 40 years of history and offices across Canada and in the US, the UK and India, CC&L Financial Group and our multi-boutique family of affiliate firms collectively manage over $133 billion in assets, providing a diverse range of traditional and alternative investment products and solutions to institutional, high-net-worth and retail clients.

For a closer look at how you can build your career with us, we invite you to explore www.cclgroup.com .

CC&L is committed to creating a diverse and inclusive environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to gender, ethnicity, religion, sexual orientation or expression, disability, or age.

To apply for this position, please submit your resume and cover letter as one PDF.

We thank all applicants in advance for their interest, but only those candidates shortlisted for interviews will be contacted. No telephone calls or recruitment agencies will be accepted.

Apply for this Position

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst
HTML:
Clio is more than just a tech company‚Äìwe are a global leader that is transforming the legal experience for all by bettering the lives of legal professionals while increasing access to justice.

Summary:

We are currently looking for a new Business Intelligence Analyst to join our Business Intelligence team in one of our Vancouver, Calgary, or Toronto locations.

What your team does:

Our Business Intelligence team is part of the larger Data & AI group. Together, we‚Äôre focused on stewarding a scientific culture to drive better decisions. Along with the Manager of Business Intelligence, you will be working across departments to empower all stakeholders to make better decisions through data-oriented solutions, with a focus on making data easy and accessible at Clio. You will help our business grow, help our customers succeed, and continuously improve the way we operate.

Who you are:

We aren‚Äôt looking for just any traditional Business Intelligence Analyst to join this team. We‚Äôre looking for someone who takes data seriously, thrives in a rapid-growth, high-velocity environment, and someone who lives and breathes their values. We‚Äôre looking for an innovator and a thought leader! We‚Äôre looking for someone who is:

  • Passionate about driving growth empirically;
  • Always looking to innovate with data and explore open-ended questions;
  • Strategically minded and never shies away from a challenge;
  • Self-motivated and able to work autonomously and collaboratively;
  • Agile and responsive, and comfortable with constant change.

What you‚Äôll work on:

  • Partnering with stakeholders, self-serve report creators, the data scientists and data engineers, and others to create meaningful, intentional data solutions;
  • Standardizing source of truth dashboards and applying best practices to create dashboards that convey the most important metrics for the business;
  • Creating and editing data models for users to answer business questions and optimize queries and reports for performance;
  • Effectively communicating findings and feedback to technical and non-technical stakeholders;
  • Working with the Business Intelligence Manager to govern our BI environment to empower our self serve stakeholders leveraging data and dashboards;
  • Working with the Business Intelligence Manager to proactively identify and resolve gaps in training, learning resources, and other roadblocks preventing stakeholders from leveraging data for decision making.

What you may have:

  • An undergraduate or graduate degree in a relevant quantitative discipline (computing science, statistics, mathematics, etc.);
  • 3+ years applied experience in business intelligence and/or data modeling;
  • Proficiency in database modeling, SQL, and knowledge of data warehousing principles;
  • Proficiency with data visualization and data storytelling;
  • An understanding or familiarity of SaaS business metrics such as MRR, churn etc;
  • A passion for understanding data and to figure out the root cause of a metric trending below target;
  • Proven experience with one or several cloud based business intelligence tools, incl. Tableau, PowerBI, and Looker;
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills.

Serious bonus points if you:

  • Have experience working with Redshift or other cloud data warehouses;
  • Are an expert translating technical solutions to non-technical stakeholders;

What you will find here:

Compensation is one of the main components of Clio‚Äôs Total Rewards Program. We have developed a series of programs and processes to ensure we are creating fair and competitive pay practices that form the foundation of our human and high-performing culture.

Some highlights of our Total Rewards program include:

  • Competitive, equitable salary with top-tier health benefits, dental, and vision insurance
  • Hybrid work environment, with expectation for local Clions (Vancouver, Calgary, Toronto, and Dublin) to be in office min. once per week on our Anchor Day.
  • Flexible time off policy, with an encouraged 20 days off per year.
  • $2000 annual counseling benefit
  • RRSP matching and RESP contribution
  • Clioversary recognition program with special acknowledgement at 3, 5, 7, and 10 years

The expected salary range* for this role is $78,400 to $106,100 CAD. Please note there are a separate set of salary bands for other regions based on local currency.

  • Our salary bands are designed to reflect the range of skills and experience needed for the position and to allow room for growth at Clio. For experienced individuals, we typically hire at or around the midpoint of the band. The top portion of the salary band is reserved for employees who demonstrate sustained high performance and impact at Clio. Those who are new to the role may join below the midpoint and develop their skills over time. The final offer amount for this role will be dependent on geographical region, applicable experience, and skillset of the candidate.

Diversity, Inclusion, Belonging and Equity (DIBE) & Accessibility

Our team shows up as their authentic selves, and are united by our mission. We are dedicated to diversity, equity and inclusion. We pride ourselves in building and fostering an environment where our teams feel included, valued, and enabled to do the best work of their careers, wherever they choose to log in from. We believe that different perspectives, skills, backgrounds, and experiences result in higher-performing teams and better innovation. We are committed to equal employment and we encourage candidates from all backgrounds to apply.

Clio provides accessibility accommodations during the recruitment process. Should you require any accommodation, please let us know and we will work with you to meet your needs.

Learn more about our culture at clio.com/careers

Title: Data Analyst (Paladin Security)
Description:
Job Skills / Requirements

Our Data Analyst is primarily responsible for creating and maintaining effective reports in Power BI, Excel, and other reporting tools, as deemed necessary. Additionally, the role involves assisting with the maintenance and enhancement of data warehouse objects in Microsoft Azure.

This person will bring a sharp analytical mind, inclination for problem solving, and strong communication skills to provide meaningful insights that can translate into evidence-based business decisions.

Responsibilities


Prepares reports in Power BI, Power BI Report Builder and other platforms
Conducts research and meets with internal stakeholders to thoroughly understand business problems and reporting deliverables
Thinks critically to offer effective solutions/improvements to data collection and report generation processes
Creates presentations showcasing reporting insights and actionable strategies
Builds and maintains ETL/ELT pipelines for efficient data processing and integration
Assists with the development of data warehouse objects in SQL/ Microsoft Azure, ensuring efficient data storage and retrieval
Thinks critically to offer effective solutions to data collection and report generation processes
Monitors the performance of reports, implements improvements as required, and ensures data integrity
Performs other duties as required to meet organizational requirements


Requirements


Proficiency with SQL, Power BI (DAX, Power Query, and Report Builder), and Excel
Experience with data warehousing, creating/ using data models, and managing databases
Highly analytical mindset with the ability to prepare reports including descriptive statistics
Ability to communicate technical requirements and reporting insights effectively
Knowledge of ETL/ELT processes and tools, with hands-on experience in building pipelines
Proficiency or practical experience with big data solutions for data processing and analysis
Strong problem-solving skills, with the ability to offer innovative solutions
Excellent prioritization and time management skills; exceptional attention to detail
Self-motivated with the ability to work independently with limited direction


This is a Full-Time position

Value

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Founded in Vancouver, Canada in 2003, Plenty of Fish is one of the early pioneers in the online dating industry, with one of the largest and most diverse communities of singles. We're one of the top revenue-driving brands in the Match Group (comprised of Tinder, OkCupid, Hinge and Match.com).

We love what we do, and have the ability to profoundly impact millions of people's lives every single day! Named one of BC‚Äôs Top Employers, Plenty of Fish is a great place to build friendships, grow your career and collaborate with top talent.

We work hybrid at Plenty of Fish - IRL in our downtown Vancouver office on Tuesday and Wednesday and work remotely the remainder of the week!

We are looking for someone to be a part of our Product Analytics team, who will work cross-functionally with the rest of the organization to help identify, understand, and improve business and product challenges facing Plenty of Fish. The Senior Product Analyst will deliver high-quality strategic and tactical analysis; collaborating with the product, engineering, data science, business intelligence, customer service, and marketing teams.

So, what will you do?


Provide a variety of stakeholders from Executives, Product Managers, Engineering Managers, or other Data Analysts, with deep-dive quantitative analyses and present them in an immediately usable format, extracting key insights from extensive, complex data sets
Proactively find opportunities to take analytics framework to the next level and lead stakeholders to adopt new frameworks and methodologies
Quantitatively analyze user behaviour to help determine product strategy and drive business decisions, including driving decisions from A/B test learnings
Take ownership of ambiguous and complex analytical assignments



You'll be a match for this role if you have..


5+ years of progressive experience using quantitative analysis to make business-focused recommendations
Strong understanding of incrementally as well as sizing business problems and opportunities
Proven technical data analytics skills in working with large amounts of data at different levels of aggregation, from raw telemetry to metric stores.
Experience with raw clickstream data (telemetry event data) and datasets of 100 million+ records
Experience with web/digital analytics metrics (Daily Active Users, Retention, Churn)
Understanding of basic statistical concepts such as confidence interval, normal distribution, correlation, linear regression, and multivariate testing
Proficiency with SQL or other query languages
Strong experience with A/B test analysis
In-depth experience with data visualization and analytical tools (E.g. Tableau, PowerBI, Looker)
A proactive skill set that encompasses problem identification, analysis, solution definition, results, and communication
Experience with Python or a willingness to learn



$116,000 - $130,000 a year

Factors such as scope and responsibilities of the position, candidate's work experience, education/training, job-related skills, internal peer equity, as well as market and business considerations may influence base pay offered. This salary range is reflective of a position based in Vancouver, British Columbia.


We would love to hear from you, even if you don't match 100% of the requirements**



Why Plenty of Fish?


We're recognized as one of BC's Top Employers 2023 !
Generous vacation, flex days, professional development days
RRSP matching, and employee stock purchase plan
Professional development budget and unlimited access to Udemy from day one
Match Group mentorship program
Parental leave top up and fertility preservation benefits
Extended health & dental benefits from day one
Corporate ClassPass membership and other wellness benefits
And many more on our careers page



Our Values


Be Proud - We own our ship. We see challenges as opportunities and take action.
Make Waves - We profoundly impact millions of peoples' lives, every day.
Dive Deep - We empathize with our members and use data to surface thoughtful decisions.
Crew Together - We're all working towards the same goals and win as a team.



Want To Dive Deeper?

LinkedIn

Glassdoor

We‚Äôre committed to creating an equal and inclusive environment; we welcome all crew (and prospective crew) members regardless of race, colour, ancestry, place of origin, political belief, religion, marital status, family status, physical or mental disability, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, conviction unrelated to employment, or any other prohibited ground of discrimination recognized by applicable law. Plenty of Fish is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace.

If you require reasonable accommodation to complete a job application, pre-employment testing, or a job interview or to otherwise participate in the hiring process, please speak to your recruiter directly.

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Covet Fashion is seeking an inquisitive and experienced Data Analyst to join our Product Management team. Reporting to the Director of Product, you will work with partners to understand player engagement, session behaviors, game usage and spending habits, and to identify product growth opportunities. You will use your skills to provide data-driven solutions to complex problems, translate qualitative/quantitative data into insights, and create recommendations to steer the product development and live operational roadmaps.

Responsibilities


Collaborate with product, design, and engineering to deliver insights into user behavior and to guide product decisions.
Help design, implement and report on A/B tests aimed at enhancing the user experience, utilizing statistical methods to draw meaningful conclusions.
Analyze player segments and behavior to support tailored content strategies.
Perform advanced statistical analyses to identify trends, patterns, and provide actionable insights.
Develop dashboards and self-serve tools to communicate findings and performance metrics to our partners and encourage the use of data in product decisions.
Communicate results and findings throughout the organization to all levels of leadership.


Requirements


A bachelor's degree in Business, Statistics, Mathematics, Economics, Data Science, Analytics, or a related field.
4+ years of experience in an analytics role performing quantitative analysis with big data to help guide decisions.
Experience in SQL and ability to extract data from large data sources with differing structures.
Experience with data visualization software (e.g. Tableau, PowerBI, Looker).
Passion for mobile lifestyle gaming is a plus.


If you are passionate about mobile gaming and possess the skills and expertise to drive the success of Covet Fashion at Electronic Arts, we encourage you to apply for this exciting opportunity.

Covet Fashion is seeking an inquisitive and experienced Data Analyst to join our Product Management team. Reporting to the Director of Product, you will work with partners to understand player engagement, session behaviors, game usage and spending habits, and to identify product growth opportunities. You will use your skills to provide data-driven solutions to complex problems, translate qualitative/quantitative data into insights, and create recommendations to steer the product development and live operational roadmaps.

Responsibilities

  • Collaborate with product, design, and engineering to deliver insights into user behavior and to guide product decisions.
  • Help design, implement and report on A/B tests aimed at enhancing the user experience, utilizing statistical methods to draw meaningful conclusions.
  • Analyze player segments and behavior to support tailored content strategies.
  • Perform advanced statistical analyses to identify trends, patterns, and provide actionable insights.
  • Develop dashboards and self-serve tools to communicate findings and performance metrics to our partners and encourage the use of data in product decisions.
  • Communicate results and findings throughout the organization to all levels of leadership.

Requirements

  • A bachelor's degree in Business, Statistics, Mathematics, Economics, Data Science, Analytics, or a related field.
  • 4+ years of experience in an analytics role performing quantitative analysis with big data to help guide decisions.
  • Experience in SQL and ability to extract data from large data sources with differing structures.
  • Experience with data visualization software (e.g. Tableau, PowerBI, Looker).
  • Passion for mobile lifestyle gaming is a plus.

If you are passionate about mobile gaming and possess the skills and expertise to drive the success of Covet Fashion at Electronic Arts, we encourage you to apply for this exciting opportunity.

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst ‚Äì BTO
Description:
JOIN US IN ENABLING TRADE THROUGH CANADA'S LARGEST PORT.

The Vancouver Fraser Port Authority is an arm‚Äôs-length federal agency responsible for the shared stewardship of the lands and waters that make up the Port of Vancouver, Canada‚Äôs largest port. Our mandate, as outlined in the Canada Marine Act, is to enable Canada‚Äôs trade objectives on behalf of all Canadians, ensuring the safe movement of goods through the Port of Vancouver while protecting the environment and considering local communities.




As an organization with a significant impact on communities and businesses across Canada, the Vancouver Fraser Port Authority is dedicated to diversity, inclusion, and sustainability. We strive to create a workplace that mirrors the richness of our community, empowering all employees to achieve their full potential.




The business intelligence analyst ‚Äì BTO develops and implements visualizations and dashboards that provide actionable insights to the business. This role uses a blend of creative and technical skills to develop intuitive BI solutions that meet the needs of our users.




What You Do:

Collaborate with business units to gather requirements, objectives, and KPIs, understand their reporting, data, and product needs, and identify data dependencies and relationships
Create appropriate datasets, data flows in Microsoft data platform based on the defined information architecture
Design and develop and deploy user-friendly, visually appealing BI dashboards and reports using BI tools such as Tableau or Power BI
Build and narrate data stories and guide in building PowerPoint decks
Provide technical expertise regarding the unique features and constraints of Power BI and related technologies, including best practice recommendations
Develop documentation, user guides, and training materials to support user adoption and customer service. Provide ongoing support, troubleshooting, and maintenance of workflows, addressing user-reported issues
Catalogue, develop and maintain operational reporting, dashboards and scorecards that track organization key metrics




What You Bring:

Bachelor‚Äôs degree in data science, computer science, management information systems, or other relevant discipline
Minimum three (3) years of experience working with BI tools or any data-specific role, plus demonstrated experience of database management, data modeling, business intelligence, SQL querying, data warehousing, and online analytical processing (OLAP)
Expertise in tools and systems on MS SQL Server BI Stack, including SSRS and TSQL, Power Query, MDX, Power BI, and DAX is required
Experience in configuration of Microsoft Dynamics and Power Platforms is an asset
Experience in configuring, customizing, and extending Dynamics 365 CRM to meet business needs, including workflows, forms, entities, and plugins is an asset
Strong ability to discern trends and patterns from large amounts of raw data
Excellent analytic and problem-solving skills with the ability to take a thoughtful data driven approach to addressing workforce challenges
Must be able to deal with ambiguity and create processes and structure where it does not currently exist
Ability to maintain utmost confidentiality and work with restricted confidential data
Ability to quickly shape data in reporting and analytics solutions and perform testing to assure report and dashboard accuracy




What We Offer:

Market-competitive base salaries and variable incentive plan
Generous and inclusive benefits offering including retirement benefits plan
Earned time off program
Paid vacation and personal care leave
Learning, development, and advancement opportunities
Onsite gym with towel service in a national landmark in the heart of Vancouver‚Äôs waterfront
Friendly, unique, and respectful workplace




Location: Vancouver, Canada

Job type: Bargaining Unit, Full-Time, Permanent, Hybrid

Working environment: Normal office conditions. Flexibility to respond to issues during non-working hours as required.




Marine Transportation Security Clearance

This position is required to access restricted areas/information. The incumbent must obtain and maintain a valid Marine Transportation Security Clearance as defined by the Marine Transportation Security Regulations.




This is Canadian-based employment, and it is expected that all employees maintain legal entitlement to work in Canada. Applicants selected to move forward in the hiring process may be subject to background checks, including but not limited to criminal record, credit, and/or reference checks.




At the Vancouver Fraser Port Authority, we are dedicated to employment equity and a workplace reflective of the diversity of our port community. We welcome applications from all qualified candidates including women, persons with disabilities, Indigenous peoples, and members of visible minorities. Reasonable accommodation can be provided in the selection process and while working with the port authority. If you require support applying to our openings, please contact us at careers@portvancouver.com.

Title: Business Intelligence Data Specialist
Description:
Working at Trail Appliances means joining an entrepreneurial-minded, driven team dedicated to delivering an exceptional customer experience. Trail Appliances is the leading independent appliance retailer in Western Canada. We‚Äôre a fast-growing company with over 500 employees in British Columbia, spread out over 10 showrooms, 3 Outlet Centres, 3 distribution centres, and 4 offices in BC's major markets. Join our team of trailblazers! Our core values: Integrity ‚Äì We do what‚Äôs right, even when no one is looking. Improvement ‚Äì We do it well. Then we do it better. Caring ‚Äì We put ourselves in others‚Äô shoes. Authenticity ‚Äì We like people, not pretense. Determination ‚Äì We kick down walls. We have everything we need to inspire our customers. Except you. Reporting to the Senior Manager of Software Development, the Data Engineer will be instrumental in designing, managing and supporting operationally the data and reporting landscape for the business. The position will be a very strategic role leveraging the candidate‚Äôs experience in data modelling, data warehousing and report model creation to help shape the next generation of business intelligence and report offerings for the business as we move towards a new to be architecture leveraging the latest technologies in the space. The position will be joining at an exciting time as the business has embarked on a digital transformation journey moving its operation to the cloud and new technologies. As a BI Data Specialist, you will


Have ownership and governance of the business intelligence and reporting platform offerings for the business
Provide insight into reporting platform usage and metrics
Support migration of the existing data warehouse and related critical reporting to a new future state data warehousing platform and data structure
Enforce data cleanliness and consistency and be the gatekeeper for data quality in the bi platform.
Create data dictionaries to support the reporting platform
Identify opportunities that can improve efficiency of business processes
Troubleshoot technical issues and identify modifications needed in existing reporting applications to meet changing user requirements



To be successful in this role, you have


Minimum of 8 years‚Äô practical experience
Post-secondary degree in computer science or related field or a combination of related experience and education.
Strong general technical experience with relational databases, data modelling and data warehousing principles
Expertise in the Microsoft SQL Server stack ‚Äì TSQL, SSIS, SSRS and SSAS
Expertise in Microsoft Power BI
Strong working experience with data migration, data cleansing, validation and de-duplication
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Experience in the development and implementation of standards, procedures and guidelines to support operational processes.
Self-motivation and the ability to prioritize, meet deadlines, and manage changing priorities
Proven ability to be flexible and work hard, both independently and in a team environment
Willingness to work occasionally outside of normal business hours.
Willingness to learn
Excellent English oral and written communication skills.
A results-oriented individual who thrives working in a fast-paced environment



The experience we like to see


Practical experience with cloud computing (Azure preferred)
Practical experience with Microsoft D365
Practical experience with Azure DevOps
Working knowledge of CI/CD and associated pipelines
Working knowledge of GIT
Practical experience with Azure Data Warehouse
Practical experience with Microsoft Fabric including Synapse Data Warehouse and Data Factory
Practical experience with CRM



Why Join Trail?


Extended Health Benefits
Merit Performance
Generous employee discounts
Gym membership discount
Professional Development Programs
Employee Recognition Program
Company events
Paid Volunteer



INDHPN We inspire possibilities, make shopping ridiculously easy, and help create special moments at home. Are you ready to meet your team?

Title: Business Systems Analyst
Description:
Description

We are seeking a Business Systems Analyst to join our clients team in Vancouver, British Columbia. In this role, you will be tasked with organizing, monitoring, and acting on requests in the help desk application and shared mailboxes. This Business Systems Analyst contract opportunity is offered on a hybrid basis with an initial term of 6-months, with potential to go permanent for the right individual.

Responsibilities


Ensuring effective communication across all levels within the organization
Assisting with the administration and testing of core Cognos Planning and Analytics and Cognos BI modules
Designing, testing, developing, and maintaining complex financial reports from multiple data providers using a variety of tools
Maintaining and managing Microsoft SQL data, performing reporting data extracts as needed
Assisting with the design and testing of Cognos TM1 TurboIntegrator processes for various global financial data collection and reporting systems
Working with managers, technical staff, and users to implement financial solutions, which includes involvement in requirement analysis, test plans, training, meetings, and documentation
Maintaining Cognos TM1 data and performing reporting data extracts as required
Developing and maintaining training documentation to support the required processes
Conducting system and quality assurance testing
Utilizing skills in Database, AB Testing, Agile Scrum, Business Process Functions, Business Requirement Document, IBM Cognos TM1, Microsoft SQL


Requirements


Proficiency in utilizing Database systems.
Proficiency with Microsoft SQL.
Prior experience with reporting tools such as PowerBI or Tableau considered an asset.
Experience with AB Testing methods.
Familiarity with Agile Scrum methodology.
Understanding of Business Process Functions.
Ability to create and manage Business Requirement Documents.
Experience with IBM Cognos TM1 software considered an asset.
Finance experience considered an asset.

Title: Data & Analytics - Analytics Engineer
Description:
THE TEAM

The mission of the Analytics Department is to provide the business with actionable and accurate information to enable data-driven decision-making.




THE OPPORTUNITY

Aritzia is experiencing exponential growth, and the Data & Analytics team is growing with it. This is a unique opportunity to join the Analytics Engineering Department, where you will transform raw data in a modern platform and create models that empower self-serve analysis, reporting, and data science. As the Analytics Engineer, you will support and enable the business, apply data modeling expertise, and become the data domain go-to person. And with the skills you gain in this role the opportunities are endless, from a rewarding career in Data & Analytics to continued growth at Aritzia.




THE ROLE

As the Analytics Engineer, you will lead and be involved in:

Develop complex SQL transformations to create beautifully designed and widely used data models
Embed and enrich business logic to unify the analysis of cross functional teams
Design and recommend data model structure and flow
Review and approve model changes and be the technical owner for specific data sub-domains
Create in Google Cloud Platform and Dataform (Google‚Äôs version of DBT)
Contribute to and leverage the best practices and standards of analytics engineering




THE QUALIFICATIONS

The Analytics Engineer has:

Proven skills, education, and/or applicable certifications in:
Excellent SQL skills with the ability to create efficient data models, applied to cloud data warehousing in particular
Strong business modelling skills: going from expressed requirements to an actual data model
Varied design options of reshaping data tables
Modern cloud data platforms such as GCP, MS, AWS
Object-oriented programming (OOP) understanding
SAP HANA data environment is a plus
An enthusiastic approach to taking on new opportunities and challenges
The ability to collaborate fluently with cross-functional partners
A commitment to learn and apply Aritzia's Business and People Leadership principles




THE COMPENSATION

The typical hiring range for this position is $75,000 - $150,000 CAD per year. The final agreed upon salary may vary based on factors such as job-related knowledge, skills and experience.




We are always looking for top talent - if your qualifications differ from those listed above, the scope of work and final agreed upon [salary/wage] may be adjusted to reflect your individual qualifications.




Aritzia‚Äôs Everyday Luxury compensation package goes beyond the base salary with endless growth and recognition opportunities through our pay-for-performance philosophy. Along with comprehensive benefits, aspirational workspaces and elevated employee perks and experiences - we provide it all.




THE PERKS

Some of the industry-leading benefits you will receive working at Aritzia:

Flexible Working Model - The option to work Remotely, On-site, or Hybrid in Canada
A-OK Commissary & Caf√© - Our in-office, world-class bistro and caf√©
The SET - Our in-house gym, with state-of-the art equipment and custom classes
Dog Friendly Office - Bring your best friend to work
Product Discount - Our famous product discount, online and in store




ARITZIA




Aritzia is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer. Our goal is to be inclusive, diverse, and representative of the communities where we work while creating an environment where every person can enjoy a successful career. This commitment applies to all candidates and employees regardless of race, ethnicity, citizenship, creed, place of origin, religion, sex, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, family status, marital status, disability, age, and any other protected characteristic.




Requests for accommodation due to a disability or any other protected characteristic can be made at any stage of the recruitment process and during employment by contacting our People & Culture Team.

As the Analytics Engineer, you will lead and be involved in:

  • Develop complex SQL transformations to create beautifully designed and widely used data models
  • Embed and enrich business logic to unify the analysis of cross functional teams
  • Design and recommend data model structure and flow
  • Review and approve model changes and be the technical owner for specific data sub-domains
  • Create in Google Cloud Platform and Dataform (Google‚Äôs version of DBT)
  • Contribute to and leverage the best practices and standards of analytics engineering


THE QUALIFICATIONS

The Analytics Engineer has:

  • Proven skills, education, and/or applicable certifications in:
  • Excellent SQL skills with the ability to create efficient data models, applied to cloud data warehousing in particular
  • Strong business modelling skills: going from expressed requirements to an actual data model
  • Varied design options of reshaping data tables
  • Modern cloud data platforms such as GCP, MS, AWS
  • Object-oriented programming (OOP) understanding
  • SAP HANA data environment is a plus
  • An enthusiastic approach to taking on new opportunities and challenges
  • The ability to collaborate fluently with cross-functional partners
  • A commitment to learn and apply Aritzia's Business and People Leadership principles


THE COMPENSATION

The typical hiring range for this position is $75,000 - $150,000 CAD per year. The final agreed upon salary may vary based on factors such as job-related knowledge, skills and experience.


We are always looking for top talent - if your qualifications differ from those listed above, the scope of work and final agreed upon [salary/wage] may be adjusted to reflect your individual qualifications.


Aritzia‚Äôs Everyday Luxury compensation package goes beyond the base salary with endless growth and recognition opportunities through our pay-for-performance philosophy. Along with comprehensive benefits, aspirational workspaces and elevated employee perks and experiences - we provide it all.


THE PERKS

Some of the industry-leading benefits you will receive working at Aritzia:

  • Flexible Working Model - The option to work Remotely, On-site, or Hybrid in Canada
  • A-OK Commissary & Caf√© - Our in-office, world-class bistro and caf√©
  • The SET - Our in-house gym, with state-of-the art equipment and custom classes
  • Dog Friendly Office - Bring your best friend to work
  • Product Discount - Our famous product discount, online and in store


ARITZIA


Aritzia is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer. Our goal is to be inclusive, diverse, and representative of the communities where we work while creating an environment where every person can enjoy a successful career. This commitment applies to all candidates and employees regardless of race, ethnicity, citizenship, creed, place of origin, religion, sex, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, family status, marital status, disability, age, and any other protected characteristic.


Requests for accommodation due to a disability or any other protected characteristic can be made at any stage of the recruitment process and during employment by contacting our People & Culture Team.

Title: Advanced Data Analyst - Frostbite
Description:
Frostbite is EA's state-of-the-art multi-platform game development engine. Our global team empowers game creators to shape the future of gaming by developing creative engine features and outstanding tools. We are honoured to have thousands of game developers all over the world using Frostbite to create some of the most amazing games and player experiences in the industry.

The Frostbite team is working on a wide array of projects to support the needs of our game developers. As an Advanced Data Analyst, reporting to the Director of Analytics, you will work with the Frostbite Operations team to improve the efficiency of our business operations. You will use your analytical skills to transform the operational needs of the business into insights and influence how Frostbite helps EA make amazing games.

You will..


You will work with the Sr. Operations Manager of the Frostbite team to tell a story with high-dimensionality data from multiple sources by using different tools and data analysis techniques.
You will perform data-gap analysis on the data generated by the business processes to identify improvements in the existing data and define new data to be captured.
You will design data models that capture all the essential data generated by the business processes.
You will determine important metrics that provide feedback on the efficacy of the business.
You will prepare detailed reports that help the business monitor the processes and identify new areas of opportunity to improve the impact of their products and services.
You will evaluate, interpret, and present data to find risks and opportunities to improve our service.
You will conduct statistical analysis for identifying patterns and trends, hypothesis testing, prediction, or inference.


You bring...


7+ years of work experience in a past analytical role, 3+ years of verifiable work experience in the field of business operations, using data to create operational improvements.
Bachelor's degree in a technical field (Computer Science, Statistics, Engineering, Mathematics, or Economics) or completion of post- secondary level Math and Statistics courses.
Experience of Microsoft Power BI or other comparable BI tool.
Proficient in SQL and Python.
Hands-on experience with Databricks technology and Cloud Computing platforms (i.e. Azure, AWS, or GCP).


Soft Skills


Be able to engage with both senior business management and technical people when discussing data analysis needs or findings.
Can move beyond data by translating customer needs into user requirements.


Bc Compensation And Benefits

The base salary ranges listed below are for the defined geographic market pay zones in these locations. If you reside outside of these locations, a recruiter will advise on the base salary range and benefits for your specific location.

EA has listed the base salary ranges it in good faith expects to pay applicants for this role in the locations listed, as of the time of this posting. Salary offered will be determined based on numerous relevant business and candidate factors including, for example, education, qualifications, certifications, experience, skills, geographic location, and business or organizational needs.

BASE SALARY RANGES


British Columbia (depending on location e.g. Vancouver vs. Victoria):


¬∫ $107,600 - $147,100 CAN Annually

Base salary is just one part of the overall compensation at EA. We also offer a package of benefits including vacation (3 weeks per year to start), 10 days per year of sick time, paid top-up to EI/QPIP benefits up to 100% of base salary when you welcome a new child (12 weeks for maternity, and 4 weeks for parental/adoption leave), extended health/dental/vision coverage, life insurance, disability insurance, retirement plan to regular full-time employees. Certain roles may also be eligible for bonus and equity.

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
At our core, Electronic Arts is a game maker that connects hundreds of millions of players from around the globe to some of the world's greatest games. The EAX team is driving the strategy and implementation of essential projects for EA's community of players to connect them to the games they love to play. These projects span the digital touchpoints where players use the EA Network, including EA's gaming service on PC through the new EA Desktop application; the EA Play subscription program on PC, PlayStation, Xbox, and Steam; EA.com's corporate, marketing and player engagement activations, and a host of other consumer experiences and strategies to connect players across platforms and within our games.

As a Data Architect, you will be instrumental in moulding EAX‚Äôs data solutions, including structure, validation, documentation, storage, and retrieval. Partnering with product owners, designers, DDs, QV, and other engineers, you will design unified data models that support the current needs of our games and are extendable to future needs. In this role, you will strongly impact EAX‚Äôs core business, influencing how data is structured, stored, retrieved and applied. As part of the broader software engineering discipline, you report to a Lead Software Engineer on the EAX team.

Joining EAX means you will shape EA‚Äôs online presence; evolve subscription services that span three significant platforms; build consumer experiences that power EA's games and promote more personalized, socially connected experiences; and expand our platforms across web, PC, mobile, the cloud and beyond so our players can get into the games they want to play and stay connected while playing. We like to say that "we see farther," and are committed to driving innovation to meet player needs today and in the future.

You're Someone With a Proven Track Record Who


Has experience working with distributed systems and large-scale data infrastructure
Is excited about improving the player experience by simplifying large, complex data sets that power player-facing apps
Seeks opportunities to improve the employee experience for engineers and content authors
Has designed or supported data schemas and data validation workflows
Is experienced in developing and maintaining data management systems and workflows
Has experience writing comparison scripts and tools


You also bring the following skills or experiences to our team:


Experience with high-scale e-commerce
Experience in data migration from legacy systems
An interest in gaming or digital platforms and digital distribution strategies
Skilled in gathering and analyzing system requirements, identifying gaps, and proposing practical solutions while ensuring alignment with business goals
Experienced in managing, querying, and analyzing structured and unstructured databases
Strong understanding of various database types (relational, graph, document) and APIs


In a typical week, the Data Architect may...


Collaborate with engineering and publishing teams to understand and improve workflows
Contribute to normalizing data models, systems and apps to meet reliability, performance and compliance needs
Review and provide feedback on data modeling opportunities supporting a new ecommerce feature
Collaborate with external teams to continuously update and align a data strategy


You‚Äôll build relationships and work with‚Ä¶


Other members of the EAX organization to provide engineering support and feedback
EA staff who publish content and games to EA apps
Game development teams for support, feature requests and distribution platform feature integration


"

Bc Compensation And Benefits

The base salary ranges listed below are for the defined geographic market pay zones in these locations. If you reside outside of these locations, a recruiter will advise on the base salary range and benefits for your specific location.

EA has listed the base salary ranges it in good faith expects to pay applicants for this role in the locations listed, as of the time of this posting. Salary offered will be determined based on numerous relevant business and candidate factors including, for example, education, qualifications, certifications, experience, skills, geographic location, and business or organizational needs.

BASE SALARY RANGES


British Columbia (depending on location e.g. Vancouver vs. Victoria):


¬∫ $115,100 - $161,200 CAN Annually

Base salary is just one part of the overall compensation at EA. We also offer a package of benefits including vacation (3 weeks per year to start), 10 days per year of sick time, paid top-up to EI/QPIP benefits up to 100% of base salary when you welcome a new child (12 weeks for maternity, and 4 weeks for parental/adoption leave), extended health/dental/vision coverage, life insurance, disability insurance, retirement plan to regular full-time employees. Certain roles may also be eligible for bonus and equity. "

Title: Business Intelligence Data Specialist
Description:
Working at Trail Appliances means joining an entrepreneurial-minded, driven team dedicated to delivering an exceptional customer experience. Trail Appliances is the leading independent appliance retailer in Western Canada. We‚Äôre a fast-growing company with over 500 employees in British Columbia, spread out over 10 showrooms, 3 Outlet Centres, and 4 offices in the Lower Mainland. Join our team of trailblazers!




Our core values:

Integrity ‚Äì We do what‚Äôs right, even when no one is looking.

Improvement ‚Äì We do it well. Then we do it better.

Caring ‚Äì We put ourselves in others‚Äô shoes.

Authenticity ‚Äì We like people, not pretense.

Determination ‚Äì We kick down walls.




Reporting to the Senior Manager of Software Development, the Data Engineer will be instrumental in designing, managing and supporting operationally the data and reporting landscape for the business. The position will be a very strategic role leveraging the candidate‚Äôs experience in data modelling, data warehousing and report model creation to help shape the next generation of business intelligence and report offerings for the business as we move towards a new to be architecture leveraging the latest technologies in the space. The position will be joining at an exciting time as the business has embarked on a digital transformation journey moving its operation to the cloud and new technologies.




As a BI Data Specialist, you will

Have ownership and governance of the business intelligence and reporting platform offerings for the business.
Provide insight into reporting platform usage and metrics
Support migration of the existing data warehouse and related critical reporting to a new future state data warehousing platform and data structure.
Enforce data cleanliness and consistency and be the gatekeeper for data quality in the bi platform.
Create data dictionaries to support the reporting platform
Identify opportunities that can improve efficiency of business processes
Troubleshoot technical issues and identify modifications needed in existing reporting applications to meet changing user requirements.




To be successful in this role, you have

Minimum of 8 years‚Äô practical experience.
Post-secondary degree in computer science or related field or a combination of related experience and education.
Strong general technical experience with relational databases, data modelling and data warehousing principles.
Expertise in the Microsoft SQL Server stack ‚Äì TSQL, SSIS, SSRS and SSAS
Expertise in Microsoft Power BI
Strong working experience with data migration, data cleansing, validation and de-duplication.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Experience in the development and implementation of standards, procedures and guidelines to support operational processes.
Self-motivation and the ability to prioritize, meet deadlines, and manage changing priorities.
Proven ability to be flexible and work hard, both independently and in a team environment
Willingness to work occasionally outside of normal business hours.
Willingness to learn
Excellent English oral and written communication skills.
A results-oriented individual who thrives working in a fast-paced environment.




The experience we like to see

Practical experience with cloud computing (Azure preferred)
Practical experience with Microsoft D365
Practical experience with Azure DevOps
Working knowledge of CI/CD and associated pipelines
Working knowledge of GIT
Practical experience with Azure Data Warehouse
Practical experience with Microsoft Fabric including Synapse Data Warehouse and Data Factory
Practical experience with CRM




Why Join Trail?

Extended Health Benefits
Merit Performance
Generous employee discounts
Gym membership discount
Professional Development Programs
Employee Recognition Program
Company events
Paid Volunteer




We inspire possibilities, make shopping ridiculously easy, and help create special moments at home. Are you ready to meet your team?

Title: Data and Reporting Analyst
Description:
Interested in a career at Langara College?




Our employees exemplify Langara's values of excellence, collegiality, innovation and integrity. If you think this position fits your qualifications, we encourage you to apply!




Langara College is located in Vancouver, B.C.: applicants to postings must be located in BC or willing to move to BC to accept work with Langara College. Exceptions to this will be clearly outlined in the event Langara College requires work (or positions to be based) to be performed outside BC or Canada.




Job Title:

Data and Reporting Analyst




Employee Group:

CUPE




Start Date:

Monday, September 23 2024




Job Description:

The Data and Reporting Analyst is responsible for working with the IR team, and other College units to develop analytics and business intelligence reports, dashboards and metrics to support evidence-based decision making at the College. Primary responsibility of the position: develops, implements and delivers BI dashboards, reports and analytics that address issues, requests and business requirements, and manages the Central Data Warehouse (CDW) and BI enterprise tool. As one of the IR team members, the Business Intelligence Analyst extracts data from the College‚Äôs information systems, administers and responds to security and access issues related to BI deliverables, conducts and coordinates quality assurance testing for all metrics and BI deliverables, maintains issue tracking and resolution log and provides end user support and training related to BI, and works closely with the IR team to find the most efficient and expedient way to respond to ad hoc data and information requests and analyses.




Minimum Requirements:




Education& Experience

Bachelor‚Äôs degree in computing science or equivalent information technology discipline.
Four (4) years of recent related experience in business analysis, data warehousing, and the implementation of Business Intelligence tools and analytical applications.
Additional industry training in programming languages and software development techniques (e.g. Java, SQL, Oracle, design methodology, project management) preferred.
Direct work experience in post-secondary education data analysis would be preferred.
Ellucian Banner experience an asset.
Workday experience an asset
An equivalent combination of education and experience may be considered.
Demonstrated knowledge of development languages such as Oracle SQL/PLSQL, JSP, C++, PHP, HTML and JavaScript.
Hands on experience with data visualization tools and BI platforms such as Tableau (preferred), PowerBI Information Builders, Qlik View, etc. and data warehouse technologies.
Demonstrated knowledge in relational database programming
Demonstrated knowledge of modern systems analysis, programming, testing, and software implementation techniques, procedures, and methodologies.
Advanced knowledge in software development in a Windows environment.
Working knowledge of data analysis, data mining, data governance, data warehousing and analytics; best practices on metadata development, retention and storage; relational and dimensional modelling techniques.




Skills & Abilities

Effective communication skills, verbally and written, in English.
Ability to produce clear, concise, and easy to read design and specifications documentation.
Ability to develop efficient, optimized, sustainable, well documented code.
Ability to apply project management fundamentals to leading projects and programs.
Be able to think and work cross functionally.
Be able to prepare executive level reports and presentations as needed for communication purposes.
Provide advice and support to users on the use and operation of application systems.
Organize and manage time to meet deadlines.
Effectively contribute to the overall improvement of department services and operations, team spirit, and morale.
Work both independently and as a member of a committee or team.
Work harmoniously with others.
Aptitude to learn new languages, methodologies, tools and technologies for software applications and programming.
Perform duties to meet established policies, practices and standards.




Our Benefits:

At Langara College, we align with the College‚Äôs vision on wellness and personal/professional development opportunities for all employed members. We‚Äôre committed to providing a competitive and inclusive benefits package that reflects our dedication to overall health, financial security, and work-life balance.

In this position, you would have access to:

extensive medical, dental, and vision coverage.
12 days per calendar year. After one year of employment, you would be eligible to 17 days of vacation per calendar year. Additionally, you would have an additional paid week off during college closure during winter holiday break.
Enrollment to the municipal pension plan.
Eligibility to enroll in training and development programs offered through the College.




To obtain the full job description, please contact our recruitment team.




Salary Range:

$36.32 - $41.79 per hour




Scheduled Weekly Hours:

35

Hours may vary according to the needs of the department.




Compressed Workweek (Fortnight):

Yes




People and Culture is committed to embracing, honoring, and promoting diversity, equity, and inclusion in our workplace. We remain dedicated to focusing our efforts on creating an inclusive employee community that fosters a sense of safety and belonging for everyone. We humbly acknowledge that we are just beginning our journey, which includes engaging in our own internal learning and creating a data-driven action plan that supports the integration of EDI practice into the work of People and Culture and the work we do with employees and leaders. Langara College welcomes applications from everyone including people from groups that are experiencing inequity including, but not limited to, Indigenous people, racialized people, people with disabilities, and members of the 2SLGBTQIA+ community. If there are any barriers that you are experiencing or an accommodation that we can provide to support you through the application process, please contact us.




Shortlisted candidates will be required to provide proof of educational and professional credentials noted on their resume. In addition, those shortlisted with international credentials must have their education credentials evaluated through WES (World Education Services) and provide Langara College, People & Culture document evaluation access for employment purposes.

We thank you for taking the time to complete an application. Only complete applications will be reviewed.

Langara is committed to enhancing our diverse workforce.

  • Additional industry training in programming languages and software development techniques (e.g. Java, SQL, Oracle, design methodology, project management) preferred.
  • Direct work experience in post-secondary education data analysis would be preferred.
  • Ellucian Banner experience an asset.
  • Workday experience an asset
  • An equivalent combination of education and experience may be considered.
  • Demonstrated knowledge of development languages such as Oracle SQL/PLSQL, JSP, C++, PHP, HTML and JavaScript.
  • Hands on experience with data visualization tools and BI platforms such as Tableau (preferred), PowerBI Information Builders, Qlik View, etc. and data warehouse technologies.
  • Demonstrated knowledge in relational database programming
  • Demonstrated knowledge of modern systems analysis, programming, testing, and software implementation techniques, procedures, and methodologies.
  • Advanced knowledge in software development in a Windows environment.
  • Working knowledge of data analysis, data mining, data governance, data warehousing and analytics; best practices on metadata development, retention and storage; relational and dimensional modelling techniques.


Skills & Abilities

  • Effective communication skills, verbally and written, in English.
  • Ability to produce clear, concise, and easy to read design and specifications documentation.
  • Ability to develop efficient, optimized, sustainable, well documented code.
  • Ability to apply project management fundamentals to leading projects and programs.
  • Be able to think and work cross functionally.
  • Be able to prepare executive level reports and presentations as needed for communication purposes.
  • Provide advice and support to users on the use and operation of application systems.
  • Organize and manage time to meet deadlines.
  • Effectively contribute to the overall improvement of department services and operations, team spirit, and morale.
  • Work both independently and as a member of a committee or team.
  • Work harmoniously with others.
  • Aptitude to learn new languages, methodologies, tools and technologies for software applications and programming.
  • Perform duties to meet established policies, practices and standards.


Our Benefits:

At Langara College, we align with the College‚Äôs vision on wellness and personal/professional development opportunities for all employed members. We‚Äôre committed to providing a competitive and inclusive benefits package that reflects our dedication to overall health, financial security, and work-life balance.

In this position, you would have access to:

  • extensive medical, dental, and vision coverage.
  • 12 days per calendar year. After one year of employment, you would be eligible to 17 days of vacation per calendar year. Additionally, you would have an additional paid week off during college closure during winter holiday break.
  • Enrollment to the municipal pension plan.
  • Eligibility to enroll in training and development programs offered through the College.


To obtain the full job description, please contact our recruitment team.


Salary Range:

$36.32 - $41.79 per hour


Scheduled Weekly Hours:

35

Hours may vary according to the needs of the department.


Compressed Workweek (Fortnight):

Yes


People and Culture is committed to embracing, honoring, and promoting diversity, equity, and inclusion in our workplace. We remain dedicated to focusing our efforts on creating an inclusive employee community that fosters a sense of safety and belonging for everyone. We humbly acknowledge that we are just beginning our journey, which includes engaging in our own internal learning and creating a data-driven action plan that supports the integration of EDI practice into the work of People and Culture and the work we do with employees and leaders. Langara College welcomes applications from everyone including people from groups that are experiencing inequity including, but not limited to, Indigenous people, racialized people, people with disabilities, and members of the 2SLGBTQIA+ community. If there are any barriers that you are experiencing or an accommodation that we can provide to support you through the application process, please contact us.


Shortlisted candidates will be required to provide proof of educational and professional credentials noted on their resume. In addition, those shortlisted with international credentials must have their education credentials evaluated through WES (World Education Services) and provide Langara College, People & Culture document evaluation access for employment purposes.

We thank you for taking the time to complete an application. Only complete applications will be reviewed.

Langara is committed to enhancing our diverse workforce.

Title: Content Insights Analyst
Description:
About us

BitKernel is dedicated to innovation and creating new firms in the OTT industry. With a solid technological foundation, we specialize in Strategic Marketing Consulting, Big Data, and disruptive technologies such as Web 3.0. This role will serve as the function of one of our companies under the umbrella.




What Will Your Next Role Look Like?

As a Content Insight Analyst [Anime/K-Drama/Film], you will help with the continuous growth of the platform! We are looking for someone with a solid understanding and knowledge of the film industry, especially an avid consumer of anime and cultural trends in the Japanese community. In other words, an Anime Lover who is capable of expressing through the language of film and has a skillful writing ability.




Responsibilities

Tracking and studying popular and classic anime worldwide. Delve into and analyze globally popular and classic anime works, observing their popularity and influence in different markets.
Planning and improving database animation category field information. Enhance the database by improving the categorization and information fields for anime works, celebrities, lists, and reviews.
Reorganizing anime classification. Use multidimensional tags and lists to reorganize and categorize anime works, enhancing user experience and streamlining content retrieval.
Monitor core data regularly. Deeply analyzing data trends and user behaviour. Provide data reports on content operations and suggest efficient content distribution and management strategies based on analysis.
Output multi-dimensional viewing guidance and content recommendation strategies effectively.
Investigating overseas content and user preferences to provide suggestions for copyright procurement of content.




Qualifications

BA/BS degree or higher; majors in Theater & Film, Writing, Marketing, English, or related fields are preferred.
3+ years of working experience in the movie and TV industry or entertainment & media industry, with familiarity with content operations processes.
Proficient in English communication (speaking and writing). Fluency in English, Spanish, or Portuguese as a workplace language and excellent media writing skills in English, Spanish, or Portuguese (Japanese is a plus).
Extensive experience and knowledge of media (anime) industry trends, familiar with internet media services such as IMDb, Letterboxd, Rotten Tomatoes, Netflix, Amazon Prime, Crunchyroll, etc.
Rich viewing history of anime, with trackable records of marking 100+ entries on IMDb or Letterboxd, or equivalent.
Ability to present ideas openly and collaborate with team members from diverse backgrounds.




Perks & Benefits

Extended Health and Dental Benefits. Ensuring your well-being is always a priority for us.
Growth and Development Opportunities. A way to take your career to the next level with us! We will work through our Learning and Development Program to help you achieve your professional goal.
Engaging Team Building Activities. We believe in solid connections. Therefore, we have fostered a variety of events and internal clubs to help you become part of our culture.
Comfortable and Fun Office Environment. A well-equipped office with ergonomic furniture, snacks, and beverages to keep you energized throughout the day.
Friday Happy Hour. The perfect way to end the week on a high note with the team!




Your Next Big Opportunity Awaits!

In BitKernel, we appreciate every candidate and their time. Therefore, our Talent team will review each application and will get back to those who successfully match our needs. As a note, this position is based in Vancouver, BC, so we are only considering those based locally and eligible to work in Canada. We invite every qualified candidate to apply! If you don't have the qualifications needed but have the potential and education, we will leave a space for you to explain "Why" you could be the next Content Insight Analyst. We will try to reach out and see if there is a place for you here now or maybe in the future.




We are recognized as an equal-opportunity company and are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive workplace. Every qualified applicant will be considered for this position, regardless of their race, nationality, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status. Let's make this environment a place where everyone is recognized, feels valued, and is open to the full field of what they do best!
